loans.name: Anielka Nahima

texts.es:
Anielka es  madre de un hijo, casada, muy emprendedora, organizada. Para un bienestar familiar
Hoy en día cuenta con dos trabajos, el cual realiza en diferentes horarios. Trabaja como ejecutiva telefónica empresa privada y junto con su esposo están en un  grupo musical lo que viene a mejorar gran parte de los ingresos para los gastos básicos y personales.

Este es su segundo crédito en donde ampliara más el cuarto ya que tiene poco espacio y que es de gran relevancia. Pues Afodenic ha sido el que ha dado el apoyo financiero para lograr estas mejoras en su vivienda. En donde comprara materiales de construcción para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Anielka has a son, is married and is very entrepreneurial and organized. For the well-being of her family, she currently has two jobs that she works on different schedules.  She works as secretary at a private company and she is in a musical group with her husband.  This helps her to increase her income so that she can pay for her basic and personal expenses.

This is her second loan with Afodenic, which she will use to increase the size of a room in her home.  The room has very little space and is of great importance.  Afodenic has given her financial support to buy construction materials to make these improvements on her home.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to renovate a room in her home

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Graciela; ella tiene 56 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de celulares de todo marca y modelos y también cuenta con su negocio de radiocomunicación, de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar nuevos equipos de celulares para así poder implementar su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “QORI ORCCO” Communal Bank which is located in the district of Urcos, province of Quispicanchis, department of Cusco.Graciela is 56 years old. She is married and has 4 children.  

She alternates her daily activities between her cell phone sales business (she sells all brands and models) and her radio communication business.  This is how she manages to get her family ahead in life.

She is requesting the loan to buy new cellular equipment to run her business. She is happy to be receiving the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: New cellular equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de maíz para la elaboración de arepas

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 36 años y vive en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 2 años vende cosméticos y productos de lencería y los lleva a vender ofreciendo de casa en casa de sus amigos y familiares; dejando a crédito la mercadería vendida. Siempre mantiene el orden en sus cuentas de esa manera no descuida de la gente que debe pagarle. se ha fijado metas para el futuro ya que  su negocio le ha traído buenas ganancias, es por ello que desea tener más mercadería para abastecer su negocio, así podrá captar más clientes. Es su crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería.
texts.en: Cecilia is 36 years old and lives at home with her parents.  For more than two years, she has been selling cosmetics and lingerie.  She sells her products door-to-door offering them to her friends and family and leaving the goods sold on credit. She always keeps her accounts in order so that she doesn’t forget the customers who must pay her.  As her business has been profitable, she has set goals for the future. She wants to stock her business with more merchandise so she will be able to attract more customers.  This is her third loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and in addition, she is pleased to be a member of her communal bank because all of the members are people that she knows and they are responsible and very supportive.  She is grateful to all the people who will be managing her credit request as the loan will be very useful in advancing her business.  She will use the loan to purchase more merchandise.

loans.use: To buy more lingerie to stock her business.

loans.name: Mayra Sugey

texts.es:
Mayra de 31 años, es una joven trabajadora que un tiempo atrás ubico una pequeña peluquería y poco a poco ha incrementado su capital de trabajo.   

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral donde también tiene ubicado su salón de belleza el día 30 de septiembre cuando hubo la revuelta mas llamada como el día negro de Ecuador por malentendidos ente la política dictada y funcionarios concurrió a que ciudadanos aprovecharan la oportunidad que no había resguardo policial y comenzaron a saquear negocios de sectores marginales. Una de las afectadas fue Mayra a quien le robaron todos sus implementos de belleza y tuvo que iniciar con lo que le dejaron. En la actualidad tiene otra vez su local con sus herramientas de trabajo. 

Para seguir con su negocio ya que tiene muchas aspiraciones ella quiere comprar con el préstamo sillones y cosméticos para su salón de belleza. En la actualidad quiere tener su negocio más grande para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mayra is 31 years old.  She is a young worker who opened a small beauty salon some time ago and has gradually increased her working capital. She lives in the peri-urban area called Perimetral which is also the location of her beauty salon.

On September 30, there was a revolt, (best known as “The Black Day of Ecuador”) due to misunderstandings about policy issued.  While officials attended to that, citizens took advantage of the fact that there was no police protection, and seized the opportunity to loot businesses in marginal areas.  One of those affected was Mayra who was robbed of all of her beauty tools and had to start over with what they left.  

Today, she has her local and work tools once again.  She has many aspirations and in order to continue her business, she wants to use the loan to buy chairs and cosmetics for her beauty salon.  At the present time, she wants to enlarge her business to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: Chairs, cosmetics.

loans.name: Lizbeth Giovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MINKA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Lizbeth Giovana, La socia tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica  ala compra y venta de cerveza ella tiene un depósito en su casa y vente al por mayor y menor la cerveza, la socia dice que es increíble pero este negocio sale como pan caliente, lo que a ella le rinde es este, la socia tenía una tienda de abarrotes al inicio y era un tanto exclavizante manifiesta y vendía poco y lo que ganaba también era muy poco, entonces ella decidió abastecerse más de cerveza que de otros productos y fue así como dio un giro a su negocio, la socia ahora solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y con una parte cubrir todos los gastos de estas fiestas ya que desea comprarle una bicicleta a su hijo y dar regalos a sus parientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su mercadería y para dar obsequios en estas fiestas a su hijo y parientes.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “MINKA” Communal Bank which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. Ms. Lizbeth Giovana is 34 years old.  She is unmarried and has one son.  

Ms. Giovana buys and sells beer.  She has a storage area in her house and sells wholesale and retail beer.  She says that it is incredible but, in this business, the products go like hot cakes.  

She had a grocery store to start and was somewhat of a slave. She sold little and earned very little.  Then she decided to supply more beer than other products and this was how she gave a twist to her business.  

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise and will use the other portion to cover the expenses of the holidays as she wants to buy a bicycle for her son and give gifts to her relatives.  She is requesting this loan to invest in merchandise and to give gifts to her son and relatives for the holidays.

She is happy to receive the loan and agrees to make the payments according to the established terms.
.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to invest in merchandise and to give gifts to her son and relatives for the holidays.

loans.name: The Arab Women´s Bank Group

texts.en:
The Arab Women's Bank is made up of eight members who live in Pococí, Limón, located near the Carribbean coast of Costa Rica. These hardworking entrepreneurs are involved in various revenue-generating activities, including clothing sales, manicure/pedicure services, sewing/alteration services, and catalog sales. In general, this loan will be used by each individual member to make investments in her specific business activity. Vendors of catalog items will invest in merchandise such as clothing, DVDs, pots, pans, perfumes, and jewelry. Seamstresses will purchase fabric, thread, and needles in order to produce clothing for sale. Some members will use this loan to invest in nail polish and other tools necessary for providing manicure and pedicure services. The members of this group offer their products and services to clients in their immediate community as well as to people in neighboring communities. 

The loan consultant who has been working with these women describes them as a tight-knit group with much experience in their individual businesses and the mutual goal of attaining a higher standard of living within their communities and families. The name of this group comes from the Bible. To the members of the group, Arab refers to growth and expansion, both of which are central values for this group. 

Emma Q. Cevrato is a 35-year-old mother of four who lives with her family in Pococí. She is also the elected president of this group. Emma is involved in two types of business: sewing/alteration services and the sale of brand-name clothing. She says the secret to organizing her day in a productive manner is keeping to a schedule. She designates blocks of time to take care of domestic tasks and blocks of time to her business. When she is very busy, her children assist her by tending to the sales part of the business while their mother sews in her workshop. Emma's goals are to expand her business and grow her list of clients. Her dream is to own a business separate from her home. With respect to her family, the immediate goal is to establish economic stability. The main obstacle to her progress is a lack of working capital funds in order to invest in sewing materials such as thread, needles, and fabric, as well as clothing merchandise. 

The members of the Arab Women´s Bank are neighbours and friends who have lived in the same rural community for the majority of their lives. They identify the main advantage of the group lending model as the ability of each member, without collateral or credit, to act as a guarantor for other members, which enables each member to receive a loan. The main disadvantage they identified was the possibility that if somebody defaults in the group, or has trouble repaying their loan, this implies a responsibility to act in support by the other members of the group.

loans.use: For the purchase of clothing, sewing materials, and manicure products to support the members' individual businesses

loans.name: Bertha Elena

texts.es:
DesD. hace 20 años, Bertha Elena P. D. L. empezó desD. su casa a elaborar productos para distribuir en diferentes cafeterías del municipio D. Yarumal- Antioquia, después tuvo la oportunidad D. adquirir una cafetería en uno D. los colegios del municipio, desD. entonces se ha dedicado a esta actividad en la que labora largas jornadas para atender las necesidades del establecimiento. 

En temporada D. vacaciones Bertha Elena tiene gran dificultad puesto que no hay flujo D. personal en la cafetería del colegio, lo que la obliga a realizar productos para distribuir en otras cafeterías del municipio y así cubrir sus gastos familiares ya que es separada. 

Mejorar su cafetería realizando remodelaciones locativas, adquiriendo vitrinas y mejorando las existentes, así como comprar más surtido para iniciar la temporada escolar son las necesidades actuales D. esta emprendedora quien necesita del apoyo económico. 

En el futuro, Bertha, espera tener otras cafeterías con el fin D. generar más empleo y mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Twenty years ago Bertha Elena P. D. L. started making products at home to distribute among various coffee shops in the town of Yarumal, Antioquia.  She then got the opportunity to acquire a coffee shop in one of the municipal schools.  Since then she has been working long hours at this activity to meet the needs of the establishment.

During school vacation time Bertha Elena faces great difficulty because no one comes by the school cafeteria which forces her to make products to distribute to other coffee shops in the city in order to meet family expenses because she’s separated.

This entrepreneur needs financial help to do some remodeling of the locale acquiring display cases and improving the existing ones as well as buying more stock items to be ready to start the new school term.

In the future, Bertha hopes to have additional cafeterias with the intention of generating employment and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: To remodel the site and buy more stock for her coffee shop.

loans.name: Ymelda Monica

texts.es: La Sra. Ymelda Monica R. D. de 36 años de edad vive en el caserio de lujaraja junto a su hija. Tiene casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza hace 2 años y ademas presenta un ingreso adicional por las personas que capta. La Sra. Ymelda requiere el crédito para incrementar su negocio. Su sueño segun nos comenta es poder tener su propio negocio y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. La Sra. Ymelda está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Ms. Ymelda Monica R. D. is 36 years old.  She lives with her daughter in the hamlet of Lujaraja and owns her home.  She has been selling beauty products for 2 years and her business also provides additional income for the sales people she recruits. Ms. Ymelda is requesting the loan to expand her business.  Her dream, as she told us, is to own her own business so that she may have a better quality of life.  She is very grateful for the support we can offer her through this financing.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Edelvina

texts.es: Edelvina tiene 36 años, vive con su  esposo y sus 4 hijos en casa de su suegra. Hace más de 13 años junto con su esposo realizan 2 actividades que son esenciales para la economía de su hogar; en donde fabrican guitarras hechas artesanalmente, asimismo ofrece  el servicio de espectáculos donde ella misma es la vocalista y deleita a su publico con su bella voz. Este trabajo lo realiza todos los fines de semana, y ahora más que se encuentra en temporada de fiestas navideñas tendrá más espectáculos. El sueño de Edelvina es tener mayor popularidad en su zona para que los contratos que perciba aumenten. Es el crédito número 2 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de micrófonos y nueva vestimenta.
texts.en: Edelvina is 36 years old, she lives with her husband and their 4 chldren in her mother-in-law's home. More than 13 years ago with her husband they set up 2 businesses which are essential for the finances in their household; they make handmade guitars, and they also perform shows where she is the vocalist and she delights the public with her beautiful voice. They do this work every weekend, and now as they in the Nativity season they will have more shows. Edelvina's dream is to gain more popularity in her area so that the contracts that they receive will grow. This is loan number 2 with MFP, she is very happy to know that she has financial support, in addition she is grateful to be part of her communal bank because all their members are people that she knows, responsible and very supportive. She is grateful to all the peope who will be providing the loan that she is requesting as it will be very useful in progressing their business activities. With the loan requested, she will use it to buy microphones and new clothing.

loans.use: To buy microphones and new clothing for her musical shows.

loans.name: Rolando Albeiro

texts.es:
Después de graduarse como Técnico en Mecatrónica, Rolando Albeiro P. H., decidió ser independiente, situación que le ha permitido convertirse en microempresario en el municipio de Yarumal-Antioquia, donde repara todo tipo de aparatos electrónicos con la limitante de que los repuestos debe llevarlos desde Medellín- Antioquia, lo que le dificulta ser oportuno en la entrega de sus trabajos. 

Rolando espera mejorar sus servicios y mantenerse en el mercado, necesita del apoyo económico para comprar algunos repuestos necesarios para reparar televisores y equipos de sonido, así como herramienta mecánica que le permitirá reparar mucho mejor los artefactos. 

Si Rolando obtiene dicho apoyo logrará ser más oportuno en la entrega, aumentarán sus clientes y en esa medida sus ingresos, para continuar ofreciéndole a su familia el sustento diario, pues actualmente está casado y tiene 2 hijos.
texts.en:
When he graduated as a Mechatronics Technician, Rolando Albeiro P. H. decided to be independent, a situation that has allowed him to become a micro businessman in the town of Yarumal, Antioquia, where he repairs all kinds of electronic devices.  He’s limited by the fact, however, that he has to get his replacement parts in Medellín, Antioquia, which creates difficulty for him to deliver his jobs on time.

Rolando hopes to improve his services and stay in the marketplace.  He needs financial help to buy some needed replacement parts to repair television sets and sound equipment as well as technical equipment that will make it possible for him to repair the devices much better.

If Rolando gets the help he will be able to finish jobs on time, his clientele will grow and, by the same token, so will his income and he will be able to continue to provide daily support to his family since he’s married and has two children.

loans.use: To buy television set replacement parts and mechanical tools.

loans.name: Irma Eloisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia D. Quispicanchis  y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Irma; ella tiene 54 años D. edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio D. venta D. madera la socia tiene su negocio D. carpintería el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia a la vez trabaja como empleada D. hogar por las mañanas y D. esta manera saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar toretes para su chacra y para comprar algunos productos para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Irma belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urcos district, which belongs to the Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

Irma is 54 years old, married, and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling wood.  She has a carpentry business, and she and her husband work together in the business. She also works as a household employee in the mornings.  That is the way she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy young bulls for her farm.  She will also buy some products for her house.

Irma is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy young bulls for her farm and to buy some products for her house

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica S. K. is forty years old. She is married and has four children aged between twenty four years old and eleven years old. Her business is located at Kithyoko in the Thika region. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. Vernoica has a salon which has been providing hair and beauty services to the local women. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. Veronica would use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more hair weaves and chemicals to grow her business. In future, she hopes to open a modern salon with excellent equipment and more employees to give good service to the customers. She also hopes to give her children good education to the university level. Veronica describes herself as creative, social and patient.

loans.use: Hair relaxers, treatment and hair additions

loans.name: Pacifica Dolores

texts.es:
Pacifica de 44 años, vende ropa desde hace años para poder ayudar con los gastos de su casa ya que no está casada y tiene dos hijos de  18 y 17 años. Pero por enfermedad tuvo que cerrar su pequeño negocio.  

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral está trabajando actualmente en su negocio que lo había cerrado por enfermedad pero por insistencia de sus vecinas abrió el local. Realiza su trabajo sola desde muy temprano, vende blusas a $ 8.00, camisas $ 12.00 y pantalones a $ 15.00 etc. 

Ella quiere el préstamo para poder comprar ropa (blusas, camisetas, pantalones). En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y poder readecuarla para darles un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pacifica, age 44, has been selling clothes for many years to help cover the household expenses, becuase she is not married and has two children, aged 18 and 17 years old. Due to illness, however, she has had to close her small business. 

Living in a semi-urban area called Perimetral, she is working in her business at the moment, because although she closed it due to illness, she has re-opened the shop at the request of her neighbours. She works alone, from very early in the morning, selling blouses at $8, shirts at $12, pants at $15, etc.

She wants the loan to be able to buy clothes (blouses, tops, pants). In the future she wants to finish building her house and be able to earn enough to give her children a good future.

loans.use: Clothes

loans.name: Jorge Eliécer

texts.es:
Jorge Eliecer C. es un hombre que desde muy niño padeció las consecuencias del maltrato familiar, lo cual lo llevó a irse de su casa cuando tan solo tenía 12 años.  La calle le enseñó que para ganarse el pan de cada día debía trabajar duro y ser muy creativo para lograr la generación de sus propios ingresos.
Fue así como desde muy joven se inició como comerciante vendiendo diferentes artículos, hasta cuando un amigo le propuso vender gafas y se enfocó en esta actividad.  Para vender su producto se estableció en un punto estratégico de la ciudad de Medellín y hoy, después de 20 años dedicado a esta actividad, ha logrado sacar a su hijo adelante gracias a la venta de gafas y otros productos que comercializa de acuerdo a las preferencias de la temporada.
El sueño de Jorge Eliecer es incrementar sus ventas y así seguir apoyando a su hijo, a quien ha sacado adelante solo puesto que su compañera los abandonó.  Para lograrlo necesita un crédito que destinará para la compra de mercancía y de un exhibidor para ubicar su producto.
texts.en:
Jorge Eliecer C. is a man who suffered from family abuse as a child.  This led him to leave home when he was only 12 years old.  Life on the street taught him to earn his daily bread since he had to work hard and be very creative to earn his own income.

This is how he started from a very young age to be a merchant selling a variety of items until a friend suggested selling eyeglasses and he focused on this activity.  To sell his products he set himself up at a strategic point in the city of Medellín and today, after 20 years in this occupation, he has managed to successfully raise his son thanks to the sale of eyeglasses and other products that he sells according to the season.

Jorge Eliecer’s dream is to increase sales to be able to continue to support his son who he is raising alone because his partner left him.  To reach this he needs a loan that he’ll use to buy merchandise and a means of displaying it.

loans.use: To buy eyeglasses to better stock his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 49 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años decidió emprender su propio negocio, vendiendo productos de primera necesidad en un espacio que disponía en su casa. Desde entonces brinda una atención cálida y amable a sus clientes que consumen los productos que ella vende. Todos los días los dedica a su negocio y hasta los fines de semana, en ocasiones recibe el apoyo de sus hijos. Hoy espera aumentar sus ganancias, debido a que se encuentra en temporada navideña por lo que habrá más afluencia de gente que irá a su establecimiento, por tanto espera comprar más mercadería para abastecer su negocio. Es el crédito número 8 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo utilizará en la compra de más productos.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 49 years old. She lives with her two children in a home that she owns. Five years ago, she decided to start her own business, and using some available space she had in the house, she set up a shop to sell basic staple products. Since then she has been bringing warm and friendly customer service to clients who purchase from her. She works in her shop every day, including weekends; sometimes her children help her out as well. Currently, Elizabeth is hoping to increase her earnings because of the upcoming Christmas season, when she'll have a larger influx of customers; therefore, she would like to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to supply her store. This is Elizabeth's eighth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support. In addition, Elizabeth likes being a part of her communal bank because all of its members are people that she knows - people who are responsible and committed to the group. Elizabeth is grateful to all the individuals who will make this loan possible since it will be very helpful to her in advancing her business. She will use the loan to buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to supply her store

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta K. M. is forty-seven years old, single and has eight children aged between thirty years and five years old. Her business is located at Kithyoko and is served by Thika branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples.

She has been selling such items as detergents, soft drinks, tea leaves, sugar and others for the last year to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in future. She also hopes to start a grocery store from which she will make more income. She describes herself as ambitious, caring, peaceful, and responsible.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves, sugar, flour, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Yony

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yony; ella tiene 31 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de elaboración de pan para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes y venderlo a las personas que le solicitan de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante   

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar toretes para su chacra y para comprar algunos productos para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Yony belongs to the Qori Orcco Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urcos district, which belongs to the Quispicanchis province, Cusco department.

Yony is 31 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of making bread.  She then distributes it to her customers and sells it to people who order it.  That is the way she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to buy young bulls for her farm.  She will also buy some products for her house.

Yony is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy young bulls for her farm and to buy some products for her house

loans.name: Corazon De Ayala Group

texts.es: La señors Sarahi M. es casada, tiene dos hijos y lleva 14 años dedicandose a ventas, en esta ocasión desea iniciar un negocio de renta de tablones y sillas para eventos y así poder tener más ingresos para solventar gastos de la educación de sus hijos teniendo este nuevo negocio. Cuenta con un buen historial crediticio aunque en credicomun está por cumplir un año sin embargo comenta que se siente muy a gusto con la institución, ya que se siente reconocida al recibir los incentivos por ser puntual tanto ella como el resto del grupo, espera seguir mucho tiempo con la empresa pues está conciente de que es una buena oportunidad para incrementar su negocio. La señora Reynalda C. es la señora de sudadera rosa que se ve en el extremo izquierdo de la foto, salio un poco cortada, pero sí se alcanza a ver su rostro.
texts.en:
Sarahi M. is married, has two children, and has dedicated herself to sales for 14 years.  She currently would like to start a business renting tables and chairs for events and in this way increase her income to pay for the educational expenses of her children.  She has a good credit history but has only been a member of CrediComun for less than a year.  She is well-liked by the institution and she, like the others in the group, has received incentives to be punctual in her payments.  She would like to be a long-term member of the group as she knows that it is a good resource to help her grow her business.

Reynalda C. is the woman in the pink sweatshirt that you can see in the extreme left of the photo.  She is slightly cut out of the photo, but you can see her face.

loans.use: To buy tables and seats to rent

loans.name: Yukuyoo Group

texts.es:
El grupo D. crédito “Yukuyoo” se localiza en L. comunidad D. San L. Oaxaca a 40 minutos al norte D. Pinotepa nacional, el nombre del grupo se le da en L. lengua mixteca, que significa cerro D. bejucos (lianas), L. mayor parte D. L. población es D. raza indígena y se dedican al trabajo del campo, en el caso D. las mujeres al bordado y textiles artesanales, L. mujer que representa al grupo  se llama Flora M. C., pero no haremos mucha alusión acerca D. elL., ya que en esta narración hablaremos D. Herminia Nicolás M., es una mujer D. 35 años D. edad, casada con el señor Graciano D. 42 años, D. oficio campesino. Ellos tienen 4 hijos que son Guadalupe D. 18 años, Claudia D. 16, Álvaro D. 15 y Azucena D. 13 años D. edad, solo los últimos tres hermanos estudian, ya que L. mayor trabaja para ayudarles en los gastos escolares. Herminia se dedica a L. elaboración D. textiles en técnica artesanal, mismos que son muy laboriosos pero poco remunerados, elL. desD. temprana edad aprendió este oficio que es una D. las formas D. ayudar a mitigar parte D. las necesidades que tiene su familia, las artesanías que elL. elabora las hace desD. su casa como es D. costumbre y se utilizan materiales rústicos elaborados D. forma tradicional, es muy común encontrar a mujeres artesanas en esta zona ya que ellas aparte D. vender sus creaciones las utilizan para el uso personal D. vestimenta e indumentaria.
Herminia es miembro del grupo D. crédito organizado cerca D. su casa y elL. solicitó los recursos para L. compra D. materiales que utiliza en L. elaboración D. las artesanías con ese dinero elL. pudo comprar hilos D. algodón en color blanco, azul, verD., rojo , naranja , morado, así como madejas D. algodón que utilizan en L. elaboración D. textiles hilo torcido, estambre D. hilo tipo cristal y el tradicional hilo D. color café que es elaborado con algodón color café D. forma manual y artesanal en esta región, mandó a renovar algunas piezas D. su instrumento utilizada para el hilado D. textiles, mismo que utiliza para elaborar servilletas, manteles, huipiles, y telares para faldones. En esta temporada decembrina Herminia esta elaborando algunos pedidos que le encargaron con anticipación mismos que serán unos detalles para recuerdos D. bodas. 
Los grandes sueños que tiene Herminia es que sus hijos crezcan en un ambiente D. poca necesidad y lo único que piD. es tener buena salud para poder seguir adelante en L. lucha D. un mejor mañana, le gustaría tener una mejor vivienda con piso firme y un poco mas reforzada para aguantar los embates D. L. naturaleza en épocas D. lluvia.
Yukuyoo es un grupo D. mujeres trabajadoras, ellas se ayudan entre si y siempre hay en ellas L. confianza necesaria para que su grupo y sus integrantes sean puntuales en sus pagos.
Lo único que podemos agregar es un gesto D. agradecimiento por parte D. este grupo hacia los que representan esta industria D. sueños gracias a los que apoyan a kiva, a fundación realidad y L. gente que se entrega todos los días por hacer posible los proyectos D. muchos.
Las mujeres que integran el grupo “yukuyoo” se enlistan a continuación, así como las actividades que realizan.

Flora M. C.. – Cocina económica
Analidia Chávez D. L. C..- Bordado Artesanal
Gregoria Nicolás Baños.- Venta D. dulces
Andrea L. M..- Bordado Artesanal
Leticia M. Guzmán.- Venta D. pollos
Herminia Nicolás M..- Bordado Artesanal
Rosa P. Hernández.- Bordado Artesanal
Tomasa B. M..- Bordado Artesanal
Oliva Vásquez H..- Venta D. antojitos
Herlinda L. B..- Bordado Artesanal
texts.en:
The “Yukuyoo” loan group is located in the community of San L. Oaxaca, 40 minutes to the north of Pinotepa nacional. The name of the group is in the language of Mixteca and means ‘hill of lianas’ (a kind of vine). The majority of the population is indigenous and works in the fields and, in the case of the women, makes embroidery and artisanal textiles. The woman that represents the group is Flora M. C., but we will not talk about her much, since this story is focused on Herminia Nicolás M., a 35-year-old woman married to 42-year-old Gracian, an agricultural worker. They have four children: Guadalupe (18), Claudia (16), Álvaro (15) and Azucena (13). Only the last three study, since the eldest works to help them pay for school expenses.   Herminia works in the elaboration of textiles in the traditional style, which is very laborious, but poorly remunerated.  She learned this traD. from a very young age as one of the ways to help alleviate the needs of her family. She makes her craftwork in her home, as is the custom, and uses coarse materials maD. in the traditional way.  It is very common to find artisanal women in this zone since, apart from selling their creations, the women also wear them.

Herminia is a member of the loan group organized near her house, and she sought the resources to buy the materials that she will use to make her embroidery. With this money, she was able to buy cotton thread in the colors of white, blue, green, red, orange and purple as well as cotton skeins that they use to make textiles, crystal worsted yarn and the traditional brown thread that is maD. artisanally in this region by hand with brown colored cotton. She also sent to be renovated some of her instruments’ parts that she uses for the weaving of textiles and also to make napkins, tablecloths, huipiles (traditional embroidered dresses), and textiles for christening robes. In this December season, Herminia is filling some orders that were maD. ahead of time that will be for wedding souvenirs. 

The big dream that Herminia has is that her children grow up in an environment without a lot of need, and the only thing that she asks is to have good health in order to be able to continue ahead in the fight for a better tomorrow. She would like to have a better house that has a solid floor and is a little stronger so as to be able to withstand the ravages of nature in the periods of rain. 

Yukuyoo is a group of working women. They help one another and always have the necessary trust so that the group and its members are punctual with their payments. The only thing we can add is a gesture of thanks on behalf of this group to those that represent this industry of dreams. Thanks to those that support Kiva, to Fundación Realidad and to the people that dedicate themselves ever day to making possible the projects of many. The women that make up the “Yukuyoo” group are listed below, as well as the activities they carry out.  

Flora M. C.. – Inexpensive, home-cooking eatery
Analidia Chávez D. L. C..- Artisanal embroidery
Gregoria Nicolás Baños.- Sweets sales
Andrea L. M..- Artisanal embroidery
Leticia M. Guzmán.- Chicken sales
Herminia Nicolás M..- Artisanal embroidery
Rosa P. Hernández.- Artisanal embroidery
Tomasa B. M..- Artisanal embroidery
Oliva Vásquez H..- “Antojitos” (traditional Mexican food/snacks) sales
Herlinda L. B..- Artisanal embroidery

loans.use:
The loan will be used to buy cotton thread in the colors of red, blue, wine, green, yellow and purple, as well as to buy
cotton thread used to make artisenal textiles using tradtional waist looms, with which napkins and tablecloths are made.

loans.name: La Cosecha 2 Group

texts.en:
Delsa is a member of “La Cosecha 2” (The Harvest), a group which is located in Los Alcarrizos in the north of the city of Santo Domingo. It is a very industrialized place with a large population which depends on the businesses and economy of the main city. As in many other cities, there is a scarcity of potable water and electricity, and a population of Dominicans and Haitian emigrants. Delsa works selling medicine in a small drugstore and oil for motor vehicles in a stall. Both are located in her house.

Delsa is a married woman with 3 children. She devotes her time to raising her children while she works and attends to all her family needs. She would like to have a wholesale store, being able to provide a better life to her family and to give opportunity to others.

Delsa is very excited to be receiving her 4th loan from Esperanza Internacional after having satisfactorily repaid her previous loans and having taken a step further in growing her business. She has had her business 6 years. She is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of medicine for her drugstore and lubricants for motor vehicles. She is planning to use her profits to invest in her business, thereby enabling herself to have more and better merchandise. Her dream is to be able to build a second floor on her house.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her drugstore and lubricants for motor vehicles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This member requests a loan to be able to buy livestock which she will then sell to her customers.

loans.name: Comerciantes De Ñuu Savi Group

texts.es:
El nombre que se le da al siguiente grupo es “Comerciante de Ñuu Savi” se ubica en la comunidad de San Juan Jicayan Oaxaca, el nombre de la agrupación se le da en idioma mixteco y significa “pueblo de la lluvia”,  el grupo esta integrado por un total de 11 personas 10 mujeres y 1 hombre, todos los integrantes pertenecen a la comunidad indígena de "la mixteca baja de la costa chica Oaxaqueña". El nombre de la representante del grupo es Alicia González Barragán, en esta ocasión nos referiremos a una miembro  del grupo ella es, Reyna Q. Hernández , tiene de 32 años de edad, casada con Braulio  de 40 años. 
Reyna  tiene 4 hijos que son: Braulio de 15 años, Araceli de 13, Artemio de 9 y Jesús de 2 años de edad. Reyna se dedica a elaborar textiles, mediante una técnica conocida como de telar de cintura, con la cual obtiene naguas, servilletas, manteles, y telares para huipiles, la técnica es única tanto en la producción de hilos así como en el titado de los mismos, ya que datan desde épocas prehispánicas hasta nuestros días, estos productos se venden en la región de la costa y son muy apreciados por turistas extranjeros y nacionales, en la mayoría de los casos las naguas son para uso propio de los indígenas y los huipiles de igual forma, las servilletas son para envolver la tortillas de maíz y los manteles para adornar la mesa.
La necesidad es una de las causas mas grandes que permiten la elaboración de estos productos, la pobreza en la que viven y la escasez de trabajos bien pagados, Reyna desde muy pequeña se dedica  elaborar estas preciadas artesanías, y en ocasiones le va mal, pero no es motivo de baja en sus proyectos, ella se integro a este grupo  de crédito, por la necesidad de recursos necesarios para la elaboración de sus tejidos, los materiales necesarios para esta producción en su mayoría se elaboran en técnicas un poco costosas, tales como el tintado del hilo de caracol púrpura, ella hizo uso del recurso para la adquisición de hilos de algodón torcido en variados colores como son: blanco, azul, verde, rojo , naranja , morado, madejas de algodón blanco que utilizan en la elaboración de textiles, mismos que se obtienen mediante la técnica de hilado a mano con malacate de madera, hilo vela en color blanco que funciona de base en los telares a fabricar estambre de hilo tipo cristal y el tradicional hilo de algodón denominado hilo de algodón cuyuchi. Reyna  lleva muchos años en este oficio y los esta enseñando a sus hijas para que el día de mañana ellas tengan la cualidad de crear arte, así se preserva este valioso legado. 
Lo que quiere Reyna es que le sigan apoyando en la facilitación de recursos para su trabajo,  ella quisiera que sus niños se preparen, que el trabajo y la salud no le falte a ella y que su producción no disminuya, que aumente más la demanda y la promoción de sus creaciones.
“Comerciantes de Ñuu Savi”. Es una agrupación de gran compromiso con sus integrantes y a nombre de sus miembros Reyna les desea felices fiestas y les manda un abrazo  los que apoyan  a la gran familia de kiva en todo el mundo, y gracias a Fundacion realidad por confiar en ellos.
Estos son los nombres de sus integrantes y sus actividades de trabajo

Carmelita D. González. – Venta de pollos
Marcelina C..- Venta de antojitos
Flora D. C..- Venta de antojitos
Reyna Q. Hernández.- Bordado Artesanal
Clementina D. D..-Venta de carne
Alicia González Barragán.- Venta de ropa
Cresencia M. D..- Elaboración y venta de pan
Celia García T..- Venta de refrescos
Victorina C. Hernández.- Elaboración y venta de pan
Isidora Hernández López.- Tienda de abarrotes
Pablo S. C..- Venta de carne
texts.en:
The name of this next group is  “Comerciante de Ñuu Savi”. It is located in the San Juan Jucayan Oaxaca community. The group's name is in mixed languages and means "people of the rain". The group is made up of a total of 11 people: 10 women and 1 man. All of the members belong to the "la mixteca baja de la costa chica Oaxaqueña" Indigenous community. The group's representative is Alicia González Barragán, and this time we will be talking about a group member whose name is Reyna Q. Hernández. She is 32 and married to Braulio, age 40. Reyna has 4 children: Braulio, age 15;  Araceli, age 13; Artemio, age 9; and Jesús, age 2. Reyna makes textiles using a technique known as a belt loom. With this, she makes petticoats, napkins, tablecloths and textiles for huipiles [Maya tunics or blouses]. The technique is unique, in the production of threads and in their usage. This technique dates from prehispanic times to the present day. They sell these products in the coastal region, and they are very well-received by foreign tourists and nationals. In the majority of cases, the petticoats and huipiles are for the personal use of the indigenous people, and the napkins are used to wrap the corn tortillas. The tablecloths are to decorate tables. The main reason that they make these products is necessity; the poverty in which they live and the shortage of well-paid workers. Reyna has been making these prized handcrafts from a very young age. Sometimes things go badly, but this does not make her stop her projects. She joined this credit group out of the need for the necessary resources to make her weavings.  The majority of the necessary materials for this production are made through slightly costly techniques, such as the dying of thread with purple charcoal. She made use of this recourse for the acquisition of twisted cotton thread in various colours such as: white, blue, green, red, orange, purple; and white cotton skeins that they use in making textiles, which they obtain using the technique of spinning by hand with wooden spindles; white sailing thread which is fundamental in the workshops in making worsted yarn from crystal thread; and the traditional cotton thread called Cuyuchi cotton thread. Reyna has been doing this for many years and is teaching her daughters so that later on they will be able to create art, thus preserving this valuable legacy. Reyna wants to continue to be supported in the facilitation of materials for her work. She would like her children to prepare themselves, for her work and health to stay strong and for her production not to diminish, for the demand and promotion of her creations to increase. “Comerciantes de Ñuu Savi” is a group that has great commitment from its members. In the name of its members, Reyna wishes you joy and sends a hug to those who support the large worldwide Kiva family. She thanks the Fundacion Realidad for trusting in them.
These are the names of the members and their jobs:

Carmelita D. González. – chicken sales
Marcelina C..- delicacy sales
Flora D. C..- delicacy sales
Reyna Q. Hernández.- hand embroidery
Clementina D. D..-meat sales
Alicia González Barragán.- clothing sales
Cresencia M. D..- the baking and sale of bread
Celia García T..- drink sales
Victorina C. Hernández.-the baking and sale of bread
Isidora Hernández López.- grocery store
Pablo S. C..- meat sales

loans.use: This next loan is for the purchase of materials for making napkins, tablecloths, coats and textiles. The materials that they use are cotton threads in varied colours, skeins of sailing thread, crafty cotton thread,  and cotton thread dyed with purple marine snails. These materials are made locally and have a high production cost.

loans.name: Emilce Ester

texts.es: La señora Emilce Ester Martínez vive con su esposo y tres hijos en el barrio las Nieves, uno de los más populares de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Ella es comerciante de mercancías en general. Hace 15 años comenzó vendiendo productos por catálogos entre sus amigas para colaborarle a su esposo con algunos ingresos para el hogar. El negocio fue creciendo y por sugerencia de sus clientes empezó  a comprar mercancía en  Maicao, ciudad comercial ubicada en el norteño departamento de la Guajira. Actualmente no viaja porque se ha especializado en la venta de calzado y ropa femenina que le proveen directamente algunos talleres en Barranquilla, motivo por el cual sus precios de venta son muy competitivos. La microempresaria atribuye el éxito de su negocio al hecho de que no sólo vende, sino que asesora a todas sus clientas en el estilo de ropa y calzado que deben comprar para verse más elegantes. Algunas, incluso, le consultan su opinión cuando compran en almacenes. Este es el segundo crédito que la señora Emilce tramita con la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo y su primer Credikiva que planea invertir en la compra de jeans, camisas, pantalones, faldas, calzado y accesorios femeninos. El volumen de venta mensual es de $ 3.000.000 COP, la rentabilidad promedio es del 37% y el plazo de la rotación de las cuentas por cobrar es de 50 días. La microempresaria sueña con abrir su propio almacén en el cual pueda ofrecer su mercancía y hacer con mayor comodidad lo que más le gusta: ser consultora de imagen femenina.
texts.en: Mrs Emilce Ester Martínez lives with her husband and three children in the Las Nieves neighbourhood, one of the most traditional neighbourhoods of the Barranquilla city. She is a merchant of general merchandise. She started selling products to her friends through catalogues 15 years ago to help her husband with some income for their home. The business grew, and on the suggestion of her customers she started buying merchandise in Maicao, a commercial city in the northern department of La Guajira. She currently does not travel because she has specialized in the sales of shoes and women's clothing which are provided directly from various workshops in Barranquilla-this is why her sales prices are very competitive. This businesswoman attributes the success of her business to the fact that she does not just sell, but also advises all of her customers as to which style of clothing and shoes they should buy to be more elegant. Some of them even request her opinion when they buy in department stores. This is the second loan that Mrs Emilce has applied for from la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo, and her first loan on Kiva. She plans to invest it in the purchase of jeans, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes and women's accessories. Her monthly sales volume is $ 3.000.000 COP. The expected profitability is 37% and the time to turn over her accounts to cover charges is 50 days. This businesswoman dreams of opening her own store in which she could offer her merchandise and do, with greater comfort, what she most likes: being a woman's image consultant.

loans.use: the purchase of jeans, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes and women's accessories

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “San Lorenzo” a quien hace honor a la comunidad de San Lorenzo Oaxaca, cabe mencionar que el grupo esta integrado por un numero de 10 personas 9 mujeres y 1 hombre, todos ellos hablan la lengua madre   perteneciente a la comunidad indígena mixteca de la costa de Oaxaca también conocido como la mixteca baja, hablando un poco mas de la comunidad en sus paisajes geográficos, podemos observar ríos, arroyos, barrancas y montañas, en la zona habita un gran numero de árboles en diferentes especies, tales como la caoba, encino, piedro y parotas, la mayoría de la gente se dedica a las labores cotidianas del campo y las artesanías. Felicitas  es el nombre de la mujer que representa al grupo, pero en esta ocasión haremos alusión a una miembro mas del grupo ella es, Florencia de 39 años de edad, casada con un campesino de 49 años  llamado José. 
Felicitas  tiene 4 hijos que son: Víctor de 19 años, Jonathan de 17 estudiante de la preparatoria, Javin de 14 quien cursa la escuela secundaria y Abigail de 12 años de edad quien estudia el 6to de primaria. Florencia es artesana de toda la vida y elabora textiles en técnica de telar de cintura, mismos que comercializa en la región y pueblos vecinos de su comunidad, este oficio forma parte de toda una gran tradición legada por sus ancestros que les enseñan desde niñas a la fabricación de textiles para uso personal y comercialización.
Florencia integra al grupo  de crédito organizado en su comunidad y a unos pasos de su domicilio,  ella hizo uso de su crédito para la compra de materiales que utiliza en la elaboración de las artesanías, compro hilos de algodón torcido en variados colores como son: blanco, azul, verde, rojo , naranja , morado, hilo de algodón torcido, madejas de algodón blanco que utilizan en la elaboración de textiles hilo vela, estambre de hilo tipo cristal y el tradicional hilo de algodón demonizado hilo cuyuchi, que es de color tierra y es elaborado con algodón sembrado en la misma región y que viste las camisas de los hombres indígenas llamados coton. Florencia ya lleva varios años en este oficio, desde que regreso de la ciudad de México en donde ella emigro durante un tiempo en busca de un futuro mejor, pero el destino la trajo de vuelta  a su pueblo natal. 
A lo único que aspira Florencia es darles lo mejor a sus hijos, apoyarlos en su preparación escolar y tener un futuro con mas oportunidades, ella quisiera que la tradición de su trabajo no se pierdan si o lo aprendan las generaciones venideras,  a lo mas grande que se ha enfrentado es a la desigualdad que impera en los pueblos indígenas, a la discriminación y falta de apoyo por parte de los organismos públicos de gobierno.
El grupo denominado “San Lorenzo”, se distingue por la unión que existe entre ellos, por ser personas trabajadoras y honradas, algunas en condiciones de pobreza pero con una sonrisa en su rostro que es capaz de mitigar cualquier estrago de la sociedad.
Las palabras no describen los gestos de agradecimiento de la gente que recibe u poquito de lo mucho que podemos dar a los que necesitan mas, y a nombre de las personas que integran este grupo de crédito, Florencia les envía un abrazo y una saludo, que pasen una feliz navidad y que DIOS los bendiga en este 2011.
 Las personas que integran el grupo “San Lorenzo” son las que aparecen a continuación, también sus actividades de trabajo que realizan.

Felicitas – Venta de antojitos
Raymundo - Venta de antojitos
Adelina- Venta de frutas y verduras
Dolores- Abarrotes
Sonia - Bordado Artesanal 
Carmen - Bordado Artesanal
Juliana - Compra y Venta de ganado
Mariana - Bordado Artesanal
Florencia - Bordado Artesanal
Laura - Bordado Artesanal
texts.en:
This group is called "San Lorenzo", whose name honours San Lorenzo Oaxaca. It is worth mentioning that the group is made up of 10 people: 9 women and 1 man. They all speak the mother tongue belonging to the Mixteca indigenous community of the coast of Oaxaca, also known as the Mixteca Baja. A little more about the community's geography: There are rivers, streams, hills and mountains. There are a great number of trees of various species, such as mahogany, holm oak, the tree of rock, and parota trees. The majority of the people work daily in the fields or make crafts.  Felicitas is the name of the woman who represents the group, but on this occasion we will talk about a different member of the group:  Florencia , age 39, who is married to a 49-year-old countryman named José. Felicitas has 4 children: Victor, age 19; Jonathan, age 17 who is in preparatory school; Javin, age 14, who is in high school; and Abigail, age 12, who is in grade 6. Florencia has been an artist all her life and makes textiles on a belt loom, which she sells in the region and neighbouring villages. This work forms part of a long traditional legacy of her ancestors who taught their children from a very young age to make textiles for personal use and for sale. Florencia joined her community credit group which is a few steps away from her home. She made use of her loan for the purchase of materials that she uses in the making of crafts. She purchased twisted cotton thread in various colours such as: white, blue, green, red, orange and purple; twisted cotton thread; skeins of white cotton that they use in the making of textiles; sailing thread; crystal worsted yarn; and the traditional Cuyuchi cotton thread, which is earth-coloured and is made with cotton grown in the same region and makes the cotton shirts that the indigenous men wear. Florencia has already been doing this for several years, since she returned from Mexico City where she emigrated in the search of a better future--but destiny brought her back to her native village. The only thing that Florencia wants is to give her children something better, to support them in their schooling and to have a future with better opportunities. She would like the tradition of her work to continue and not to be lost, but to be learned by future generations. The largest challenge that she has confronted has been the inequality that prevails in indigenous communities, the discrimination and lack of support from government organizations. The San Lorenzo group is set apart by the unity of its members, who are hard-working and upright. Some of them live in conditions of poverty but they have smiles on their faces that are able to relieve any problem in society. Words cannot describe the gratitude of the people who are receiving a little of abundance that we can give to those who need more. In the name of the people who are part of this credit group, Florencia sends you a hug and greetings and hopes that you have a merry Christmas and prays that God blesses you in 2011.
The members of the San Lorenzo group are listed below, as well as their jobs:



Felicitas – delicacy sales
Raymundo- delicacy sales
Adelina - fruit and vegetable sales
Dolores- groceries
Sonia - hand embroidery
Carmen- hand embroidery
Juliana - the purchase and sale of livestock
Mariana- hand embroidery
Florencia - hand embroidery
Laura - hand embroidery

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of twisted cotton thread; cotton skeins to embroider in various colours; worsted yarn for spinning in purple, white, blue, green; coffee; cotton sailing thread; crystal skeins for spinning and natural purple cotton thread dyed with marine snails

loans.name: Lucerito 1 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the group "Lucerito 1" which translates to "Guiding light".  The group is in Los Alcarrizos which is located north of the city of Santo Domingo which is a very industrialized city with a large population.  Los Alcarrizos is dependent on the companies and economy of Santo Domingo.  Like in many other cities, Los Alcarrizos has a shortage of drinking water and electricity and includes a Dominican population as well as a population of Haitian immigrants. 

Carmen is dedicate to the art of creating things, like jewel.  She make rings, necklaces, bracelets and other creative things.  She is the mother of two children.  Her biggest challenge is to become a designer and to expand her art so that it can be known in other places.  She likes to create things.

Carmen is very happy to be receiving her fourth loan with field partner Esperanza Internacional.  With this loan she hopes to be able to get ahead and to have a successful business.  She plans on investing her loan in purchasing various materials like thread and accessories to make different styles of jewelry.  She plans on using her profits for her house and to improve her designs.

loans.use: To buy thread, jewels, etc.

loans.name: Las Chicuelas Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO SE ENCUENTRA LOCALIZADO EN MORELOS, ESTADO D. MÉXICO.EL GRUPO SE LLAMA LAS CHICUELAS PORQUE SUS INTEGRANTES EN SU MAYORÍA SON MUJERES JÓVENES.LA SEÑORA MARÍA MAGDALENA N. TIENE 34 AÑOS D. EDAD Y TIENE TRES HIJOS (10, 8 Y 2 AÑOS). ELLA Y SU ESPOSO SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA D. ABARROTES, POR LO QUE EL CRÉDITO LO HAN SOLICITADO PARA LA COMPRA D. MERCANCÍA PARA HACER CRECER MÁS SU TIENDA,  COMPRAR  MERCANCÍA AL MAYOREO Y OFRECER PRODUCTOS SURTIDOS, LOGRANDO TENER UNA MAYOR VARIEDAD D. ARTÍCULOS D. ABARROTES, LO CUAL SE VERÁ REFLEJADO EN SUS VENTAS Y EN SUS INGRESOS CON LO CUAL PODRÁN HECERLE MEJORAS A SU CASA  Y ASÍ OFRECERLE UNA MEJOR CALIDAD D. VIDA A SUS HIJOS.
texts.en: The group is located in Morelos in the state of Mexico and is called Las Chicuelas ["The Little Kids"] because the majority of its members are young women.  María Magdalena N. is 34 years old and has 3 children (10, 8, and 2 years old).  She and her husband sell groceries and are requesting this loan to buy merchandise at wholesale to supply their store and help grow their business.  They would like to buy assorted products, allowing them to have a greater variety of groceries, which will be reflected in their sales and income.  With increased income they will be able to make improvements on their home and improve the quality of life of their children.

loans.use: To buy assorted products to supply their grocery store

loans.name: Peguajho Group

texts.es:
En Yaguarón, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de  capitalizar su actividad y otras para emprender actividades productivas, de ahí que coordinamos la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa, les resultó muy fructíferas  e interesantes por los beneficios brindados por el programa.
El comité lleva por nombre Peguajhó debido a que todas son de la compañía que lleva dicho nombre, por medio de este emprendimiento fortalecerían el lazo entre ellas, actualmente se encuentran en el quinto ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 20  emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para aumentar sus ingresos y por ende brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. Todas las integrantes son luchadoras, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de ellas es la señora Gumercinda quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, es importante mencionar que muchas de hortalizas que ella venda es de produccion y tambie  las de sus socias del comité.
Comenta que todas estan muy contentas por el trabajo que vienen realizando y esperan continuar.
Ella solicita el prestamo para la compra de frutas y verduras, ya que en esta epoca hay mucha venta y no cuenta con mercaderia suficiente.
texts.en:
In Yaguarón some women get together to capitalize their businesses, and others meet to launch productive businesses.  The meetings are coordinated so that the members can familiarize themselves with the program.  The program has been very fruitful for them, and the benefits offered keep them interested.
The committee carries the name "Peguajhó" because all the members are from the company of the same name.  
Through this enterprise, the ties between the women have been strengthened.  Currently, they are in their fifteenth cycle with excellent rating.  The committee is made up of 20 enterprising women who put forth the best of themselves to increase their incomes and therefore offer the best to their respective families.  All the members are strong women who have invested their loans into their respective businesses.  
One of the women is Señora Gumercinda.  She makes her living selling fruits and vegetables.  It is important to mention that much of the produce that she sells she produces, as is true for other members of the committee. 
She notes that all of them are very happy for the work that they are doing, and they hope to continue.
Señora Gumercinda is requesting the loan to purchase fruits and vegetables, since there a lot of sales in this season and she doesn't have enough merchandise.

loans.use: For the purchase of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lluvia Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO SE LLAMA LLUVIA PORQUE EL DIA QUE SE CONFORMO ESTABA LLOVIENDO. LA SEÑORA LUISA COLUMBA B. TIENE 51 AÑOS DE EDAD,  LLEVA 17 CICLOS EN EL GRUPO Y SE DEDICA A HACER SERVILLETAS BORDADAS A MANO. ELLA ES EL ÚNICO SUSTENTO DE SU CASA, TIENE 5 HIJOS, TODOS MAYORES DE EDAD Y CASADOS, CON CRÉDITOS QUE HA RECIBIDO ANTERIORMENTE SE HA VISTO BENEFICIADA NOTABLEMENTE, AHORA QUIERE COMPRAR MÁS MATERIALES DE MEJOR CALIDAD PARA LA ELABORACIÓN DE SUS SERVILLETAS, MENCIONA QUE TAMBIÉN DE ESTA MANERA MEJORA EL SERVICIO A  SUS CLIENTES , YA QUE LAS OFRECE EN LAS COMUNIDADES ALEDAÑAS OBTENIENDO MEJORES INGRESOS, MAYOR RENTABILIDAD EN SU NEGOCIO Y UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE SU MERCANCÍA. EN LA FOTOGRAFÍA LA SEÑORA SABINA S. SE MOVIO AL MOMENTO DE TOMAR LA FOTO Y LA SEÑORA SARA CASTEÑEDA ES LA QUE ESTA ENFRENTE DE ELLA Y SE VE OBSCURO SU ROSTRO POR LA SOMBRA DEL ÁRBOL.
texts.en:
This group is called “Lluvia” (Rain) because it was raining on the day that the group was formed.  Luisa Columba B., age 51, has been in the group for 17 cycles.  She makes embroidered napkins by hand.  She is the only support in her household.  She has five children, and they are all adults and married.

She has benefited greatly from the previous loans that she has received.  Now she wants to buy more materials that are better quality to make her napkins.  She also mentions that this way she will improve customer service.  She sells in neighboring communities and gets better earning, greater profitability in her business, and a better quality of merchandise.

Sabina S. moved at the time the photo was taken.  Sara Casteñeda is in front of her, and her face is obscured by the tree’s shadow.

loans.use: Material for making napkins and tableclothes

loans.name: Luz En Desarrollo 1 Group

texts.en:
Joaquina operates a decorations workshop where she manufactures bedding, clothing, bathroom linen sets, curtains, tablecloths, etc.  She is a married woman with 3 children.  Her biggest challenge is to have a store to decorate weddings and other events.  She loves to read.

Joaquina is a member of the group 'Luz en Desarrollo 1' which translates to 'Development light'.  The group is in Los Alcarrizos which is located north of the city of Santo Domingo which is a very industrialized city with a large population.  Los Alcarrizos is dependent on the companies and economy of Santo Domingo.  Like in many other cities, Los Alcarrizos has a shortage of drinking water and electricity and includes a Dominican population as well as a population of Haitian immigrants.

Joaquina is very happy to be receiving her fourth loan with field partner Esperanza Internacional.  With this loan she hopes to be able to get ahead and to have a successful business.  She plans on investing her loan in purchasing various materials like thread, linen and accessories to make different styles of decorations.  She plans on saving her profits.  She wants to have a local business and she is dreaming to have it soon.  She wants to dedicate her time to improve her business and start other projects.

loans.use: To buy linen, thread, and others items.

loans.name: Jamai

texts.en:
For Jamai, art has been his passion for as long as he can remember. Through silk-screening, he has found a way to pursue his passion and create his very own business: Animal Instincts Apparel.

Three years ago, while wearing a shirt he had created, Jamai caught the attention of a successful retail business owner. He asked to buy some of his shirts and, impressed by his work ethic, went on to offer Jamai an internship. Within a year, Jamai decided to take what he had learned, both about design and managing a small retail business, and start his own company. “The most challenging part of opening the business was to sit down and decide to actually do it,” Jamai explained.  

To make sure his business would be a success, Jamai explored each San Francisco neighborhood to discover what sold best. His hard work paid off, and Animal Instincts Apparel is now featured in 15 boutiques across the city, at local crafts markets, and online through his website and Etsy. His unique t-shirts feature his own designs and are available in toddler, children, and adult sizes.

Buzz is building around Jamai’s clothing line. He needed a small business loan to meet demand and begin offering more designs, colors, and styles. But, as a young entrepreneur, he was turned away from banks due to his limited credit history.

An Internet search brought Jamai to Opportunity Fund, a local micro lender, and he realized that a micro-loan was “much more manageable” for his business than the larger loans traditionally offered by banks. “Opportunity Fund discussed my budget and finances with me and made sure a loan was the right choice.” A $5,000 loan will provide Jamai the capital he needs to incorporate hoodies and sweatshirts into his line, build up his inventory, and take Animal Instincts Apparel to the next level.

As his business grows, Jamai hopes to open his own silk screening facility and eventually expand production to other cities. Starting in 2012, he also plans to launch a donation program that will send a percentage of the proceeds from Animal Instincts Apparel to wildlife organizations.

To learn more about Animal Instincts Apparel and see Jamai’s designs, visit: http://animalinstinctsapparel.com

loans.use: To add hoodies and sweatshirts to his clothing line

loans.name: Juventud Activa Group

texts.es:
Este Comité de Jovenes se formó gracias a Liz Paola B. Mareco, que vive en la cuidad de Potrero Melgarejo Loma. Encantados aceptaron conformar el Comité de Jóvenes nombrando al Comité  Juventud Activa.
 
      Las integrantes del comité se dedican  a la venta de productos avon, ventas de ropas interiores, ropas de vestir, capataz,  etc. a la par de estas actividades están estudiando también la mayoría están cursando el último año del nivel medio. 
La presidenta del grupo es Liz, una joven emprendedora y que desea comenzar con un negocio de venta ropas. 
Comenta que quiere comenzar con una pequeña cantidad e ir aumentando a medida que consiga clientes. 
Para comenzar con las compras de ropas de la temporada entre remeras, vestidos, shorts y otros.

Todos agradecen por la oportunidad que ofrece la Fundación ya con esto aprenderán mucho como el trabajo en grupo, responsabilidad y lo más importante iniciar un trabajo que les puede ayudar en el futuro.
texts.en:
This Young People's Committee was founded thanks to Liz Paola B. Mareco who lives in the town of Potrero Melgarejo Loma.  The members were delighted to set up their Young People's Committee and named it 'Comité Juventud Activa' (Active Youth Commitee).

Between them, the members of this committee sell Avon products, underwear, clothes, etc.  As well as carrying out their business activities, these young people are also studying.  Most of them are in the final year of their intermediate studies.

Liz is the group's president.  She is an enterprising young woman who would like to start a business selling clothes.  She says that she would like to start with a small quantity of clothes and increase her stock as she gains customers.  She will start by selling seasonal clothes such as t-shirts, dresses, shorts, etc.

All of the members of the group are grateful for the opportunity that they are being given by Fundación Paraguaya since they will learn a lot such as how to work as a team, responsibility and, most importantly, how to start a business that can help them in the future.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, dresses, tops, etc.

loans.name: Flores De Dolores Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Flores de Dolores. Está ubicado en la comunidad de Dolores Hidalgo, en el Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes.Paulina M. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 44 años, estudió hasta el 6° año de primaria, es comerciante, tiene en total 4 hijos; 2 mujeres y 2 hombres. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de rebozos, negocio que inicio hace 8 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar rebozos. Ella vende sus rebozos en los municipios aledaños a su comunidad, menciona que el producto que vende es parte de la vestimenta tipica de la región donde vive y sus alrededores.Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente feliz porque tiene capital para poder invertir en su negocio. Quiere este crédito para comprar rebozos y tener surtido su negocio. Al momento de capturar la fotografía la señora Adela García se agacho, pero salen todas las integrantes.
texts.en:
This group is called Flores de Dolores (Dolores’s Flowers). It is located in the community of Dolores Hidalgo in the state of Mexico. There are 12 people in the group. 44-year old Paulina M. is one of them. She completed sixth grade of primary school, is a businesswoman, and has four children, two girls and two boys. 

Paulina earns her living buying and selling shawls, a job she’s been doing for eight years. She is seeking a loan to buy more shawls which she sells in the nearby towns. The shawls are part of the traditional dress worn by local women. 

Paulina is happy right now because she has the money to invest in her business. The loan will be used to buy more shawls so her store is well-stocked. At the moment of taking the photograph, Sra. Adela García bent down, but all the group members appear.

loans.use: to buy shawls

loans.name: Ana Empeatriz

texts.es:
Ana de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora que con esfuerzo tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa de caña. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Fortín ha trabajado para ayudar a su esposa a mantener a sus cinco hijos de 13, 10, 5, 4, 3 años de edad. Empezó hace tres años atrás con víveres de primera necesidad variados. En la actualidad trabaja en su tienda desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm con la ayuda de su hermana también trabaja los fines de semana. Vende en la tienda arroz, azúcar, confites, enlatados etc. La incomodidad que tiene para trabajar con eficiencia es comprar los víveres ya que el sitio está muy lejos y tiene que alquilar un carro para que la acompañe. 

Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceite, enlatados para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos. En el futuro quiere construir su casa de cemento y comprar una camioneta para hacer las comprar de la tienda.
texts.en:
35 year old Ana is a hard-working woman who with great effort has a small store in the front part of her house built of reeds.

She lives in a suburban area called Fortín and works helping her husband support their five children ages 13, 10, 5, 4, and 3. She began her business three years ago selling basic needs items. Today she works in the store from 6:00 AM until 10:00 PM with the help of her sister she also works on the weekends. In the store she sells rice, sugar, candy, canned goods, etc.  The inconvenience she has working efficiently is having to buy the goods as the locale is very far and she has to rent a car to take her.

She wishes to continue with her business and therefore with the loan she wants to buy rice, oil and canned goods in order to provide a better life for her children. In the future she wants to build a house out of cement and buy a small truck to make purchases for her store.

loans.use: Rice, oil, canned goods

loans.name: Julia Geoconda

texts.es:
Julia Geoconda C. M. tiene 58 años. Es viuda, vive con los nietos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Julia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao y crianza de pollos. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para que la producción sea de calidad. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener terrenos propios para trabajar y no vivir arrendado.

Le gusta coser, cuidar con los animales, jugar con los nietos y la navidad festejar con la comunidad.
texts.en:
J58-year old Julia Geoconda C. M. is a widow and lives with her grandchildren in Chillanes canton, in Bolivar province. She has three adult children.

The members of V.R.C. La Esperanza Nunca se Pierde (Hope never Dies) Community Bank live in the community of El Placer, about 120 minutes from the office in Chillanes. The majority of the group work in agriculture.

Julia is one of them. She grows corn and cocoa, and raises chickens. Her purchases and sales are made in Chillanes canton, at the Sunday market. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds, manure, and fertilizer so that her crops are of good quality. The loan will help her provide for her needs. Julia faces problems such as pests, plant disease, and weather. Her dream is to have land of her own to farm and not have to rent it. She enjoys sewing, looking after the animals, playing with her grandchildren, and joining in the community Christmas festivities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, and fertilizer

loans.name: Shareef

texts.en:
Shareef is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Shareef and his friends decided to start a small project that would create an additional source of income. The group of friends has created a musical and chanting troupe to perform in weddings. Shareef came to FATEN and took the loan to purchase the musical instruments they need to start the band in addition to the ones they already have. Shareef and his band studied music in school and they have the skills.

Shareef is the one who stands in the middle of the picture here with his band.

loans.use: To purchase musical instruments to form a band

loans.name: Ángel Oswaldo

texts.es:
Ángel Oswaldo Y. N. tiene 28 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la conviviente y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Ángel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao y crianza de chanchos. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es completar la siembra de cacao y adecuar unas chancheras.

En su tiempo libre le gusta salir al rio a nadar, ver la television, escuchar musica, festejar las fiestas de navidad y del recinto.
texts.en:
28-year old Ángel Oswaldo Y. N. lives with his common-law wife and their three children in Chillanes canton, in Bolivar province. 

The members of V.R.C. La Esperanza Nunca se Pierde (Hope never Dies) Community Bank live in the community of El Placer, about 120 minutes from the office in Chillanes. The majority of the group work in agriculture.

Ángel is one of them. He grows corn and cocoa, and raises pigs. His purchases and sales are made in Chillanes canton, at the Sunday market.
