He is seeking a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and food for his animals. The loan will help him provide for his needs. Ángel faces problems such as pests, plant disease, and weather. His goal is to finish planting his cocoa crop and make improvements to some of the pigpens. 

In his free time he enjoys going to the river to swim, watching television, listening to music and is excited about celebrating the Christmas holidays.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and animal food

loans.name: Marianela Del Rocio

texts.es:
Marianela Del Rocio B. C. tiene 35 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el conviviente y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Marianela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao y crianza de chanchos. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo y tener una economía familiar.

Le gusta ver  la televisión, jugar con la pelota, ayudar a ser las tareas de los hijos y festejar las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Marianela Del Rocio B. C., age 35, is in a common-law marraige.  She lives with her life partner and their children in the Chillanes canton in the Bolívar province.  She has three children.

The members of the La Esperanza Nunca Se Pierde (Never Lose Hope) Communal Bank belong to the Placer community or precinct.  It is 120 minutes from the Chillanes office.  Most of the members of this bank are farmers.

Marianela grows corn and cacao.  She also raises pigs.  She makes her purchases and sales at the Sunday fair in the Chillanes canton.

She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, and feed for the animals.  

The support of the loan will financially help her to provide the necessities.  Her crops face the challenges of pest infestations, diseases, and climate changes.

Her dream is to buy a vehicle and to have family savings.

She likes to watch television, play ball, help her children with their homework, and celebrate community fiestas.

loans.use: To buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, and feed for the animals

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio C. N. tiene 45 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la conviviente y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Marco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao y arroz. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para tener dinero para que los hijos tengan una vida sin necesidades.

Le gusta visitar a la familia, cuidar a los padres, salir de paseo, jugar pelota y ver la pelea de gallos.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio C. N., age 45, is in a common-law marraige.  He lives with his life partner and their children in the Chillanes canton in the Bolívar province.  He has four children.

The members of the La Esperanza Nunca Se Pierde (Never Lose Hope) Communal Bank belong to the Placer community or precinct.  It is 120 minutes from the Chillanes office.  Most of the members of this bank are farmers.

Marco grows corn, cacao, and rice.  He makes his purchases and sales at the Sunday fair in the Chillanes canton.

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds and organic and chemical fertilizers.  

The support of the loan will financially help him to provide the necessities.  His crops face the challenges of pest infestations, diseases, and climate changes.

His dream is to continue working in order to have the money so that his children have the necessities of life.

He likes to visit family, take care of his parents, go for walks, play ball, and watch cockfights.

loans.use: Seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Los Lirios 1, 2 Group

texts.en:
Yojane is the coordinator of her group L. lirios 1, 2 (the lilies), and her story is representative both of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in L. Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial town where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children.

Yojane is excited both to take her fifth loan with Esperanza and to grow her business like her friends who are already participating in Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and miscellaneous products by purchasing more merchandise. She will use the profits and savings to invest in her house by building a concrete roof. Prior to starting the business, it was really difficult to save or to buy things for her house and family. Now she has the opportunity to support some of those needs.

loans.use: Clothing and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Digna Isabel

texts.es:
Digna Isabel Y. N. tiene 25 años. Es soltera, vive con los padres, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Digna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y crianza de pollos. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta escuchar música y celebrar las fiestas del patrono San José.
texts.en:
Digna Isabel Y. N. is 25 years old. She is single, and lives with her parents in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. She does not have any children.

The members of the V.R.C. "La Esperanza Nunca Se Pierde" ("The Hope Is Never Lost Communal Bank") belong to the community or recinto El Placer, about 120 minutes from the office in Chillanes. The majority of the members of this communal bank are in the agricultural business.

Digna is in the agriculture business, sowing corn and raising chickens. On Sundays she makes her purchases and sells her stock in the Chillanes canton market.

She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and food for the animals. The support of the loan will help her to meet her needs economically. She faces challenges such as plagues and illnesses and the variations of the weather. Her dream is to have her own house. She likes to listen to music and celebrate the holidays of the patron saint San José.

loans.use: seeds, fertilizer, and food for the animals

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Pedro José B. M. tiene 55 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y crianza de pollos. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener más ingresos económicos y mayor producción.

Le gusta celebrar las fiestas de San Jacinto.
texts.en:
Pedro José B. M. is 55 years old. He is married, and lives with his wife and their children. He lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. He has three children.

The members of the V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE (the Hope Is Never Lost communal bank) belong to the community or recinto of El Placer, about 120 minutes from the office in Chillanes. The majority of the members of this communal bank are in the agriculture business.

Pedro is in the agriculture business, sowing corn and raising chickens. On Sundays he makes his purchases and sells his stock in the market of the Canton of Chillanes.

He is requesting the loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizers, and food for the animals. The support of the loan will help him meet his needs economically. He faces challenges such as plagues, illnesses and the variations of the weather. His dream is to have more income and greater production. He likes to celebrate the fiestas (holidays) of San Jacinto.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and food for the animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start up his own air conditioning and heating systems business

loans.name: Joffre Joselito

texts.es:
Joffre Joselito Z. C. tiene 36 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Joffre se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y crianza de pollos. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es superarse económicamente.

Le gusta celebrar las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Joffre Joselito Z. C. is 36 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children in Cantón Chillanes, Bolívar province. He has two children.

The members of V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE belong to the community or area of Placer, located 120 minutes from the Chillanes office. 

The members of this group are primarily farmers.

Joffre is a farmer, growing corn and raising chickens. He buys and sells in Cantón Chillanes market on Sundays.

He seeks a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and animal feed. The support of the loan would help him economically to supply his needs. The challenges of farming include pests, diseases, and weather. His dream is to succeed economically.

He likes to celebrate the community holidays.

loans.use: Buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Danilo Fernández

texts.es:
Danilo Fernández R. A. tiene 44 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Danilo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es superarse económicamente.

Le gusta asistir a las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Danilo Fernández R. A. is 44 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and child in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The members of the 'LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE" (Hope Is Never Lost) community bank live in the community of El Placer, 120 minutes from our Chillanes office.

The members of this community bank mainly work in agriculture.  Danilo is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He makes his purchases and sales in Chillanes canton, in the Sunday market

Danilo is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as plant diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to improve himself financially

Danilo likes taking part in his community's fiestas.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Roberto Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama ROBERTO, en honor al primer hijo de la organizadora del grupo. Está ubicado en el Estado de México.El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes.La señora Godofreda Eugenia es integrante de este grupo.Tiene 51años, estudió hasta segundo de primaria, es casada y tiene en total 4 hijos; 2 mujeres y 2 hombres,de los cuales dos dependen de ella. Ella lleva viviendo en la comunidad 20 años y se dedica a la venta de tortillas elaboradas a mano, esta actividad la inicio hace 4 años, el credito lo solicita para comprar una tonelada de maiz,gas y lo necesario para su negocio. Con el primer crédito la señora compró su tanque,comal y prensa para hacer las tortilas,con esto ella se motivo a seguir adelante con su negocio.Sus clientes comenta que las tortillas que vende la señora estan bien hechas y les inspira confianza el comprarlas por que saben que el sabor es único y que cuenta con la experiencia para que esten bien cocidas. Quiere este credito para obtener más produccion y poder acondicionar un espacio en su casa para poder atender a sus clientes y ayudar a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
This group is called ROBERTO in honor of the eldest son of the group's organizer.  The group is located in the State of Mexico and has 11 members.

Godofreda Eugenia is a member of this group.  She is 51 years old and studied up to the second year of elementary school.  She is married and has 4 children: 2 girls and 2 boys, of whom two are still in her care.  She has been living in the community for 20 years and her business is selling hand-made tortillas.  She started this business 4 years ago and she is requesting this loan to buy a ton of corn, gas and other items that she needs for her business.

With her first loan, Godofreda Eugenia bought her gas cylinder, 'comal' (a special ceramic or metal hotplate on which you cook tortillas) and press for preparing her tortillas.  This motivated her to continue with her business.  Her customers comment that the tortillas she sells are very well made and they are confident when they buy them because they know that the flavor is unique and that she has the experience to cook them well.

Godofreda Eugenia would like this loan so that she can make more tortillas and fit out a space in her home where she can serve her customers.  She would also like to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy corn and other items she needs for her business

loans.name: Lorenzo Silbano

texts.es:
Lorenzo Silbano V. A. tiene 53 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la conviviente y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Lorenzo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una finca.

Le gusta trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Lorenzo Silbano V. A. is 53 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has three children.

The members of the "LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE" (Hope Is Never Lost) community bank live in the community of El Placer, 120 minutes from our Chillanes office.  The members of this group mainly work in agriculture.

Lorenzo is a farmer who grows corn and beans.  He makes his purchases and sales in Chillanes canton, at the Sunday market.

Lorenzo is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as plant diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to own a large farm.

Lorenzo likes to work in the fields.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Fidela

texts.es:
Fidela es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisun, tiene 55 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de papa rellena de manera ambulatoria en el terminal de salida al sur, también vende en toda la avenida cuzco y arenales donde hay talleres. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación como: papa, aceite, carne cebolla, zanahoria, carne, etc.
Está en Finca hace 2 ciclos, le gusta porque le dan créditos, puede ahorrar y recibe capacitaciones de la familia, superación personal, negocio.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos se superen.
texts.en:
Fidela is a member of the Ccatarisun Communal Bank. She is 55 years old, married, and has 5 children. She sells stuffed potatoes as a street vendor at the bus station, she also sells along Cusco and Arenales streets where there are shops. The loan she seeks will be invested in buying ingredients to prepare her dishes such as: potatoes, oil, meat, onion, carrot, meat, etc.

She has been with Finca for 2 cycles; she likes the loans and she can save money and receive education services related to family, personal growth, and business.

Her dream is that her business grows and that her children be successful.

loans.use: Buy potato, oil, meat, onion, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Mamoun

texts.en: Mamoun is a young man from Tulkarem city. Mamoun works in a sewing workshop in the morning and fixes electrical machines. Mamoun is married and a father. He was able to buy an apartment after years of savings. Now he started putting final touches on the house, such as painting walls, installing washbowls and sinks. In order to pay for the installations and painting, Mamoun came to FATEN and took a loan to cover the cost. Mamoun wants to finish fixing the house to be able to move in next year. Mamoun appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Tulkarem.

loans.use: To put the final touches on his house such as painting and installing washbowls

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila es socia del Bancomunal Ccatarisun, tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 2 hijos de 22  y 9 años. Zoila es feriante, viaja a la Selva San francisco y sus anexos, atiende sólo pedidos y le va bien. Está en Finca hace 2 ciclos y le gusta por los créditos que le otorgan, puede ahorrar y le gusta la capacitaciones porque se tratan temas de la familia, negocio, derechos de las mujeres. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de pescado y abarrotes en general
El sueño de zoila es capitalizarse y que su negocio siga creciendo, que su hijos sean profesionales y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Zoila is a member of the Ccatarisun Communal Bank, is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children ages 22 and 9. Zoila is a saleswoman, she travels to Selva San Francisco and its surrounding area, taking only orders and her business is going well. She has been with Finca for 2 cycles and she like receiving the loans, being able to save money, and she likes the educational offerings because they relate to issues of family, business, and women’s rights. The loan that she seeks will be invested in buying fish and groceries.

Zoila dreams of becoming self-supporting and that her business continues to grow, that her children become professionals and have their own homes.

loans.use: Buy fish and groceries

loans.name: Maurita

texts.es:
Maurita es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisun, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos de 16, 13, 10 y 6 años de edad. Maurita es feriante, viaja de viernes a domingo a la selva de Santa Rosa y sus anexos lleva: verduras surtidas, pescado, gallinas. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en comprar: verduras surtidas, pescado, gallinas. A Maurita le gusta Finca porque le dan créditos, puede ahorrar, aprendió a ser responsable a llevar mejor su negocio, a mejorar en su familia.
Su sueño es poder abrir  su negocio en su casa, que sus hijos sigan estudiando, ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Maurita is a member of the Ccatarisun communal bank.  She is 36, married, and has 4 children, ages 16, 13, 10 and 6.  Maurita works at markets.  She travels from Fridays to Sundays to the Santa Rosa jungle and nearby markets where she takes: assorted vegetables, fish, and chickens.  She will use the loan to buy the different vegetables, fish and chickens.  Maurita likes Finca because it extends loans, she can save, and she has learned how to  be responsible in improving her business and helping her family.

Her dream is to open her own business in her home, for her children to continue studying, and to enlarge her house.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, fish and chickens

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, es madre soleta, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad. Maximiliana es feriante. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería, vende ropas como: buzos, blusas, faldas, entre otros para damas caballeros y niños.
Viaja a la feria de Seccelambras los días sábados, a Allpachaca los días jueves y Pampa cangallo los días miércoles. Le gusta Finca, porque le capacitan en negocio, familia, salud, le dan créditos y ahorra.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children ages 15 and 12. Maximiliana is a saleswoman.  

The loan that she seeks will be invested in buying clothing to stock her merchandise; she sells clothing such as : track suits, blouses, skirts and other items for men, women and children.

She travels to the Seccelambras market on Saturdays, to Allpachaca on Thursdays, and Pampa Cangallo on Wednesdays. She likes Finca because Finca educates her about business, family, health, provides loans and she can save money.

Her dream is that her business grows and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: Buy a variety of seasonal clothing

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene tiene 40 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y sus padres en casa de sus progenitores. Tiene más de 15 años de experiencia en la venta de cosméticos, productos que son ofrecidos a sus amistades y familiares, y con el apoyo de los catálogos sus clientes puede saber que tipo de producto es lo que desean comprar. Se siente muy satisfecha de lograr sus metas y recibir incentivos de parte de la empresa que le provee su mercadería, además  este negocio le permite ofrecer ofertas y promociones a su público consumidor a fin de que sean fieles en sus compras. Es por eso que Marlene ve con futuro su negocio y se proyecta  para los próximos años aumentar su mercancía y tener una tienda de cosméticos. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Marlene is 40 years old, lives with her two children and her parents in her parent’s home. She has been selling cosmetics for more than 15 years; products that are offered to friends and family, and with the help of catalogues her clients can know what types of products they wish to buy. She is very satisfied in meeting her goals and she receives incentives from the business that provides her merchandise. In addition this business allows her to be able to offer discounts and promotions to her customers so that they continue to make purchases. It is for this reason that Marlene sees her business continue in the future and she expects to increase her merchandise in the upcoming years and have a cosmetics store. This is her first loan with MFP; she is very happy to know that she has financial support. In addition she likes being part of the communal bank because all its members are people who she knows, are responsible, and very united. She thanks everyone who will be supporters of the loan that she seeks as it will be very useful in continuing her business. With the loan she seeks she will invest in buying beauty products to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: Buy more beauty products in order to meet her customer demand

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.es:
Rita de 43 años, es una mujer emprendedora que ha luchado para sacar adelante a su familia ya que no está casada. 

Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral ha trabajado durante 5 años como comerciante informal de productos L’bel (compañía de cosméticos y productos de uso personal que ayuda a mujeres emprendedoras con ventas por catalogo). Trabaja de lunes a viernes en la venta de los productos de uso personal y los fines de semana vende pescado para tener otro ingreso adicional.

Tiene muchas aspiración para su familia por eso quiere continuar trabajando pero uno de sus objetivos que ahora quiere es construir mejor su casa ya que viene el tiempo de lluvia por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, arena, bloques. En el futuro quiere tener otro piso en su casa para alquilarlo y así tener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Rita is 43 years old. She is a hard-working woman that has fought to improve her family's life since she is not married.

Living on the edge of the city in a zone called "Perimetral", she has worked for five years as an informal salesperson of L'bel products (a cosmetics and personal use products company that helps hard-working women with catalog sales). She works from Monday to Friday selling personal use products, and on the weekends she sells fish in order to have another additional income.

She has many aspirations for her family; that is why she wants to continue working. One of her objectives that she wants now, is to better construct her house since the rainy season is coming. It is for this reason that she wants to buy cement, sand, and blocks with the loan. In the future, she wants to have another floor on her house to rent out, and in this way have more income.

loans.use: Cement, blocks, and sand

loans.name: Meribeth Diana

texts.es:
Meribeth es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, es casada, tiene 24 años, un hijo de 4 años y un bebe que esta esperando. Meribeth es feriante se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, lo lleva a la selva de San Francisco y sus anexos, aprendió de este negocio de sus hermanas que venden ropa en la feria de San Miguel, Tambo y son socias de Finca.
Meribeth, vendiendo en la ferias se está auto educando, le gusta Finca por los créditos que le facilitan y puede ahorrar, aprende mucho en las capacitaciones sobre la familia, negocio, derechos de la mujer.
Su sueño es poder terminar sus estudios, que su negocio crezca y poder educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Meribeth is a member of the Wiñarisun community bank.  She is 24 years old and married.  She has a 4 year-old child and is expecting a baby.  Meribeth is a trader who sells men's, women's and children's clothes.  She takes her products to sell in San Francisco and surrounding areas.  She learned this business from her sisters who sell clothes in the market in San Miguel, Tambo and are also members of Finca.

Meribeth is teaching herself by selling her products in the markets.  She likes Finca for the loans that they provide and the fact that she can save.  She learns a lot in the training sessions about family, business and women's rights.  

Meribeth's dream is to be able to finish her studies, for her business to grow and to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell during Christmas week

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, es casada, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo de 1 año y 4 meses.
Karina es feriante, vende ropa para damas caballeros y niños que trae de Lima, compra en Gamarra y lo lleva  a la selva de San Francisco donde lo vende le va bien.
Le gusta Finca por los créditos, puede ahorrar y la capacitaciones que recibe de negocio, como hacer trabajar la plata. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en surtir su mercadería.
El sueño de Karina es poder establecer su negocio en un lugar fijo la selva de San Francisco y poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the community bank Wiñarisun.  She is 24 years old. She is married and has a son who is 16 months old.

Karina is a merchant at fairs. She sells clothing for women, men, and children. She buys clothing in the Gamarra district in Lima and takes it to the countryside around San Francisco, where she sells it. This business is going well for her.

She likes Finca because of the loans it provides, because she is able to save, and for the training in business that she receives, such as in making her money work for her. She will invest the loan that she is applying for to stock her merchandise.

Karina's dream is to be able to establish her business in a fixed location in the San Francisco countryside and to build her house.

loans.use: Buy various clothing for resale

loans.name: El Buen Futuro 2 Group

texts.en:
Rafaela is the coordinator of her group El Buen Futuro 2 (The Good Future) 2. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their three children.

Rafaela is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She operates a store that sells ice cream and juices. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing coconut, sugar, flavor, water, etc. She will use the profits to re-invest and to save, because she wants to finish building her house. She wants to have a nice and safe house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making ice cream and juice

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio Constitución de la  Ciudad de Caaguazú, son 15 (Quince) señoras trabajadoras, solidarias y responsables, que decidierón formar un grupo de mujeres, cuyo fin es recibir un pequeño préstamo DE la Fundación Paraguaya para invertir en sus trabajos diarios,con el deseo de incrementar las ventas y recibir más ganancia para beneficio personal y de toda la familia.
Una de las integrantes es la señora quin se dedica a la señora Erma y se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Las ropas que ella vende los compra de Asuncion donde los precios son mucho mas baratos y actualmente solicita le prestamo para la compra de remeras, shors, blusas, vestidos y otros.
texts.en: The Santa Librada group was formed in the Constitución neighborhood of the Caaguazú city. It consists of fifteen hardworking, committed, and responsible women that decided to form a group whose goal is to receive a small loan from Fundación Paraguaya. The members would like to invest the loans into their daily jobs so that they could increase their sales and profits and thus have greater income for themselves and their families. Erma is one of the group's members. Erma works in clothing sales; she buys her inventory in the town of Asuncion where the prices are much lower and is currently seeking a loan to purchase T-shirts, shorts, blouses, dresses, and other items.

loans.use: Purchase of T-shirts, shorts, dresses, blouses, and other items.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: A. Benson is an individual client from Mubende. He is 28 years old, married with one child and has a boutique that sells suits and clothes from the Kibaati area. Benson says that he is able to make 300,000/= as weekly profits from his boutique, which has been in existence for 6 years. He opening his boutique, after being in the tailoring business, on the advice of friends. He is hard working and friendly and hopes to expand his business further for more profits. Benson needs a loan to buy more clothes for resale, especially now during the festive season.

loans.use: Buying more clothes for resale especially now during the festive season.

loans.name: Nélida

texts.es: Nélida tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa de sus familiares. Hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y los vende de casa en casa a amigos y familiares, es así que sale todos los días a ofrecer sus productos. Dichos productos son de garantía ya que provienen de empresas reconocidas en el mercado y eso le da mucha ventaja en las ventas. Su gran entusiasmo que tiene le ha llevado a cumplir sus propias metas por lo que ahora se propone a tener ventas mayores para asegurarse en sus ganancias. Es su crédito número 3 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más cosméticos al por mayor.
texts.en: Nélida is 47 years old and lives with her husband and son in her relatives’ house.  She has worked selling cosmetics for three years and she sells them every day from house-to-house to friends and family members.  These products are of good quality as they come from companies that are renowned in the market, giving her a great advantage in her sales.  Her great enthusiasm has helped her to accomplish her own goals, which is why she is determined to have greater sales to secure her earnings.  This is her third loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support.  She enjoys being part of her communal bank because she knows all of the group members and they are responsible and supportive people.  She is grateful for all those who will find the loan she is requesting because it will be very useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the loan requested to invest in the purchase of more wholesale cosmetics.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: M. Anthony is an individual client from Kyenjojo. He is 28 years old and the father of four children. He makes local juice, called omubisi, which can also be used to make a local brew from Kabarungyi village. He also makes kwete (a maize-based brew) from sorghum which sells at a profit. His business is self initiated and it is his hard work and patience that have brought him this far. He needs a loan to be able to buy bananas to make the juice.

loans.use: Buy bananas to make juice.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, de 28 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Janeth de 24 años y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. El persistente trabajo de Cesar poco a poco va dando frutos, el restaurante que con tanto esfuerzo a puesto cada día tiene más clientes. Y es que su restaurante - cevicheria, es uno de los lugares más concurridos, debido a la gran atención que brinda, pero sobre todo al delicioso sazón que tienen sus comidas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, ya que él es el administrador del restaurante, lleva 1 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es satisfacer a sus clientes y brindarles un buen servicio, ya que las personas son muy exigentes, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Con el tiempo, espera que su restaurante crezca y se convierta en uno de los más conocidos de la ciudad. Es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, puesto que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas sillas y mesas para mejorar el ambiente de su restaurante.
texts.en: Cesar, age 28, is a very unassuming and hardworking man. He lives in his own house with his wife Janeth, age 24, and what he wants most of all is to do well in life. Cesar's main job, a restaurant that he created with so much effort, is little-by-little starting to bear fruit and with each passing day he has more clients. His restaurant - a cevicheria (serving dishes of marinated seafood) - is one of the busiest in the area, thanks to the great level of service he provides but most of all because of the delicious flavor of his dishes. What Cesar likes best about his work is providing service to his customers, given that he is the administrator of the restaurant. He's been in this business for about one year and finds it quite challenging to satisfy clients since people can be very demanding. Even so, he knows that it is his job and that he has to do it. With time, he hopes that the restaurant will grow and will become one of the better known restaurants in the city. This is Cesar's first loan with MFP, and he knows that he has to repay it in a timely manner since he does not want to cause problems for his partners in the communal bank. He plans to invest the funds into the purchase of new chairs and tables in order to improve the decor of his restaurant.

loans.use: Purchase new chairs and tables in order to bring better service to his customers.

loans.name: La Buena Vida 4 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is the coordinator of her group L. Buena vida 4 (The Good life). She operates a business selling catalog products, especially shoes and cosmetics. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. 

Ramona is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing new inventory. She will use the profits to re-invest and to save. She says that her most difficult challenge is to pay her daughter's fees at the university. She is working hard because she wants to see her daughter become a doctor. She thanks you all for your support. 

Ramona's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en: K. Gorreti has a retail shop in Bwizi trading centre. She is 32 years old and married with 6 children. In her shop, she sells items including flour, soft drinks, sugar, and rice. On average, she is able to make 30,000/= weekly profit and since she is a determined lady, she believes this will increase. Her dream is to have a stable and growing business and improve her family's standard of living. Gorreti needs a loan to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.use: Buying more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar, de 30 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Gilda de 24 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. A lo largo de su vida, Cesar ha trabajado en muchas cosas, ahora se decida al trabajo de la albañilería y es muy solicitado por sus vecinos y es que cuando hay que levantar una pared en su barrio de la ciudad de Kimbiri, él es el albañil con más experiencia, al que todos recurren. Cesar disfruta de trabajar en la construcción, sabe que con esta digna profesión puede pagar la educación de sus hijos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta profesión y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es cargar los pesados ladrillos y tener que manejar el cemento hasta con las manos, lo que ha hecho que sus manos envejezcan rápidamente. Pero su pronto requerimiento es renovar sus herramientas para mejorar el trabajo que hace. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que ya esta haciendo contactos para realizar más trabajos de construcción, él es el único varón de su banco comunal por lo que siempre trata de ser responsable y respetuoso con las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará tablones nuevos y aumentará su número de puntales, con lo cual podrá trabajar en más construcciones a la vez y así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Cesar, age 30, is a kind and hard working man. He lives in his own house with his wife Gilda, age 24, and their beloved children, to whom they hope to provide a better future.
 
For most of his life Cesar has done different kinds of work, but he is now dedicated to his work in construction. His work is in high demand by all of his neighbors; whenever someone needs a wall built in Cesar's neighborhood in Kimbiri city, he is the one everyone turns to because he has the most experience. 

Cesar enjoys working in construction; it is a decent profession that allows him to pay for his children's education. He has been working in construction for 10 years and thinks the most difficult part of his work is loading the heavy bricks and handling cement by hand. This prematurely ages his hands. But his greatest priority is to upgrade his tools to improve his work. This is Cesar's first loan from MFP and he doesn't want to risk running out of money to repay it, so he is currently making contacts for more construction work. He is the only man in his community bank, so he always makes an effort to be responsible and respectful towards all the other members. 

With the 1,000 PEN loan, Cesar will buy new wooden planks and more posts, construction materials that will allow him to work on more jobs at the same time and thus increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase wooden planks for construction business.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es: El Sr. Raymundo R.  es una persona muy honrada y respetuosa el tiene un negocio de abarrotes, el cual el desea ampliar un poco mas para así poder ofrecer mas variedad a su clientela el vive con su esposa y una hija, el Sr. Raymundo necesita el préstamo para así poder invertir mas en su tienda, su esposa no trabaja se mantienen de la tienda de abarrotes  por eso el quiere brindar mas y mejor servicio y variedad a la vez.
texts.en: Raymundo R. is a very honest and respectful person.  He owns a grocery store which he would like to expand a little so that he can offer more variety to his customers.  Raymundo lives with his wife and daughter.  He needs this loan so that he can invest more in his store.  His wife doesn't work and it is the grocery store that supports his family.  This is why he would like to be able to offer a better service with more products and variety.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Waly Suma Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal Waly Suma (en idioma aymara quiere decir “Bien Rico”) está solicitando su primer crédito en el centro focal de Villa Tejada, un total de  9  socias integran este grupo.
Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, como por ejemplo:  venta de aceite comestible a granel,  artesanía  de calzados, venta de condimentos y venta de comida, venta de medias, venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de juguetes y aguayos, venta de comida, artesanía y tejido de chompas.
Esta Banca Comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza se encuentra la presidenta, la señora  Teodora.

La señora Teodora es una socia con experiencia,  si bien es el primer ciclo como Banca Comunal Waly Suma, antes tuvo experiencia en crédito.   El negocio de la señora Teodora es la venta de fruta, tanto las frutas que son de la estación como las que se tiene durante todo el año, inició el negocio con su familia hace como cincuenta años, tenían la costumbre de traer fruta de la localidad de Río Abajo, actualmente compra de la ciudad de La Paz del mercado Rodríguez y las vende en su puesto de venta de la zona 12 de Octubre, en la calle Nº 2. Con el crédito la señora Teodora piensa comprar cajas de manzanas, mangas y uvas, especialmente estas últimas, pues existe la costumbre de comerlas en la noche de año nuevo, por lo que hay mucha demanda de las mismas.
texts.en:
The Waly Suma community bank ('Waly suma' means 'very rich' in the Aymara language), is requesting its first loan through the Villa Tejada regional office.  The group has 9 members.

The ladies' businesses are all different.  They include: selling cooking oil by the liter, making footwear by hand, selling condiments, selling meals, selling tights, selling clothes, selling fruit, selling toys and multicolored cloth, selling meals, making handicrafts and knitting sweaters.

This community bank is managed by a board and at the head of the board is the president, Teodora.

Teodora is an experienced member of the community bank.  Although this is her first loan cycle with the Waly Suma community bank, she has had previous experience with loans.  Teodora's business is selling fruit, both seasonal fruit and fruit that is available all year round.  Her family started the business around fifty years ago.  They used to bring fruit from the town of Rio Abajo.  Teodora currently buys her fruit in the Rodríguez market in the city of La Paz and then sells it from her stall in the '12 de Octubre' neighborhood, on Calle No. 2 (Street No. 2).  Teodora plans to use her loan to buy boxes of apples, mangos and grapes, especially the latter as there is a tradition of eating grapes on New Year's Eve which means that there is a lot of demand for them.

loans.use: To buy apples, grapes and mangos

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: T. Fred is an individual client from Kyenjojo. He is 35 years old and married with three children, all of them in school. Fred is involved in agriculture where he grows and sells Irish potatoes, beans, maize, matooke and so on while some of this produce he buys from other farmers for sale from Rutabo in Bwizi. His customers are daily transporters from Kampala and he is able to make 40,000/= as weekly profits. He is also involved in cattle selling; all self initiated and motivated businesses. Fred needs a loan to be able to purchase more produce for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing more produce for resale.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children. Her business is selling shoes in Ave. Ejercito in Cusco, Peru. She is taking out the loan to reinvest in her  business by buying shoes such as sandals, tennis shoes, dress shoes, and kid's shoes in bulk from distributors. She is very happy with the loan, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To Invest in her shoe sales business

loans.name: Macedonia

texts.es: Macedonia, de 46 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Nely y Herlinda, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Trabajando arduamente Macedonia ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a su café, cacao y hojas de coca los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes, para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en: 46 year old Macedonia is a very simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her two beloved children Nely and Herlinda, who are the principle motive for all her efforts. By working hard Macedonia has been able to be ahead of schedule on her planting. Every morning she gets up very early to water and care for her coffee, cocoa, and coca leaves which she then sells in San Francisco city, where she can get the best prices for her products. What she enjoys most about her works is that she can enjoy the freedom to work on her land. She has been farming for 27 years and considers having to work the land the most difficult part. With time, she hopes to be able to prepare her land to plant much more coffee. This is her second loan with MFP, she knows that this loan will help a lot in the progress and development of her business, and therefore she is prepared to make all her payments punctually. In her communal bank she is a very responsible member which is why she is very loved. With the one thousand soles of her loan, she will buy manure and fertilizers to improve the quality of her land.

loans.use: Buy more manure and fertilizers to improve the quality of her land

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El señor Sergio N. desde hace 3 años cuenta con un negocio de carpintería donde hace variedad de trabajos con la madera como lo es cuadros, cocinetas, respaldo para camas, y buros. Para seguir con su negocio el necesita comprar mas madera para seguir teniendo mas pedidos y así incrementa sus ventas.
Sergio aparte de su negocio trabaja en maquiladora para poder sustentar los gastos de la familia.
texts.en:
Three years ago Sergio N. began a carpentry business where he makes a variety of objects with wood such as frames, kitchen tables and chairs, headboards for beds, and bureaus. In order to continue with his business he needs to buy more wood in order to continue having more orders and in this way increase his sales.

In addition to his business Sergio works in a factory in order to be able to support his family’s expenses.

loans.use: Wood to stock his business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha Granados es una señora muy trabajadora y emprendedora, desde hace 3 años tiene un negocio de abarrotes donde ofrece todo en mercancía como lo es botanas, refrescos, lácteos y mas. Para incrementar sus ventas en esta temporada ella necesita comprar más mercancía.
texts.en: Martha Granados is a very hard-working and enterprising woman. She has had a grocery store business for three years, offering all kinds of merchandise such as snacks, soda pop, dairy products, and more. In order to increase her sales in this season she needs to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 29 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridas hijas Luz y Britney, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. El salón de belleza de Rosa es uno de los visitados de la ciudad de Juliaca, ella tiene un talento natural para cortarle el cabello a sus clientes, pero su fama principal y el motivo por el cual la buscan sus clientes, es por los novedosos cambios de looks que realiza y es que tiene un muy buen ojo para sacar la belleza de la gente a relucir. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre cuales son los estilos que están de moda, lleva 4 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el fuerte olor que despiden  los químicos con los que trabaja, aun así espera sacar adelante su salón de belleza y convertirla en la mejor de la ciudad de Kimbiri. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone a las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza para realizar un mejor trabajo en sus clientes.
texts.en: 29 year old Rosa is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her two beloved daughters Luz and Britney, who are the primary motive for all her efforts. Rosa’s beauty salon is one of the salons visited from those from the city of Juliaca. She has a natural talent for cutting hair, but her main fame and reason why clients seek her is for the contemporary styles she creates and she really has a good eye to discover the beauty in everyone. What she most likes about her work is counseling her clients about the cuts that are in style. She has been doing this for 4 years and considers having to put up with the strong odor by some of the chemicals she works with to be the most difficult part. She hopes to continue growing her beauty salon and converting it to the best in the city of Kimbiri. This is the ninth credit with MFP, and she is prepared to make all her payments on time, as she feels that she has a responsibility to the members of her communal bank, where she is very respected for the order she brings to the meetings. With the thousand nuevos soles from the loan, she will buy more beauty products in order to do better work with her customers.

loans.use: Buy more beauty products

loans.name: Luz Eliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Eliana; ella tiene 26 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de pan ,la socia elabora todo tipo de pan para luego venderlo en forma ambulatoria a sus clientes en la plaza de Urcos y  de esta forma poder sacar a su familia adelante ya que es la única actividad que realiza por el momento.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar pan como azúcar, harina,manteca entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “QORI ORCCO”. The bank is located in Urcos district, Quispicanchis province, Cusco state.

The member is Mrs. Luz Eliana;  she is 26 years old, married, and has 2 children. The member alternates her daily chores with her business selling bread. She makes all kinds of bread to then sell as a street vendor to her customers in the Urcos plaza and in this way she is able to support her family, and this is the only work she has at the moment.

The member seeks a loan to buy ingredients to make bread such as sugar, flour, butter, and more.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make bread such as sugar, flour, butter, and more

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia G. P. desde hace 2 años en su propia casa instalo su negocio de belleza para poner unas acrílicas  de todos tamaños y colores. La joven es madre de un pequeño por quien sale adelante para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida. Patricia comenta que en esta temporada navideña es cuando tiene mas citas, por lo que quiere estar preparada para que no le falte nada.
texts.en: Two years ago Mrs. Patricia G. P. opened a beauty salon in her house in order to provide acrylic nails of all sizes and colors to her clients. The young woman is a mother to one child for whom she wishes to offer a better quality of life in the future. Patricia comments that in this Christmas season is when she has more appointments, so she wants to be prepared so as not to be lacking any supplies.

loans.use: Stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica D. L. O R. cuenta con un negocio D. abarrotes llamado “Yessica”  desD. hace 7 años que se encuentra en su mismo hogar, pues elL. prefirió trabajar en su casa para no desatender a su familia. Verónica desea el crédito para comprar mas mercancía para que en esta época naviD.ña sea incrementadas sus ventas.
texts.en: Verónica D. L. O R. has had a grocery business called “Yessica” for 7 years. The business is located in her home, as she preferred to work from her home so as to not leave her family unattended. Verónica wishes to use the loan to buy more merchandise so that her Christmas holiday season will have increased sales.

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Ericka Dalia

texts.es:
Ericka de 33 años, es una mujer trabajadora que hace 10 años atrás aprovecho el dinero de una pequeña herencia y ubico en la parte delantera de su casa una pequeña papelería.      

Viviendo en una zona periurbana ha trabajado en su papelería con esfuerzo y dedicación para mantener a su hijo y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su familia. En la actualidad vende juguetes $ 10.00, ropa, libros a $ 3.00, cuadernos $ 1.00, plumas a $ 0.30, papelería. Se levanta a las 06h00am alistar a su hija para que se vaya a la escuela y después atiende su papelería. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene para atender su papelería es la delincuencia que  hay en el sector ya que hace semanas atrás le quisieron robar en el negocio. 

Quiere con el préstamo comprar vitrinas, ropa y zapatos para diversificar un poco su papelería. En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa y ubicar un local de ropa en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Ericka, 33, is a hardworking woman who took advantage of a small inheritance 10 years ago to set up a little stationery store in the front area of her house.

Living in a peri-urban area, she has worked in her stationery store with great effort and dedication to support her child and help her husband with family 
expenses.  She currently sells toys for $10.00, clothing, books for $3.00, notebooks for $1.00, pens for $0.30, and stationery.  She gets up at 6:00 am to get her child ready for school, and then she works in her store.  One of the problems she has is crime in the area.  A few weeks ago, some people tried to rob her in the store.

Ericka wants to buy display cases, clothing and shoes with the loan money so she can diversify her store a little.  In the future she would like to improve  her home's construction and set up a clothing store in the city center.

loans.use: Display cases, clothing, shoes

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco.

Her name is Modesta, and she is 39 years old.  Modesta lives with her common law husband and has two children.  During the day, Modesta is a street vendor selling cooked eggs around her house.  Most nights, Modesta will sell typical Peruvian food in the center of Cusco.  She plans on investing the loan to buy food products to cook in both of her food sales businesses.

She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in Food Sales Business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco.

Her name is Nilda, and she is 33 years old.  Nancy lives with her common law husband and has two children.  Her business is selling shoes wholesale in Cusco, Peru.  She is taking out the loan to reinvest in her shoe sale business, where she buys shoes such as sandals, tennis shoes, dress shoes, and kid´s shoes in bulk from distributors.  

She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in Wholesale Shoe Business

loans.name: Rosmery Susan

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosmery; ella tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de artesanía como chompas, guantes, chalinas, pantalones entre otros mas, a la vez la socia compra lana para elaborar chompas de colegio en campaña escolar,la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por su familia. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio y así tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Qori Orcco communal bank.  The bank is located in Urcos District, which belongs to Quispicanchis Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Ms.Rosmery.  She is 25 years old, lives with her partner and has one son.  She alternates daily activities with her business selling handcrafted items like sweaters, gloves, scarves and pants, among other things.  She also buys wool to make school uniform sweaters during the school year.  She is a very happy person and really wants to move ahead for her family.

Rosmery is asking for the loan to expand her business and have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: Expand her business and have more product variety to offer customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Payment for car repairs

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a young man from Nablus who has a grocery store in the eastern part of the city. Yousef rented the store two years ago and since then the number of clients has increased rapidly. 

Yousef wants to increase the variety of goods he sells in the store, where he stands in the picture. He wants to include cleaning and hygiene products, Yousef received a $1,000 loan for this purpose. Yousef's store is located next to his house, which makes his brothers willing to help when he is out of the store.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods he sells

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco, Peru.  Her name is Lourdes and she is 30 years old.  Lourdes lives with her common-law husband and has one child.  She has a business buying and selling clothes.  

With this loan, Lourdes plans to invest in her clothing business, using it to purchase more inventory.  Lourdes will purchase clothes such as jackets, sweatshirts, t-shirts, and children clothing from wholesale markets in Lima, Peru, and then resell them in the local markets here in Cusco.  

She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: Humberto, de 29 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposa Margarita de 27 años y de su pequeña hija; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Desde hace 2 años, este emprendedor hombre se desempeña como carpintero, y le gusta mucho su labor pues sabe que los diversos muebles en madera que realiza son de calidad. Trabaja durante todos los días útiles de la semana, de 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde  en el taller ubicado en su casa, pues es un negocio familiar, en ese lugar labora junto a su suegro y cuñados. Realizan muebles en madera, además de otros pedidos y las ganancias que obtienen son regulares y se las reparten entre todos. Esta muy contento con su labor que  la desempeña desde muy joven, y de esta manera puede ofrecerle una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia. Como siempre piensa en el futuro, por lo que ya tiene pensado instalar una carpintería en un local, y así independizarse, pues quiere mejorar sus ingresos. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Humberto tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado, en la compra de cantidad de madera que necesita para concretar un gran pedido, de esta manera espera seguir adelante.
texts.en: 29 year old Humberto lives in his own house with his wife Margarita, 27 years old, and their small daughter. Together they work every day to get ahead. For 2 years this enterprising man has worked as a carpenter, and he enjoys his work very much as he knows that the various pieces of wood furniture he makes are of quality. He works every day of the week, from 8 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon, in the workshop located in his house as this is a family business and in this place he works along with his father-in-law and brothers- in law. They make wood furniture, and in addition the orders and earnings they generate are constant and split between them. He is very content with this work he has been doing since he was very young, and in this way he can offer an adequate quality of life to his family. He is always thinking about the future, which is why he is thinking of opening a carpentry shop in a new location, becoming independent, as he would like to increase his earnings. This is his second credit with MFP and he promises to make the payments on time, as he doesn’t want to disappoint those who made this support possible that will permit him to continue working for the future. Humberto has planned to invest the loan, buying a quantity of wood that he needs to complete a large order, and in this way he hopes to continue on with his business.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maritza; ella tiene 37 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de venta de pan, la socia elabora pan y lo vende en forma ambulatoria en la plaza de Urcos, la socia lleva años en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio como harina,manteca,azúcar entre otros mas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Qori Orcco communal bank.  The bank is located in Urcos District, which belongs to Quispicanchis Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Ms. Maritza.  She is 37 years old, lives with her partner and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her bread-selling business.  She makes bread and sells it as a traveling saleswoman in the plaza at Urcos.  She has had this business for several years, and she is happy because she can make ends meet for her family.

Maritza is asking for the loan so she can buy supplies like flour, lard, sugar and other items for her business.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: Buy supplies such as flour, lard, sugar, etc. for her business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district in the province of Cusco.

Her name is Luisa, and she is 51 years old. Luisa is married and has one child. She has her own toy shop and also buys and sells clothes and bedding (sheets and bedspreads). She is requesting the loan to invest in her two businesses so that she can buy stock of toys, clothes and bedding at cheaper prices from Lima.

She is very happy with the loan granted and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy stock for her toy store and clothes & bedding business

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Ana Cecilia; ella tiene 35 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de venta de pan, la socia elabora pan y lo vende en forma ambulatoria en la plaza de Urcos, a la vez tiene su negocio de pasamanería donde vende shampus, jaboncillos, pilas, baterías, linternas entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar instrumentos musicales ya que su pareja tiene su propio grupo musical llamado Los Delfines del Amor y mediante este préstamo ella puede ayudarle a su esposo y también solicito el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Qori Orcco communal bank.  The bank is located in Urcos District, which belongs to Quispicanchis Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Ms. Ana Cecilia.  She is 35 years old, lives with her partner and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling bread.  She makes bread and sells it as a traveling saleswoman in the plaza of Urcos.  Ana Cecilia also has a pasamanería (variety of small items) store where she sells shampoos, soaps, batteries, flashlights and other items.  She has had this business for several years, and she is happy because through this business she makes ends meet for her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy musical instruments because her partner has his own music group called Los Delfines del Amor.  Through this loan she can help her husband, and she is also asking for the loan so she can buy supplies for her business.

Ana Cecilia is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: Purchase musical instruments for her husband's band and buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalia belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children. Natalia is a street vendor selling toys. She also sells food in the mornings in the bus terminal to Quillabamba, Peru. She is requesting the loan to invest in her businesses. Natalia is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in toy sale and food business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 34 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Luis de 36 años y sus 2 pequeñas hijas; juntos se esfuerzan mucho por salir adelante. Hace más de 4 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la fabricación de polos y estampados en prendas de vestir, en el taller que tiene en su casa. En su negocio  produce junto a su hermana y esposo, es por esta razón que esta  muy satisfecha pues vende los polos al por mayor a los grandes emporios comerciales de la ciudad, y obtiene regulares ganancias. Para el futuro tiene pensado ampliar el negocio, pues algún día sueña con empezar  a exportar sus prendas, pues sabe que son de alta calidad. Lo que no le gusta de su labor es que a veces le falta material para cumplir con tanta demanda que tiene. Además paralelamente durante las mañanas se dedica a la enseñanza  en una escuela de educación inicial ubicada por su zona, y también recibe un pago mensual por el desempeño como profesora. Es el 12avo  crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Ana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de tela, que necesita para continuar fabricando sus polos; pues tiene un gran pedido por concretar. Además invertirá en la compra de algunos materiales educativos que necesita para implementar mejor el colegio donde trabaja.
texts.en: Ana, 34 years old, lives in her own home with her husband Luis, 36 and their 2 young daughters; together they work hard to get ahead. More than 4 years ago, this enterprising woman started making polo shirts and printed clothing, in the workshop that she has in her home. In her business she works with her sister and husband, this is why she is very satisfied when she sells polo shirts wholesale to the big department stores in the city, and earns regular profits. In the future she is thinking of expanding the business, as one day she dreams of beginning to export her garments, as she knows they are of high quality. What she doesn't like about her job is that sometimes she lacks the material to fulfill everything with such the demand that she has. In addition in parallel during the mornings she teaches at a school for pre-school education located in her area, and she also receives a monthly payment for her duties as a teacher. This is the 12th loan that she has had with MFP and she promises to make her repayments punctually, as she doesn't want to lose face with the people who are making this support possible which will allow her to continue working in search of progress. Ana has plans to invest the requested loan in purchasing material, which she needs to continue making her polo shirts; as she has a big order to fulfill. In addition she will buy some educational materials that she needs to improve her resources at the school where she works.

loans.use: To buy more material to keep making polo shirts.

loans.name: Ruth Sotera

texts.es: La. sr. Ruth es una persona muy honrada y muy respetuosa ella tiene un puesto de abarrotes en su casa, el motivo del prestamo de la sra. Ruth es para compra de mercancia de su tienda ya que es el medio´por el cual sale para sus gastos ya que ella tiene 2 hijos que estan a su cargo, de abarrotes, ella no trabaja ya que tiene dos pequeñines que tiene que cuidar el esposa de la sr. Ruth trabaja todo el dia, ella quiere salir adelante por si sola pero necesita comprar mas mercancia para su negocio.
texts.en: Ruth is a very honest and very friendly person. She runs a general store at home and she requests a loan to buy merchandise for her store. This business allows her to take care of her family, as she is responsible for her two small children.  The grocery business is her only income and she works all day; she wants to get ahead on her own and now she needs this loan to restock her store.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 39 years old, married and has five children. She works as a tour guide in Cusco, and also has her business transporting wood and petrol from Puerto Maldonado to Cusco, Peru. She buys both wood and petrol wholesale in Puerto Maldonado and resells them here in Cusco. She is taking out the loan to invest in her transportation business. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her transport business

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchi y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Hernán; el tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pan, el socio elabora los panes para luego distribuirlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, y a la vez vende en forma ambulatoria al público en general, el socio lleva años en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para su negocio como harina, manteca, azúcar entre otros más.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hernán is a member of the "Qori Orcco" community bank which is located in Urcos district, in Quispicanchi province, in Cusco department.

Hernán is 38 years old and lives with his partner and four children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling bread.  He makes bread which he then delivers to his customers who have requested it.  He also sells as an itinerant street vendor to the general public.  He has been in this business for years and feels happy because this is how he gets his family ahead in life.

Hernán is requesting this loan to buy supplies for his business such as flour, butter, sugar, etc.  He is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his business such as flour, butter, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Jimena

texts.es: La señora Jimena S. Ordoñez tiene 32 años es madre soltera con dos hijos Abigail Lorena de 15 años y el pequeño Juan de 2 años; viven en su casa propia  en la zona del barrio del plan 3000 una de las zonas pobres de Santa Cruz De La Sierra. La señora trabaja en una empresa de transporte en el área de despacho de cargas, es una de las personas más responsables, que trabaja en dicha empresa pero sus ingresos son bajos. La señora Jimena requiere el dinero para poder ampliar su casa ya que es muy pequeña y así poder darle un mejor ambiente a sus hijos en el cual puedan vivir y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida, y sus hijos se puedan tener todas las comodidades como una familia normal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jimena S. Ordoñez, 32, is a single mother of two children: Abigail Lorena, 15, and little Juan, 2. They live in their own house in the Plan 3000 neighborhood, one of Santa Cruz De La Sierra’s poor areas.  She works at a transportation firm in the shipping department.
