She is one of the most responsible persons working at said firm but her income is low.

Jimena needs funds to enlarge her house because it is very small and she wants a better environment where her children can live and improve their quality of life so that her children will have all the comforts like a normal family.

loans.use: To enlarge her dwelling.

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es: Antolina, de 51 años, vive al lado de su esposo Edgar de 45 años, que es ingeniero,  y de sus tres hijos, de los cuales solo se hace cargo de los dos últimos, pues el mayor ya trabaja y se mantiene. Hace más de 3 años, asta empeñosa mujer trabaja todos los días en la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa. Le gusta mucho su labor pues la desempeña desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche; y durante los fines de semana la ayudan sus hijos, dice que esta muy satisfecha ya que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Le gusta mucho atender su negocio pues mientras trabaja tranquila no descuida sus labores del  hogar, además comercializa  diversos jugos que prepara en su casa, pero solo lo hace por pedidos. Como es una dama que siempre piensa en el futuro, en adelante quiere ampliar el negocio para mejorar sus ganancias. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Antolina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería (como panetones, chocolates, tarros de leche) que necesita para surtir su tienda, pues quiere ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes, durante esta campaña navideña que ya esta próxima.
texts.en: Antolina, age 51, lives with her husband Edgar, age 45, who is an engineer, as well as their three children. Only the younger two are in their care, given that the eldest son is already working and takes care of himself. For over three years, this industrious woman has been working daily in a grocery shop that she runs from home. Antolina likes her work a lot. She starts at 8 in the morning and works till 10 at night. On weekends, her children help her out. She is quite content because this business allows her to have regular income and help her husband with paying household expenses. Another reason Antolina likes her business is that she can at the same time take care of her household chores which gives her peace of mind. In addition, she also sells various kinds of juices that she makes at home, but she only does this work to specific orders. Given that Antolina is a woman who always thinks about the future, she is already interested in expanding her business to improve her income. This is Antolina's seventh loan with MFP and she promises to be timely with repayment, especially because she does not want to let down the people who have made this financial support possible -- support that allows her to keep working and to search for ways to make progress with her business. Antolina plans to invest the funds into the purchase of inventory, items such as panettones (a type of dessert bread), chocolates, and milk that she needs to stock her store. Antolina would like to offer the best service to her clients during the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase store inventory such as panettones, chocolates, and milk.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Feliciano; el tiene 56 años de edad es viudo  y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos como papa, maíz, cebada, para luego venderlos a sus clientes en el mercado de Urcos, a la vez el socio tiene su negocio de tienda naturista el vende todo tipo de medicamentos elaborados de plantas naturales para diferentes enfermedades, el socio es una persona alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos para su negocio y para aperturar un restaurante.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Feliciano belongs to the “Qori Orcco” Communal Bank, located in the Urcos district, Quispicanchis provonce, Cusco department. He is 56 years old, a widower, and has 2 children.

Feliciano alternates his daily activities between negotiating the purchase of products such as potatoes, corn, and onions, to later sell these goods to his customers in the Urcos market. At the same time, Feliciano has a natural products store and sells all types of medicines made from natural plants for different illnesses. He is a happy person with much desire to get ahead.

Feliciano is requesting a loan to buy more products for his business and to open a restaurant. He is glad for the loan and promises to comply with the schedule of repayments.

loans.use: TO BUY MORE PRODUCTS FOR HIS BUSINESS AND TO OPEN A RESTAURANT

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco.

Her name is Susana, and she is 23 years old. Susana has a common-law husband and one child. Susana buys electronic appliances for the home from Tacna, Peru—near the border with Chile—and sells them in Cusco. For example, she will buy and sell blenders, microwaves, and televisions in the street in Cusco. She is requesting the loan to invest in more inventory for her business.

She is very happy with the loan granted and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in her household appliance business

loans.name: Marleny Liliana

texts.en: Marleny belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 28 years old. She and her common-law husband have three children. Marleny is a street vendor in Baratillo: a few blocks in Cusco where street vendors gather to sell their wares.  She sells energy-saving light bulbs and will use the loan to invest in her business, buying more light bulbs to sell. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Buy light bulbs to sell

loans.name: Roxana

texts.en: Roxana belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 38 years old. She and her common-law husband have two children. She has a shop where she restores and repaints cars in the San Sebastian neighborhood of Cusco, Peru.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her business by buying more parts and paint for her body shop. Roxana is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in spare parts and paint for her auto repair shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes and pairs of shoes to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Leonada; ella tiene 44 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de venta de pollipapas, la socia vende en la plaza de Urcos, tiene su carreta donde todas las tardes a partir de las 5:00pm hasta las 10:00pm vende, la socia es una persona muy alegre y de esta manera saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para aperturar un restaurante y poder implementarlo con mesas, sillas, cubiertos, platos entre otros mas y  la vez también para comprar insumos para su negocio de pollipapá.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Qori Orcco". The bank is located in the district of Urcos, which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.
The member is Leonada. She is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. She combines her daily activities with her business selling pollipapas (a meal of chicken and potatoes). She sells in the market place in Urcos - she has a cart from which she sells her goods in the afternoons, from 5:00pm until 10:00pm. She is a very cheerful person and in this way she is moving her family forward in life.
The member is requesting a loan to open a restaurant and to be able to stock it with tables, chairs, cutlery, plates and other things and also to buy supplies for her polllipapas business. 
She is happy to have the loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: To open a restaurant and to supply it with tables, chairs, cutlery, plates, and other things and also to buy stock for her business selling pollipapas (a meal of chicken and potatoes).

loans.name: Capuyo Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Capuyo, le nombraron así porque es una flor que va renaciendo. Está ubicado en el Estado D. México. El grupo está conformado por nueve integrantes. ManueL. M. es L. tesorera del grupo. Tiene 38 años D. edad, estudió hasta L. preparatoria, es comerciante, está casada y tiene un hijo D. 12 años.ElL. inició en el ambito del comercio hace aproximadame 15 años, empezó vendiendo pan con sus vecinos y actualmente cuenta con una  tienda con L. cual ya tiene 2 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en algunos artículos que le hacen falta, tales como un refrigerador para lácteos, quiere agrandar su tienda ya que tiene muchos clientes y quiere tener aun más. Almomento D. solicitar este credito se siente orgullosa D. si y espera lograr su meta junto con su familia.
texts.en: The group is called Capuyo and they named it this because it is a flower that continues to be reborn. The group is located in the state of México and is maD. up of new members. ManueL. M. is the treasurer of the group. She is thirty-eight years old and studied up until high school. She is a business owner, married and has a son who is twelve years old. She started in the business world about fifteen years ago. She started by selling bread with her neighbors and she currently has had her own store for two years now. She requests the loan to invest in some things she doesn't have such as a refrigerator for dairy products. She also wants to make her store bigger because she has a lot of customers and she wants to have even more. She feels very proud for requesting the loan and hopes to reach her goal with the support of her family.

loans.use: To make her business grow.

loans.name: Janeth Martha

texts.en: Janeth belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 29 years old and separated with one child. She sells cell phones, parts and accessories from a stand in “El Hueco.” On the weekends, she is a street vendor selling her wares in Baratillo in Cusco, Peru. She is requesting the loan to invest in her business. Janeth is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in a mobile phone business

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder, de 32 años, vive en la casa de su suegra en compañía de ella, su esposa y su pequeño hijo; juntos buscan que progresar cada día. Este laborioso  hombre se desempeña como chofer de un vehiculo de  transporte publico, desde hace 3 años. Trabaja todos los días, durante las mañanas y obtiene regulares ganancias por este trabajo que considera algo arriesgado por los constantes accidentes de transito que hay en la ciudad. Además paralelamente a esta actividad también se desempeña en la tienda de venta de comestibles que tiene su suegra en su casa; le ayuda durante 3 veces a la semana, sobretodo en las noches que debe cargar cajas de cerveza. Lo que no le gusta de esta actividad es que muchas veces no puede salir por no descuidar el negocio familiar; pero esta muy satisfecho con las considerables ganancias. Como es un hombre muy emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado instalar su propio negocio de venta de comestibles. Es el  octavo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiete quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Wilder tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de comestibles que necesita para surtir mejor su tienda, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Wilder is 32 years old. He lives in his mother-in-law's house along with her, his wife and young son. Together they strive to make daily progress. Wilder has worked very hard for three years as a public transportation driver. He works every day in the morning and earns a steady income doing what he considers a dangerous job due to the constant traffic accidents that occur in the city.  In conjunction with his job in public transportation, he also works three nights a week in a grocery store that is attached to his mother-in-law's house where he mainly stocks crates of beer. What he does not like about this job is that it prevents him from going out, as he cannot neglect the family's business. However, he is very content with the considerable earnings. Being a very enterprising man, in the future Wilder plans to open his own grocery store. This is his eighth loan through MFP and he is committed to making the payments on time so as to not jeopardize the trust of those who made possible the loan that will allow him to continue working and progressing.  Wilder plans to use the requested loan to purchase the necessary amount of groceries to better stock his store. In this way he hopes to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase goods to stock his store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 42 years old and has a common-law husband and five children. Juana has a business making and selling furniture in the Baratillo part of Cusco, and also will accept and fill specific orders from customers elsewhere. Additionally, Juana has a washing and dry-cleaning business in her house. She is asking for the loan to invest in raw materials for her furniture business. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her furniture-making business

loans.name: Monte Fresco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mote Fresco lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Reyna Isabel A. quien se dedica al comercio de ropa negocio que inicio con poco y ha ido creciendo poco a poco.
Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo en especial en mercadería como pantalones, blusas, zapatos, suéter entre otros. 
Las otras integrantes son  Marisol F. quien realiza sopas los fines de semana y fritanga, ella con el préstamo invertirá en materia prima y Norma A. mini pulpería e invertirá en chiberias, granos básicos, papel higiénico…etc.
texts.en:
The group Monte Fresco is composed of three hardworking, courageous, and entrepreneurial women who are from the capital, Managua. The coordinator of the group is Señora Reyna Isabel A., who sells clothing. She began this business with very little, and it has been growing little by little. 
She will invest the loan in her business so that it can continue growing; in particular, she will invest in pants, blouses, shoes, and sweaters, among other items.

The other members are Marisol F., who makes soups and fritters on weekends and will invest the loan in basic ingredients, and Norma A., who has a mini-market and will invest in snacks, basic grains, toilet paper, etc.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 61 años de edad, viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de pescado y pollo en el mercado de Urcos, esta es la única actividad que realiza la socia y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas pollo,pescado y pavo para estas fiestas navideñas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Qori Orcco communal bank.  The bank is located in Urcos District, which belongs to Quispicanchis Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Ms. Juana.  She is a 61-year-old widow with five children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling fish and chicken in the market of Urcos.  This is her only job, and this is how she makes ends meet for her family.

Juana is asking for the loan to buy more chicken, fish and turkey for the Christmas holidays.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: Buy more chicken, fish and turkey for the Christmas holidays

loans.name: Yeni

texts.en: Yeni belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 38 years old and single with no children. Yeni is a street vendor selling toys, clothes, and shoes. She will traves to Tacna, Peru, a town on the Chilean border, to purchase more toys, clothes, and shoes once she receives the loan. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her toy, clothes, and shoe sales business

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a young man from Tulkarem, Ahmed and his brothers own a carpentry shop where they make furniture such as tables, chairs, beds, doors and windows. 

Ahmed took a loan from the FATEN branch in Tulkarem (where he appears in the picture) to buy wood and make more furniture. Ahmed and his brothers always try to meet deadlines and ensure the best furniture quality.

loans.use: To purchase wood for furniture making

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.en: Rosmery belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 22 years old and separated with one child. Rosmery’s business is selling stuffed animals and clothes. She has a shop in the Baratillo part of Cusco, Peru and is requesting the loan to buy more inventory — jackets, t-shirts, pants, and stuffed animals — for her shop. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in Clothing Sales Business

loans.name: Las Hormiguita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Hormiguitas lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Blanca Rosa A. quien tiene un pequeño y modesto taller de costura actividad 	que realiza desde hace 7 años por medio de un proyecto de la alcaldía de Managua.
Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo en especial adquirir un máquina de coser, mantenimiento y materia prima como en telas, dacron, listones, cedinas (hilos) y botones etc.  
Las otras integrantes son María Aurelia García propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 14 años e invertirá en granos básicos y productos de higiene personal (cepillo de dientes, pasta dental, jabon de baño etc.) y Oneyda R. quien vende cosméticos en los que invertirá el crédito en especial perfumes, body, aretes, pulseras, tratamientos para el cabello etc.
texts.en:
The group Las Hormiguitas (literally, "the little ants" but colloquially "very thrifty people") consists of three hard-working, courageous, and entrepreneurial women from the capital, Managua. The coordinator of the group is Señora Blanca Rosa A., who has a modest little sewing workshop. She set up this business 7 years ago by means of a project of the Managua mayor's office. She will invest her loan in her business in order to continue growing, Specifically, she wants to acquire a sewing machine, maintenance, and basic materials such as fabrics, dacron, ribbons, threads, buttons, etc.

The other members are María Aurelia García, proprietor of a grocery store for 14 years, who will invest in basic grains and personal hygiene products such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, bath soap, etc.; and Oneyda R., who sells cosmetics and will invest her loan particularly in perfumes, bodysuits, earrings, bracelets, hair products, etc.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Yonny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yonny; ella tiene 23 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche entre otros productos más, de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Qori Orcco communal bank. The bank is located in the Urcos district which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.

Yonny is 23 years old and has a live-in partner and two children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business where she sells basic needs items such as rice, sugar and milk, among other items. This is how Yonny gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to set up her store more.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan repayments.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 20 years old and single with children. Her business is selling clothes such as sweatshirts, t-shirts, underwear, and pants in Cusco. She buys the clothes wholesale in Juliaca, Peru and resells them on the street here in Cusco. She is requesting the loan to go to Juliaca to buy more inventory. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her cothing sales business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 59 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, es viuda,  vive en su casa propia con sus 3 hijos de los 9 que tiene. Siendo sola,  tuvo que trabajar duro y parejo para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ocupándose así en  diversas actividades. De entre todas, lo que más le gustaba desarrollar, fue el servicio de lavado de ropa a domicilio. De esa amanera solo acumulaba algunas ganancias, con ello fue educando a sus hijos. Pero a medida que pasó el tiempo, quiso ganar más, así que se propuso comprar su lavadora y se compró uno de segundo uso, desde entonces su labor es más productiva y rentable. En adelante, quiere terminar de construir su casa y acondicionar  un lugar para desarrollando dicha actividad. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que asegura que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará accesorios para mandar a reparar su lavadora.
texts.en: Ana is a very happy and hardworking 59-year-old mother.  She is widowed and lives in her own house with three of her nine children.  Being single, she had to work hard and consistently to get her children ahead, which is why she kept herself busy with various activities.  Of all of them, what she has liked most was the home clothes washing service.  She only earned some money through this, which she used for her children’s education.  As time passed, however, she wanted to earn more so she decided to purchase a used washing machine.  Since then, her work has been more productive and profitable.  In the future, she wants to finish building her house and set up a place to do her work.  This is her second loan with MFP and she is sure that this loan will be very beneficial to her business’ development.  With the loan requested, she will buy accessories to fix her washing machine.

loans.use: To purchase accessories and spare parts to fix her washing machine

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. She is 31 years old and has a common-law husband and one child. She is a street vendor who makes and sells silver jewelry: bracelets, necklaces, and rings.  She is requesting the loan to purchase more inventory and raw materials to support her business. Justina is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her jewelry business

loans.name: Lluvia De Oro Group

texts.es: Banco de emprendimiento  que se encuentra en su 2do ciclo integrado por 8 integrantes los cuales todos viven en la zona de San José  La Presidenta la Sra. Paola vive en esta comunidad hace 4 años ella es empleada educadora   en Santa Cruz, su estado civil es soltera y cuenta con 1 hijo ella sola mantiene el hogar, es una señora muy amable y preocupada por el bienestar de su hija, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de electrodomésticos para su casa, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora,  todos los clientes se sienten muy agradecidos con la entidad financiera por  haberles otorgado el crédito y depositar su  confianza en ellos y abrirles las puertas cuando ellos mas lo necesitaban.
texts.en: This borrowing bank is in its second cycle, made up of 8 members who all live in the San Jose La Presidenta zone. Mrs. Paola has lived in this community for 4 years and is employed as a teacher in Santa Cruz. She is single and has one child. She maintains the household on her own. She is a very likeable woman who is very concerned for her daughter's well-being. She will use the money from this loan in the purchase of home electronics for her home. She is a very responsible and hard-working woman. All of the members are very grateful to the financial institution for having authorized this loan and put its confidence in them, opening doors when they most needed it.

loans.use: the purchase of home electronics

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes, 40, is a member of the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco.

Luisa has a common law husband and three children. Her business is the buying and selling of tires in Cusco. She is requesting the loan to purchase more inventory for her tire shop. She is very happy with the granted loan and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in her tire business.

loans.name: Las Leo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Leo lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Leonor L. quien se dedica al comercio en general desde ropa usada, electrodomésticos, helados…etc.  y licor desde hace 20 años. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo con el podrá adquirir mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería aprovechando las fiestas.
Las otras integrantes son  Maria G. quien vende comida y Modesta D. vende mercadería en general como ropa, zapatos, pinolillo…etc.
texts.en: The Las Leo group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women from the capital of Managua. The group coordinator is Mrs Leonor Lopez, who has sold general merchandise such as used clothing, home electronics, ice cream...etc. and liquor for over 20 years. She will invest the loan in her business with the goal of continuing its growth. She will be able to acquire a larger amount and variety of merchandise, thus benefiting from the holidays. The other members are Maria G., who sells food, and Modesta D., who sells general merchandise such as clothing, shoes, cornstarch...etc.

loans.use: merchandise

loans.name: Anconeras Emprendedoras Group

texts.en:
The communal banking group "Anconeras Emprendadoras" has ten members who all live in Ancon - a neighborhood north of Lima. Their name translates to "Enterprising Residents of Ancon", in so far as all members are working hard to grow their businesses.
 
The president of this communal banking group is Eloisa. She has five adult children and is 66 years old. Eloisa sells clothing door-to-door to her neighbors - her most popular items are T-shirts and pants. She also has a sewing machine and repairs clothing as a siD. business. With this loan, Eloisa plans to purchase a variety of fashion T-shirts to sell for the summer season here in Peru. In the future, Eloisa would like to obtain display windows to place outsiD. her home to make her house into more of a proper clothing store.

* La Sra. Eloisa Rugel es la tercera D. la derecha (paradas)

loans.use: COMPRA DE POLOS PARA EL VERANO

loans.name: Isabel Reyna

texts.en:
Isabel, 29, is a member of the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco.

Isabel is married and has two children. She sells candies, nuts, drinks and other snacks off a push cart on the street in Cuzco. She also is involved in the sale of beauty products from catalogs. She sells Avon, Dupre and Esika products and delivers them to her customers. She is requesting the loan to invest in both her businesses.

She is very happy with the granted loan and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in snack cart and beauty product sale businesses.

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es: La. Sra. Armandina es una persona muy honesta y responsable, ella es madre soltera, ella quiere el prestamo por que necesita comprar mercancia ya que es el unico medio que tiene para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella tiene una estetica corta cabello ahí en su casa, ella es una persona seria el cual lucha por sacar adelante a sus pequeñines ya que son todo para ella, ella quiere el prestamo ya que quiere ver su estetica completa.
texts.en: Sra. Armandina is a very honest and responsible person. She is a single mother. She wants the loan because she needs to buy merchandise for her business, since it is the only means that she has to raise her children. She has a beauty salon and cuts hair in her home. She is a reliable person who struggles to raise her little ones, since they are everything to her. She wants the loan because she wants to see her salon completely stocked.

loans.use: Buy stock for her business

loans.name: Vianka Group

texts.es:
El grupo Vianka lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es Vianka J. quien tiene una tortillería y los fines de semanas vende nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo.
Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo en especial en maíz, cerdo, leña etc.
Las otras integrantes son  Alba Z. vende comida y Flor Díaz vende ropa usada.
texts.en:
The “Vianka” group is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial women from the capital, Managua. The coordinator for the group is Vianka J., who has a tortilla-making business and also sells nacatamales, made of corn and pork, on the weekend.

She will use the loan for her business with the goal of growing it. She will buy corn, pork, firewood, etc. 

The other members are Alba Z., who sells food, and Flor Díaz, who sells used clothing.

loans.use: To buy corn and pork

loans.name: Mashiel

texts.en:
Mashiel, 20, is a member of the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco.

Mashiel is single and doesn’t have any children. Her business is selling cell phones and accessories in “El Hueco”. She is currently studying gynecology in the main university of Cusco, UNSAAC. She is requesting the loan to not only support her in her studies but also to purchase more inventory to sell in “El Hueco”.

She is very happy with the granted loan and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in her mobile phone business.

loans.name: Karla Karen

texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco. Her name is Karla and she is 20 years old. Karla is single and doesn’t have any children.  

She is engaged in the sale of Christmas merchandise, from wrapping paper to Christmas bags and ribbons and other decorations. She buys her products wholesale on the border of Chile in Tacna, Peru. She also sells energy-saving light bulbs in the Baratillo section of Cusco. She plans on investing the loan in the purchase of more merchandise to sell for the holidays.

She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in Christmas merchandise

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
Wilber, 40, belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco.

Wilber has a common law wife and six children. His business is the sale of cell phones, cell parts and accessories for mobile phones in “El Hueco”.  He also is involved in the sale of used clothes in the Baratillo part of Cusco. He is looking to invest the loan in the purchase of more inventory for both of his businesses.

He is very happy with the granted loan and commits to making his payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in mobile phone and used clothes business.

loans.name: Las Pagadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Pagadoras lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Johana Núñez M. de 27 años quien es estilista desde hace 4 años. Ella aprendió este oficio con su cuñada la cual tiene un salón y luego se independizo y empezó a realizar trabajos a domicilio. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo en especial en cosméticos, exfoliantes, gel refrescante, pinturas, tintes etc.
Las otras integrantes son  Adela Dolores quien vende cosméticos y perfumes actividad en la que invertirá el crédito y Jaqueline del Socorro Anduraly quien comercializa repostería.
texts.en:
The “Pagadoras” group is made up of three hard-working and entrepreneurial women from the capital, Managua. The coordinator of the group is Johana Núñez M., who is 27 years old. She has been a stylist for 4 years. She learned this line of work from her sister-in-law, who has a beauty salon. She later started her own business and started doing hair styling in individuals’ homes. 

She will use the loan for her business so it can keep growing. She will buy cosmetics, exfoliants, gel, hair dyes, etc.

The other members are Adela Dolores, who sells cosmetics and perfume (these are what she’ll invest her loan in), and Jaqueline del Socorro Anduraly, who sells bakery items.

loans.use: To buy hair dyes, creams, beauty treatments, etc.

loans.name: La Union De Jaloxtoc Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama "La Unión de Jaloxtoc", se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Jaloxtoc, Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, este grupo está conformado por 8 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, las integrantes del grupo son Eufracia P. P. va a comprar con su crédito jabón, refrescos, azúcar, huevo, leche, frijol para surtir su negocio, la señora Martina Floriberta Vásquez Zalazar va a comprar jabón, azúcar, aceite, leche, galletas, dulces y frijol para surtir su negocio, la señora Estela B. H. va a comprar ropa interior de dama bikini, pantaletas, brasear para iniciar su negocio, la señora Juana H. López va a comprar refrescos, pan, jamón, mayonesa, aguacate, chiles en vinagre para preparar las tortas que vende, la señora Ángela H. López va a comprar refrescos, tortillas, carne, chiles, rábanos, tomates, jitomates para preparar los tacos, la señora María H. López va a comprar ropa interior para dama, blusas, pantalones, suéter etc. para empezar con su negocio, la señora Graciela Silvia M. C. va a comprar ropa blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas par empezar con el negocio, la señora Flavia Paula C. Pérez va a comprar pollo muerto par venderlo por pieza o entero. 
La señora Eufracia P. P. es la representante del grupo La Unión de Jaloxtoc, ella tiene 58 años de edad estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria tiene su certificado, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos Yasmin de 32 años de edad es maestra y es casada, Christian tiene 25 años de edad es soltero y trabaja, ella solicita un préstamo para surtir su tienda de abarrotes va a comprar jabón, aceite, refrescos, azúcar, huevos, leche, harina, arroz, frijol, harina, papas fritas, marínela, Gamesa, su tienda se llama abarrotes Yasmin, y ofrece a sus clientes jabón, papas fritas, pan dulce, refrescos, galletas, chocolates, dulces, papas fritas, huevos, aceite, azúcar, harina, arroz, este negocio lo inicio hace 35 años por necesidades económicas no alcanza el dinero, fue comprando poco a poco, su esposo le dio para comprar y comenzó vendiendo poquito y fue aumentando, fue invirtiendo hasta que la tienda estaba más surtida, su tienda esta en Jaloxtoc en su casa en Miguel Hidalgo No. 107. Ella está emocionada con el préstamo que le hacen porque va a poder surtir su tienda. Su negocio es importante porque de ahí sale para ir comiendo, la parte favorita de trabajar en este negocio es cuando hay ventas y tiene dinero, ella está orgullosa de que en ese lugar fue la primer tienda en este lugar no había ningún negocio, sus clientes son los vecinos, los niños, las señoras, los jóvenes. Su negocio es popular porque ya tiene mucho tiempo trabajando la tienda, los desafíos que enfrenta el negocio son los costos elevados, cuando no hay ventas y la competencia, ya que hay mas negocios junto al suyo.
Las ganancias del negocio las invierte otra vez, toman parte de su negocio su esposo y su hijo le ayudan a atender a los clientes, su negocio le ha ayudado en lo económico para mejorar la alimentación, las mejoras que desearía hacer a su vivienda son poner la cancelería al 2º. Piso, sus sueños son poder arreglar bien su casa para que esté bonita y las mejorías que desea para sus hijos son que sean felices ya que tienen su carrera su hija es maestra y su hijo es ingeniero. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Les damos las gracia, y que hay personas que apoyan a mucha gente a salir adelante en los negocios, gracias por preocuparse por nosotros en los momentos que más lo necesitamos”. Jaloxtoc, es bonito donde vivo pasa un arroyito, siembran cebolla, maíz, cilantro, ejote y tienen 2 jagüeyes que tienen pescados.
texts.en:
This group is called "La Unión de Jaloxtoc" and it can be found in the community of Jaloxtoc, Ayala City, in Morelos state, Mexico.  This group is comprised of eight women who know one another and are neighbors.  The members of the group are:

Eufracia P. P. - she is going to use her loan to buy ham, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, milk, and beans to stock her business.

Martina Floriberta Vásquez Zalazar - she is going to buy ham, sugar, oil, milk, cookies, sweets, and beans to stock her business.

Estela B. H. - she is going to buy women's undergarments like bikinis, panties, and bras to start her business.

Juana H. López - she is going to buy soft drinks, bread, ham, mayonnaise, avocado, and chilies in vinegar to prepare the sandwiches she sells.

Ángela H. López - she is going to buy soft drinks, tortillas, meat, chilies, radishes, and tomatoes for preparing tacos.

María H. López - she is going to buy women's undergarments, blouses, pants, sweaters, etc. to start her business.

Graciela Silvia M. C. - she is going to buy clothing like blouses, pants, shirts, and skirts to start her business.

Flavia Paula C. Pérez - she is going to buy chickens to sell by the piece or whole.

Ms. Eufracia P. P. is the group representative for La Unión de Jaloxtoc.  She is 58 years old and studied through the sixth grade of primary school.  She has her certificate.  She is married and has two children: Yasmin, 32, is a teacher and is married; and Christian, 25, is single and works.

She is requesting a loan to stock her grocery store.  She will buy ham, oil, soft drinks, sugar, eggs, milk, flower, rice, beans, potato chips, marinades, and Gamesa brand cookies.  Her store is called "Abarrotes Yasmin" ["Yasmin's Groceries"] and she offers her clients products like ham, potato chips, sweet breads, soft drinks, cookies, chocolates, sweets, eggs, oil, sugar, flour, and rice.  She started her business 35 years ago out of economic necessity.  She didn't have enough money so she started buying products little by little, and her husband gave her money so she could start selling a little.  Her sales increased and she invested more until her store was better stocked.  Her store is located in her house on Miguel Hidalgo Street in Jaloxtoc.

Ms. Eufracia is excited about this loan, which she is taking out because it will make it possible for her to better stock her store.  Her business is important because it is how she puts food on the table.  Her favorite part of her work is when she makes sales and has money.  She is proud because her store was the first in her area.  Before, there wasn't any such business.  Her customers are her neighbors, children, women, and young people.  Her business is popular because she has been running her store for a long time.  The challenges she faces include higher costs, periods when there are few sales, and the competition, as now there are more businesses than just hers.

She reinvests the profits from her business.  Her husband and son also take part in the business by helping tend to customers.  Ms. Eufracia's business has helped her family economically and helped them to eat more nutritiously.

She would like to make improvements to her home, including adding aluminum detailing to the second floor.  Her dream is to be able to fix her house up well so that it is attractive.  She also hopes that her children will be happy and that they will have professional careers.  Her daughter is a teacher and her son is an engineer.

The members of La Unión de Jaloxtoc Communal Bank would like to say the following to Kiva and Fundación Realidad: "We thank you and you are people who support many individuals so that they can progress their businesses.  Thank you for caring for us in the moments when we need you most."

Jaloxtoc, where they live, is beautiful.  A stream passes through and there are two pools with fish. People plant onion, corn, cilantro, and beans.

loans.use: to buy ham, sugar, eggs, milk, beans, potato chips, cookies, and bread to stock her store

loans.name: Azucenas De San Antonio Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA AZUCENAS DE SAN A. PORQUE A LAS SEÑORAS LES AGRADAN MUCHO LAS FLORES AZUCENAS Y ESTÁ UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE SAN A. EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTÁ CONFORMADO POR 10 PERSONAS.LA SRA. CRISTINA A. ES UNA INTEGRANTE, TIENE 57 AÑOS, Y SE DEDICA  A LA VENTA DE VERDURA (NOPALES). ELLA TIENE EN TOTAL 8 HIJOS: 3 MUJERES Y 5 HOMBRES, ACTUALMENTE SÓLO UNO DEPENDE DE ELLA Y ES UN NIÑO DE 16 AÑOS QUE ESTÁ ESTUDIANDO LA PRIMARIA, SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE NOPALES YA QUE ACTUALMENTE SUBIERON DE PRECIO DEBIDO A LA ESCACES DEL PRODUCTO. ADEMÁS QUIERE INICIAR SU CULTIVO  PARA PODER OBTENER UNA MAYOR GANANCIA, SUS CLIENTES SON PRINCIPALMENTE DE ATLACOMULCO YA QUE ES EL LUGAR EN DONDE LAS PERSONAS DE LAS DIFERENTES COMUNIDADES SE CONCENTRAN PARA LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS DE ACUERDO A SU NECESIDAD. AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR EL CREDITO LA SRA. CRISTINA SE SIENTE MUY ENTUSIASMADA YA QUE PODRA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO, ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA QUE NO SE DA POR VENCIDA ANTE NINGUNA SITUACIÓN, SIEMPRE LO AFRONTA CON ENTUSIASMO. HACE POCO FALLECIO SU ESPOSO Y HA SABIDO VER LA MANERA DE SALIR A ADELANTE Y DARLE EDUCACIÓN A SU HIJO, ESPERA QUE EL LOGRE SUS OBJETIVOS Y QUE EN CUALQUIER COSA QUE HAGA LO REALICE BIEN Y CON MUCHA RESPONSABILIDAD.
texts.en: This group is called "Azucenas de San A." ["Lilies of San A."] because the women in this group really like that type of flower and because the group is located in the community of San A. in Mexico state. The group is comprised of 10 members. Cristina A. is one of them. She is 57 years old and sells vegetables, particularly nopales [prickly pear cactus]. She has eight children total: three girls and five boys. Only one - a 16 year old boy who attends primary school - is still dependent on her. Cristina is requesting this loan to buy nopales, as the price is currently high due to a scarcity of that product. She would also like to begin cultivating her own crops in order to bring in a better income. Most of her customers are from Atlacomulco, which is a place where people from different communities gather to buy whatever products they need. As she requests this loan, Cristina feels very excited that she will be able to invest in her business. She is a very hardworking person who does not give up in any situation; she faces anything with enthusiasm. Her husband died recently but she knows that the way to get ahead is to provide her son with a good education. She hopes that he will achieve his goals and that he will do well and act responsibly in whatever he does.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (prickly pear cactus)

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva, 40, belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco.

Eva is married and has six children. She is in business with her husband buying and selling mobile phones, parts and accessories. On the side, Eva also sells bedding (bedspreads, blankets and sheets) around Cusco. She is requesting the loan to invest with her husband in their cellular phone business and to purchase more bedding to sell.

She is very happy with the granted loan and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To invest in mobile phone and bedding businesses.

loans.name: Rosibel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosibel lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es Erlinda L. Obregon de 47 años se dedica a la venta de tortilla, bastimento por excelencia de los nicaragüenses y tiene una fritanga. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo en especial en maíz para las tortillas, carne para las enchiladas y frutas para los frescos. 
Las otras integrantes son  Rosibel F. de 38 años propietaria de una fritanga y María Godínez vende tortillas y frijoles cocidos.
texts.en: The Rosibel group is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women from the capital of Managua. The group coordinator is Erlinda L. Obregon, age 47, who sells tortillas- the signature food of Nicaraguans- and she has a food stand store. She will invest the loan in her business with the goal of continuing to expand, especially with corn for the tortillas, meat for the enchiladas and fruit for the drinks. The other members are Rosibel F., age 38, the owner of a food stand, and María Godínez, who sells tortillas and cooked beans.

loans.use: For corn, meat and fruit

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.en:
Dionicia, 47, belongs to the “Nueva Luz” cooperative bank, located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco.

Dionicia is married and has five children. She has a fruit and vegetable sale business in the Nogales market in Cuzco. Depending on the season, she will sell different fruits and vegetables that she buys locally. She also sells her wares in Urubamba and Ollantaytambo. She is looking to invest her loan in the purchase of more fruits and vegetables to sell.

She is very happy with the granted loan and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Soy Y Luna Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sol y Luna lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es Alvaro V. quien inicio con un taxi hace 2 años y hace poco los fines de semana destace cerdo con el fin de día a día salir adelante. 
El invertirá el crédito en sus negocios con el fin de seguir creciendo.
Las otras integrantes son  Maricela Solórzano quien tiene una fritanga y Yolanda del Carmen M. quien vende refrescos.
texts.en:
The Sol y Luna ["Sun and Moon"] group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising individuals from the capital city of Managua.  The group leader is Alvaro V., who started a taxi service two years ago.  Not long ago, he also started butchering pigs on the weekends in order improve his situation day by day.

He will invest this loan in his businesses, with the goal of continuing to grow.

The other members of the group are Maricela Solórzano, who has a small restaurant, and Yolanda del Carmen M., who sells soft drinks.

loans.use: to invest in his taxi service and pig butchering business

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela Rosa D. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien desde muy joven empezó a trabajar. Ella inicio un pequeño negocio hace  varios años tiene una pequeña y modesta pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación en el barrio San Judas.
Ella invertirá el crédito en gaseosa, aceite, arroz, pollo, carne, cerdo, perecederos, lácteos, cloro, jabón, detergente.
texts.en: Ángela Rosa D. is a hard-working and enterprising woman who started to work at a very young age. She started a small business a few years ago. She has a small and modest corner store in her home in the San Judas neighbourhood. She will invest this loan in pop, oil, rice, chicken, meat, pork, perishables, dairy products, bleach, soap and detergent.

loans.use: for pop, oil, rice, chicken, meat, pork, perishable goods, milk products, bleach, soap and detergent.

loans.name: El Monte De Joco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama EL MONTE DE JOCO porque las integrantes del grupo buscan el éxito cotidiano en su negocio, buscando  una oportunidad  de crecer y además está ubicadad en el municipo de Jocotitlan en el Estado de México,en México. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes.Rosa Q. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 43 años, estudió hasta la primaria, es ama de casa y tiene en total 4 hijos: 3 hombres y 1 mujer. Ella se dedica a la producción y comercialización de productos lacteos que inició hace 12 años. Solicita el prestamo para producir su mercancía y tener una variedad de productos que por lo regular sus clientes le demandan y evitar así que sus clientes le compren a otra persona  para satisfacer la necesidad que tienen en ese momento. Sus clientes  son personas del mismo barrio, en especial  de las cuadras aledañas, cada una prefiere comprar los productos  con ella , por la calidad y buen servicio que ofrece y la atención muy amable  de la señora. La  calidad de sus productos es la base por lo que los clientes la recomiendan, eso ayuda  a incrementar su M.  y siga creciendo en clientes y ganancias. Al momento  de solicitar este  préstamo se siente con mucha alegría de tener la oportunidad de invertir nuevamente. Su negocio es tan importante  ya que con ello puede salir adelante con los gastos de su familia y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This is the Monte de Joco Group whose members are seeking success everyday in their businesses and are looking for opportunities to grow them. The group got its name because it is located in the municipality of Jocotitlan in the State of Mexico in Mexico. The group is composed of 11 members.

Rosa Q. is one of them. She is 43, attended elementary school, is a housewife and the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. She has been producing and selling dairy products for 12 years. She applies for this loan to keep up the production and have a variety of products that her customers regularly ask for, so that they don't buy elsewhere. They are people from her neighborhood, usually living in the blocks nearby, and prefer to buy dairy products from her because of the quality and her good customer service and friendliness. Her customers recommend her because of the high quality of her products, which helps her increase her market share, her customer base and her earnings. When she applied for the loan, she was in high spirits because of the opportunity to invest again. Her business is important to her, since it allows her to provide for her family and thus have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy feed for her dairy animals

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es:
El grupo que acontinuación presento se llama "Lucero", es un grupo D. 9 mujeres D. L. localidad D. El Obraje, San Felipe del progreso, México. L. comunidad es una D. las mas cercanas al centro del municipio, se pueD. ir uno caminando por lo mismo que no esta retirada, las nuve mujeres son D. L. misma comunidad y son vecinas por eso se conocen muy  bien todas desD. niñas. Desiderion llamarle al grupo "Lucero" porqué una D. ellas volteo al cielo y se le ocurrio ese nombre, a todas les gusto como sonaba el nombre, su comunidad es granD. y por lo regular es gente con estudio, ahi viven muchos maestros y maestras, algunos profesionistas y es una D. las comunidades más avanzadas del municipio.

Las integrantes son las siguientes:
 Ana Lilia Guzman C. D. 36 años
 
 Esmeralda D. L. L. G. D. 29 años

 Nancy G. S. D. 32 años

 Lucero López S. D. 31 años

 Aurelia V. C. D. 43 años

 Josefina F. M. D. 38 años

 Modesta I. C. D. 55 años

 Ma Elena M. G. D. 51 años

 Margarita Hernández R. D. 49 años.

Doña Elena M. es L. representante del grupo "Lucero", tiene 1 niña D. 9 años estudia L. primaria en el centro D. San Felipe del Progreso, en total tuvo 5 hijos, 4 ya estan casados y viven con su familia, doña Elena es casada por el civil y L. iglesia, ya cumplió 35 años D. casada, vive con su esposo que trabaja en L. Comision Federal D. Electricidad, viven en casa propia hace unos 5 años porqué antes rentaban, ahora doña Elena aparte D. atender su casa venD. ropa, son chamarras y bolsas D. piel, tambíen venD. por catalogo zapatos.
Doña Elena le echa muchas ganas para tener dinero, tambíen quiere apoyar a su esposo porqué le faltan muchas cosas en su casa para tenerL. arreglada. Doña Elena no tiene un local, sale a vender casa por casa y tiene clientes, sus clientes son por lo regular maestros y L. gente que trabaja en L. presidencia del pueblo, no anda caminando porqué trae una camioneta y ahi carga sus cosas.
El prestamo que solicitó fue para comprar varios articulos que le hacian falta, ya los habia visto pero no los podia comprar,tambíen tiene encargos D. zapatos que comprar.
L. meta D. doña Elena es tener un local lleno D. mercancia, que el local este en el centro, y si cumple su meta elL. piensa que le va ir muy bien.
Con las ganancias D. su negocio las quiere ocupar para cubrir nesecidades y alomejor algun gusto, tambien piensa en su hijo y en que siga estudiando.
texts.en:
The following group is called "Lucero". It is a group of 9 women in the community of El Obraje, San Felipe del Progreso, México. The group is one of the closest ones to the center of town. You can walk there, so it isn't far. The nine women are from the same area and they are neighbors and thus they have known each other very well since they were children. They decided to call the group "Lucero" because one of them looked up at the sky and the name occurred to her. They all liked how the name sounded. Their community is large and in general the people are educated. A lot of teachers lives there, and some professionals. It is one of the most advanced areas of the city. The members are the following:

 Ana Lilia Guzman C., 36 years old 
 
 Esmeralda D. L. L. G.,  29 years old 

 Nancy G. S., 32 years old 

 Lucero López S.,  31 years old

 Aurelia V. C., 43 years old

 Josefina F. M.,  38 years old

 Modesta I. C., 55 years old

 Ma Elena M. G., 51 years old  

 Margarita Hernández R.,  49 years old 

Elena M. is the representative of the "Lucero" group. She has one 9 year old daughter, in primary school in downtown San Felipe del Progreso, In total she had 5 children. 4 are already married and living with their families. Elena was married civilly and through the Church. She has been married for 35 years. She lives with her husband, who works in the Federal Electricity Commision. They  have lived in their own home  for 5 years. Previously, they rented. Now Elena, besides taking care of her house, sells clothes. She sells leather jackets and purses and shoes as well via catalogue.  
Elena works very hard to have money. She also wants to support her husband because they lack many things in their house. Elena doesn't have a locale; she sells house to house and has customers. Her customers are normally teachers and people who work at city hall. She doesn't walk because she has a pick-up truck and she transports her things.  

The loan she asked for was to buy various items she needed, ones she had seen but coudn't buy. She also has shoe orders to buy. Elena's goal is to have a locale full of merchandise in the center of town. If she is able to acheive her goal, she thinks it will go very well for her. With the earnings from her business, she will pay for necessities and perhaps for something she likes.  She also plans on her son continuing to go to school.

loans.use: To buy leather jackets and shoes to sell via catalogue

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles Gáleo  es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien labora arduamente con el firme propósito de salir adelante. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio que consiste en  la venta de ropa usada el cual lo inicio hace 5 años con pequeña cantidad de productos.
Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de paca de ropa para con el fin de mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: María de los Ángeles Gáleo is a hard-working and enterprising woman who works hard with the firm intention of getting ahead in life.  She has a small business selling used clothes that she started 5 years ago with a small quantity of products.  She will invest her loan in buying a bundle of clothes with the aim of improving her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teresa del Carmen S. García tiene 58 años y comenzó a vender varios sabores de helado de coco, nancite, leche, maní y papaya. Con el tiempo, ella comenzó a invertir en productos cosméticos, ropa y otros productos que se venden a pedido del cliente.
Teresa es un ejemplo que demuestra que la perseverancia y el trabajo duro tienen sus recompensas. Ella quiere seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa del Carmen S. García is 58 years old.  She started selling different flavors of ice cream: coconut, 'nancite' (a berry native to Nicaragua), milk, peanut and papaya.  Over time, she also started investing in cosmetics, clothes and other products that her customers order from her.

Teresa is an example which shows that perseverance and hard work have their rewards.  She would like to continue working and to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde N.  es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien tiene un pequeño comedor el cual inicio probando de poco en poco y como vio que le iba bien fue creciendo. Ella invertirá el crédito en granos básicos, perecederos, frutas etc.
Ella tiene la meta de poder vender todos los días y no solo los fines de semana.
texts.en: Matilde N. is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has a small eatery.  She started her business trying things out, little by little, then saw that it was doing well and that it was growing.  Matilde will invest her loan in buying basic grains, perishables, fruit, etc.  Her goal is to be able to sell every day of the week and not just on weekends.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, perishables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for house maintenance

loans.name: Creativas 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama CREATIVAS 1, porque son mujeres que día a día salen adelante con su trabajo. Está ubicado en  Atlacomulco, Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes. Himelda S., es integrante del grupo. Tiene 26 años estudió carrera técnica, es enfermera y tiene 4 hijos: 3 hombres y 1 mujer. Ella se dedica a la venta de plantas desde hace 9 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar macetas y semillas, esto le va ayudar a mejorar su negocio con mayores rendimientos, crecimiento, calidad, competitividad y satisfacción del cliente en variedad de productos  (Malbon, Geranios, Agazanias, Pensamiento, Petunias, Noche Buenas, etc.). Es un objetivo a largo plazo, desea aumentar su productividad e invertir en plantas de sombra para aumentar su competitividad en el mercado. Observaciones: La señora Emma es la que se asoma en la foto, la segunda de izquierda a derecha.
texts.en: This group is called Creativas 1, because it is composed of women who progress everyday through their work. It is located in Atlacomulco in the State of Mexico. The group has 10 members. Himelda S. is one of them. She is 26, attended a vocational school, is a nurse and has four children: three sons and one daughter. She has been selling plants for 9 years. She applies for this loan to buy pots and seeds. This will help her improve the yield, growth and competitiveness of her business, the quality of her products and the satisfaction of her customers thanks to a greater variety of products (malvones, geraniums, gazanias, pansies, petunias, poinsettias, etc.). It is a long-term goal, she wants to increase her productivity and invest in shade plants to improve her competitiveness in the market. Note: Emma is the second lady on the picture, from left to right.

loans.use: To buy pots and seeds to increase her productivity

loans.name: Vilma Lisseth

texts.es:
Vilma Lisseth L. López  en  1992 inicio a  comercializar de manera ambulante ropa, zapatos, prenda y cosmético. Esta señora trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora ha sido beneficiada por Adim tanto por la oferta de crédito como con los programas de desarrollo empresarial  y autonomía personal que le ayudado a  tener mayor  libertad, a conocer y explotar sus capacidades, estar segura de sí misma y administrar su negocio.  
Ella invertirá su crédito para adquirir mercadería en ropa, zapatos, prendas, tinte, champú, desodorante, perfumes y con ello levantar las ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
In 1992 Vilma Lisseth L. López started selling clothes, shoes, garments and cosmetics as an itinerant street vendor.  This hard-working, enterprising lady has benefited from help from ADIM both through loans and through their business development and personal independence programs which have helped her to have more freedom, to be aware of and to exploit her skills, to be sure of herself and to run her business.

Vilma will invest her loan in acquiring merchandise: clothes, shoes, garments, dyes, shampoos, deodorants and perfumes to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To buy various merchandise

loans.name: Majdi

texts.en:
Majdi who lives in Hebron city has a poultry farm where he raises chicken for sale. Majdi provides stores with chicken. Majdi is married and has three sons aged two, four and seven.

Majdi took a loan from FATEN to purchase and install stalls. His farm is relatively new and still needs a lot of work; he started it one year ago.

Majdi who appears in the picture here takes care of the farm with his wife.

loans.use: Purchase and install chicken coops

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is the mother of three daughters and three sons, and her husband Rafeeq is a retired Palestinian Authority employee. As Fatima's husband doesn't work anymore, he decided to start a small business to have a better income.

Fatima and Rafeeq started a small grocery store using the husband's saving from when he was employed. They needed more money to cover goods and expenses, so Fatima came to FATEN and took a loan for this purpose.

Fatima's husband Rafeeq appears in the picture here as his wife is a religious woman who did not want to be photographed.

loans.use: purchase grocery store goods

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia G., 44, is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP every four months from these activities.

In 2010, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela G., 38, is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Carmela owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Carmela has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP every four months from these activities.

In 2010, Carmela joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI which she used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Carmela is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria R. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela.  She is 50 years old.  Maria is married and has 3 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Maria owns & operates a business raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale.  Maria has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP every five months.

In 2007, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI.  This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  Maria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Maria from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock.

loans.name: 46 - Thon 1 - Quang Hung Group

texts.en:
Thuong H. T. (113) is a 50 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Thuong is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 46 - Thon 1 - Quang Hung (18.01.46 Quang Hung).

Thuong is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Thuong owns and operates a business venture running a food stall.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling soft drinks in the local community.  Thuong has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,400,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Thuong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thuong has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,248,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thuong plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. T. Hong (115) is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.
