loans.name: María Anelida

texts.es:
María tiene 49 años de edad, es separada y reside junto a su familia en el sector 20 de Enero del distrito de Pomalca, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lleva más de 18 años vendiendo fruta en los exteriores del mercado del distrito en donde reside, ella suele adquirir su mercancía en el mercado Moshoqueque (el principal mercado mayorista de la Chiclayo) para luego venderla diariamente a sus clientes habituales. María trata de que la mercadería que ofrezca sea siempre fresca por lo que siempre se encuentra viajando a la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirirla.

Este establecimiento es la única fuente de ingreso familiar, motivo por el cual ella trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacar adelante su negocio, su buen trato y la calidad de sus productos ha hecho que su puesto sea uno de los preferidos por las personas que diariamente compran en ese lugar.

María se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de más fruta de estación para ampliar su negocio, ya que durante la temporada de verano su demanda suele aumentar. 

Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla, en aquella oportunidad ella pudo adquirir más fruta y su negocio puso salir adelante, por este motivo ella se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old.  She is separated and lives together with her family in the '20 de Enero' sector of Pomalca district, an agricultural area with regular commercial activity which is located 10 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

María has been selling fruit on the edge of the district market for more than 18 years.  She usually acquires her merchandise in Moshoqueque market (the main wholesale market in Chiclayo) and then sells it daily to her regular customers.  María tries to make sure that the merchandise she sells is always fresh, so she is always traveling to Chiclayo to acquire it.

This business is María's only source of family income.  For this reason, she tries to give the best of herself in order to make progress in her business.  Her good service and the quality of her products have made her stall one of the favorites amongst the people who shop daily in the market.

María is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to invest this money in buying more seasonal fruit so that she can expand her business since, during the summer season, demand usually increases.

María has already had a loan through Edpyme Alternativa's seed money that was financed by Kiva.  With that money she was able to acquire more fruit and make progress in her business.  For this reason, she is grateful to the people who work with her through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to expand her market sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene carga familiar, reside junto a sus padres en un sector urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona conocida a nivel nacional por su abundante movimiento de transporte y comercio, es la región Lambayeque.

Luis se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros). El brinda su servicio en la periferia de la ciudad y se vale de el para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su mototaxi ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunos daños que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a reparar su moto y a adquirir algunos accesorios adicionales.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 22 years old, he is single and he doesn’t have children. He lives with his parents in a suburban region of the city of Chiclayo. It is a region nationally known for its transportation services and commerce. It is in the region of Lambayeque. 

Luis provides transport services with a motorcycle rickshaw (a motorized vehicle which consists of a motorcycle equipped with a cabin where both cargo and passengers can be transported). He provides his services throughout the city. It is a valuable business because it covers his personal expenses and he is able to contribute to the household finances. 

Continuous use of the rickshaw has caused wear and mechanical breakdown and it needs urgent repair to keep it running. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles and it will help him repair the rickshaw and he will also purchase some additional accessories.

loans.use: To carry out maintenace repairs for his rickshaw.

loans.name: María Úrsula

texts.es:
María Ursula es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector Cruce Larán, una zona agrícola que pertenece al distrito de Monsefú. La zona se caracteriza por ser rural y por estar poblada de personas bastante humildes y trabajadoras, se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas a la agricultura. Ella cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde, junto a su esposo, suelen sembrar vegetales y diversos productos de panllevar. Los productos que cosechan los suelen vender en el mercado Moshoqueque, el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Adicionalmente María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en su domicilio. Los ingresos que ello obtienen de estas actividades los utilizan para sacar adelante a la economía de su familia.

María desea brindar mantenimiento y riegos a sus cultivos para asegurarse una buena cosecha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo y poder asegurar el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Ursula is a mother, she is 32 years old and she lives together with her husband and their three children in the Cruce Laran sector, an agricultural region within the district of Monsefu. The region is known for its rural setting and it’s the humble and hardworking population.  It is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo

She is an agriculturist. She has a small field where she and her husband sow vegetables and various other harvests.  The harvests they gather are sold in the market in Moshoqueque, the wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo. Maria is also involved in raising and selling small livestock from her home. The income she earns from these businesses is used for the financial support of the family. 

Maria wishes to maintain and irrigate her cultivations in order to ensure a good harvest. To this end she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles. With this loan she will continue to ensure the support of her family.

loans.use: To invest in her plantations.

loans.name: María Maribel

texts.es:
María Maribel tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el caserío La Arena, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Túcume, conocido a nivel regional por su atractivo turístico, ya que en su territorio existen varios complejos arquitectónicos que datan de épocas preincaicas. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral, ella cría sus animales en su domicilio alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya alcanzan un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside y al público en general. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda percibir mas ingresos por sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad ella también consiguió financiamiento para sacar adelante su negocio de crianza y venta y gracias a ello puedo obtener mayores ganancias que le permitieron mejorar su calidad de vida, por ese motivo María se encuentra agradecida con tosas las personas que colaboraron con ella a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Maria Maribel is 29 years old, she is single and she lives together with her family in the neighborhood of La Arena. It is a rural region belonging to the Tucume district. It is a national tourist area because there are various archeological sites dating prior to the Inca civilization. It is in the province of Lambayeque, about forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

She raises and sells foul. She raises her livestock in her home, feeding them grains and natural grasses. When the livestock have reached a certain level in their development she sells them to the merchants who visit the region and to the general public. The business helps her to contribute to the daily financial support of her family. 

Maria wishes to expand her business with the acquisition of more livestock and balanced feed in order to increase her sales. In order to meet her goal she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1100 nuevos soles.

She has had a previous Kiva loan through Edpyme Alternativa and its affiliate Capital Semilla. In that experience she requested a loan to support her livestock business and it is thanks to this loan that she was able to increase her profits, which resulted in the improvement in their quality of life. Maria is grateful to all of those individuals who contribute to her loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and feed.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el sector La Estancia del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Armando se dedica al cultivo y comercio de maracuyá. En la zona donde reside, el cultivo de esta fruta es bastante común y se está consolidando como una actividad productiva bastante rentable debido a que los agricultores se han agrupado en asociaciones, lo cual les permite tener mejores accesos al mercado nacional e incluso internacional. Adicionalmente siembra limón bajo la misma modalidad. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza en el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Armando desea brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de modo que pueda asegurarse una buena cosecha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Armando is a father, he is 29 years old and he lives together with his wife and children in the La Estancia sector of the district of Olmos. It is an agricultural and commercial region located in the province of Lambayeque, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

Armando is an agriculturist who harvests and sells passion fruit.  In the region where he lives the harvest of this fruit is common and this is becoming an important and profitable harvest because individual farmers have come together to form unions. They are able to have better access to the national and international market this way. He also harvests lemons under the same conditions. The income that he earns is used to the financial support of his family.

Armando wishes to maintain his plantations in order to ensure a good harvest. To this end he has requested a loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: To maintain his plantations.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofia tiene 72 años D. edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, resiD. junto a su esposo y a uno D. sus hijos en una zona marginal del distrito D. Cayaltí, la localidad se caracteriza por ser agrícola y por tener movimiento comercial considerable. Se encuentra ubicada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como comerciante en una bodega que tiene instalada en su vivienda desD. hace más D. veinte años. Ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos D. uso diario, ente abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad. Su negocio tiene bastante acogida entre la personas del lugar ya que suele ofrecer productos D. buena calidad y un buen trato a sus clientes.

Sofía desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería D. modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Sofia is 72 years old, married and has four children.  She lives together with her husband and one of her children in a poor area of Cayaltí district.  This is an agricultural area which has considerable commercial activity.  It is located more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Sofia works as a saleswoman in a small grocery store which is located in her home.  She has had her store for more twenty years.  She offers her customers a range of daily-use products, both groceries and convenience store items.  Her business is quite popular with local people since she usually offers good-quality products and provides good customer service.

Sofia would like to expand her business, acquiring more merchandise so that she can satisfy the demand that she currently has.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire more merchandise so that she can satisfy the demand that she currently has

loans.name: María Armita

texts.es:
María Armita es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos. Ella cuenta con un quiosco situado frente a la posta de salud de su localidad. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes ceviches, papas rellenas (platos típicos de la zona), gaseosas y comida en general. El negocio cuenta con buena acogida por parte de sus clientes debido a la buena sazón con la que María prepara sus alimentos y a la amabilidad con la que los atiende. Las ganancias que percibe de esta actividad las utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares.

María Armita desea adquirir más insumos para poder preparar más platos de comida, aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Armita is a 40 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural district located in Piura region, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

María Armita makes and sells food.  She has a kiosk opposite her town's local health clinic.  There she offers her customers 'ceviches' (raw fish marinated in lemon and garlic) and 'papas rellenas' (fried, stuffed potatoes) which are both traditional meals in this area.  She also sells soda and food in general.  Her business is very popular with her customers because of the good flavor of María's food and the kindness with which she serves her customers.  She uses the profits that she makes from this business to help her husband cover their family expenses.

María Armita would like to acquire more supplies so that she can prepare more meals, increase her sales and make more profits.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: Adquirir más insumos para poder preparar más platos de comida.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina G. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 59 years old. Adelina is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Adelina owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Adelina has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Adelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Adelina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Adelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Ma. Ruby

texts.en:
Ma. Ruby Q. is from the town of Banga. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Ma. Ruby owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She wants her family to always be happy and healthy. She does her best to support them.

Ma. Ruby joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ma. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira C. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Elvira is married and has 5 adult children. Elvira owns & operates a vegetable selling business. She is just starting this business.

In 2008, Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Lucrecia's Group

texts.en:
Lucrecia B. is from the village of Bacolod, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 37 years old. Lucrecia is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lucrecia is married and has 2 school-aged children. Lucrecia owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP every four months.

In 2009, Lucrecia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Lucrecia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen C. is from the village of Brgy. Homestead, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Helen is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Helen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

loans.name: Oem

texts.en:
Oem P. is a modest villager living in the province of Siem Reap. She owns farmland in the village where she plants rice and vegetable crops to make an income. Oem P. is a divorced mother who has given birth to five children who are still single. Two of her children help her with the family's daily expenses by working as a fisherman and a porter in and around Tunle Sap River.

Presently, it is a good time for doing a dry-season rice-field, but Oem P. has still not planted her crops yet. Therefore, Oem P. hopes to use her Kiva loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer, and also to assist her son by buying fishing implements to catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer, and to buy fishing implements.

The official name of this borrowing group is Lolita B.'s Group.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en: From Kompong Cham Province, Huon N. presently has been earning her daily income by making mortar; it is used to polish rice and is a cooking ingredient for housewives to use, which she produces from stone at her house. Her husband assists with the same business. This couple has only two kids who are both in school. They always go out to buy stone pieces in the village and other villages at a proper cost and then pick up it by their motorbike to bring back home. After that, Huon N. and her husband make it by hand. Huon N. always gets good results from her business, and she hopes to invest some funds in expanding her business, but her funds are insufficient yet. To achieve her goal, Huon N. would like to request her loan to purchase additional pieces of stone to make mortar to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional pieces of stone to make mortar to sell.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: The man shown in the picture is Mr. Suong A., 42, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish, in and around Tunle Sap River. He catches around 10 kg of fish per day and sells it in bulk to his customers, who are retail sellers in the market. His wife’s name is Naiy; she is 40 and works with him in the fishing business. This couple is blessed with four children, three of whom are single, and the other one of whom is married and also earning a living as a fisherman. Mr. Suong A. will use his loan to purchase nets and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets and other fishing implements so he can catch more fish.

loans.name: Ey

texts.en:
Ey R., 38, produces cow ties (ropes that are used like leashes to keep the animal in place), earning an income of USD 3 per day. R. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area that is known for Pre-Angkorian temples that were typically built before 800 AD. 

R.'s husband is a construction worker and buys cows to resell, earning an income of USD 6 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 35 for food, USD 15 for electricity, and USD 100 for other necessities. R. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more nylon to produce more cow ties to sell. In the future, she hopesto use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more nylon to produce cow ties

loans.name: Long

texts.en:

N. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia,  an area that is known for Pre-Angkorian temples that were typically built before 800 AD. Her husband is a TV repairman, earning an income of USD 5 per day. 

Each month, the family's expenses include USD 40 for food, USD 10 for electricity, and USD 80 for other necessities. N. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more TV and stereo spare parts to expand her husband’s business. In the future, she plans to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy TV and stereo parts

loans.name: Nov

Nov sells fruits and vegetables, earning an income of USD 3.3 per day, while her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 4.3 per day. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 90 on other necessary expenses every month.

Nov is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. In the future, she would like to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

texts.en:
Keo K., 51, buys rice for resale, earning an income of USD 3.30 per day. K. is married and resides with her husband and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of USD 10 per day. The family has to spend USD 45 on food, USD 10 on electricity, and USD 120 on other necessary expenses every month. 

K. is requesting a loan of USD 350 to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more rice to resell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn T. is a married woman from the town of Banga. She has children who go to school. Analyn is a farmer. She particularly plants and harvests rice crops. She sells her harvest at the market. Analyn also owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells biscuits, chicken eggs and other products. Analyn plans to start a small backyard piggery. She says she wants to have an extra source of income in case of emergencies.

Analyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and piglets

loans.name: Young

texts.en: Young S. is a 41-year-old married woman, who lives in the Siem Reap Province. She owns a small store in Phnoum Krom village, which is full of people, and she uses this store to sell breakfast and lunch foods. She generates a profit of approximately US$4 a day to help her family meet their daily expenses with more stability. Her husband works as a motor taxi driver in his community. This couple has one kid, who is attending school. Presently, her husband’s motorcycle is breaking down very often while he is providing transportation services. Young S. will use her loan to help her husband buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy V., 33 years old, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 2 children. Cristy is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells at the market. She also grows pigs for fattening. Cristy also put up a small sari-sari (variety) store where she sells soy sauce and other products. Cristy does all these to support her family.

Cristy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristy has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Cristy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy farm inputs and piglets. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and piglets

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng K., 51, is a teacher for a public school, earning an income of $4 per day. K. is married and resides with his wife and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. His wife is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day. 

The family has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $80 on other necessary expenses every month. K. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang S., 28, raises pigs, earning an income of $4 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of $5 per day. 

The family has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $40 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of  $1,000 to repair her husband’s car to operate his business more efficiently. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Her husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: To repair her husband's car to operate his business more efficiently

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva S., 41, is from the town of Banga. She is engaged in farming and a hog-raising business. She plants and harvests rice crops to sell to the market. Geneva also sells her fattened pigs. Geneva helps her family financially. She hopes for her ventures to grow and help improve her family's living conditions.

Geneva is a member of CEVI, a Kiva partner. She says her previous loans helped her maintain her businesses. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos that she will use to purchase farm fertilizers and piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and piglets

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch S., 30, is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband buys cows to resell, earning an income of USD 4 per day. 

The family has to spend USD 45 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell

loans.name: Nally

texts.en: Nally M. is an industrious and an active member of ASHI Antique North Branch Lipata Center 4, Lipata, Culasi, Antique Philippines. She is a 59-year-old widow and presently has five dependents, three of whom are still studying. They earn their living through their tricycle and she has also a variety store in their barangay (neighborhood or district). The income that they earn from this business really helps her to sustain their basic needs. Though some of her children who already work help support her, sometimes it is not enough for their needs, especially if there are unexpected expenses. Nally is one of the pioneer members of the branch. She has been a member for 11 years in ASHI and has already received several awards for being a good member. The Institution really helps her because through ASHI, some of her children have already finished their studies and have a stable job, and she has a tricycle. For her next loan, she is planning to expand her store and to purchase again an additional motorcycle. These projects are very useful not only for her, but also to her children who do not have any source of income. Her greatest dream in life is to have a decent house and to have savings for the future needs of the family.

loans.use: For a motorcycle and to expand her variety store

loans.name: Khit

texts.en:
Khit N., 57, makes hand-made brooms, earning an income of $2 per day. N. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $4 per day. 

The family has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $50 on other necessary expenses every month. N. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to improve his business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng Y., 43, sells hand-made brooms, earning an income of $4 per day. Yeht is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. The family has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $25 on other necessary expenses every month. 

Y. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase cows for offspring to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows for offspring to sell

loans.name: Phav

texts.en:
Phav B., 25, sells hand-made brooms, earning an income of $3 per day. B. is married and resides with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. The family has to spend $60 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $40 on other necessary expenses every month. 

B. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more brooms to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more brooms to resell

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Som N. is a married woman who currently lives in the province of Siem Reap. To earn of living, she sells sugar cane juice in front of her house and receiving an income from her business in average $2 per day. She has a life partner in her husband who works as chief of building construction. They have five children, all of whom are single, and staying with them under a roof. Som N.’s husband has a few labors to help him for serving his building service. He always gets a lot of order from his customer to build and repair their house. Recently, Som N.’s husband received an order from his client to build a house, but he lacks some construction material for construction yet. So that Som N. would like to request some fund from Kiva for her husband to buy brick, cement, and other construction supplies.

loans.use: To buy brick, cement, and other construction supplies.

loans.name: Lourt

texts.en: Lourt T., 29, is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. T. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband raises pigs to resell, earning an income of USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 35 on other necessary expenses every month. T. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more pigs to raise for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. T. is not available, so her husband appears in the photograph instead.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise for resale

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita P., 50, is from the town of Banga. Nelita plants and harvests rice for sale. Nelita also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to her town's market.

Nelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Nelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy fertilizers and piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and piglets

loans.name: Eoun

texts.en:
Eoun T., 68, sells handmade brooms, earning an income of USD 3 per day. T. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area that is known for Pre-Angkorian temples that were typically built before 800 AD. 

In a typical month, the family's expenses include USD 45 for food, USD 5 for electricity, and USD 40 for other necessities. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner in Cambodia. T.'s son appears in the photograph because T. is not available.

loans.use: To repair the family's home

loans.name: Ruena

texts.en:
Ruena S. is a married woman from the town of Banga. She has children who attend school. To make a living, Ruena raises pigs for sale. She also tends a corn farm.

Ruena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities, and she has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP to be used to purchase piglets, animal feed and farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, livestock feed and farm supplies

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Tun S., 24, sells fish, earning an income of USD 2 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area that is known for Pre-Angkorian temples that were typically built before 800 AD. Her husband sells ice cream, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. 

The family's monthly expenses include USD 66 for food, USD 5 for electricity, and USD 30 for other necessities. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits from her business to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family

loans.name: Tao

texts.en: Tao D., 24, is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. D. is married and resides with her husband and their child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is employed as a transporter of materials for his existing customers, earning an income of USD 4 per day. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month. D. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a new car for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new car to improve her husband's business.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas I., 51, sells traditional cakes, earning an income of USD 3 per day. I. is married and resides wI. her husband and six children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband buys rice to resell, earning an income of USD 5 per day. The family has to spend USD 66 on food, USD 10 on electricity, and USD 100 on other necessary expenses every month. I. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. I. is not available, so her husband appears in the photograph instead.

loans.use: To buy more rice to resell.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie B. is from the town of Banga. She is 54 years old. Virgie is married and has 3 children aged 20, 23 and 25. To make a living, Virgie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Virgie also cooks food that she sells to their neighborhood.

Virgie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to buy feed and piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M. is from the town of Banga. She is 43 years old and married. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Virginia also raises ducks and sells their eggs at the market, and manages a corn farm. 

Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy piglets and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy S., 31, purchases rice to sell, earning an income of USD 5 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is a civil servant, earning an income of USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase rice to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with one small daughter. He has a business selling cleaning supplies at a market in Novaya Kakhovka. Sergei started this business 6 years ago after he was unable to make enough money as a farmer to support his family. He enjoys his business now because inventory sells quickly. Having many repeat clients ensures his sales. 

Sergei is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to help purchase new inventory to sell. He wants to increase the assortment of products to improve sales overall. He hopes to receive additional income, which he will spend on his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning supplies to sell

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin E. is from the town of Talibon. He is 23 years old. Marvin is married and has a 4-month-old child. To make a living, Marvin operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. 

Marvin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvin has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marvin is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Mychel

texts.en: Mychel A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 31 years old. Mychel is married and has four children, aged 9, 7, 3 and 1. She is engaged in fishing. She helps her husband operate their fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. Mychel also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store and sells snacks. She makes pilipit, a Filipino crunchy sweet bread. Mychel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mychel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Mychel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Lem

texts.en: Lem S. is a hard-working woman who tries her best to support her family. She is a Khmer noodle seller and she always gets up early in the morning to go around her community to sell Khmer food. She has been operating this business since 2007, and she makes a profit of approximately $2.50 per day to use for daily expenses in the family. Lem S. has other income from her husband. He is a motor taxi driver, and he always shares his revenue with Lem S.. Unfortunately, his existing motorbike has often broken down during use. Because of that, Lem S. has decided to seek a loan of $1200 from Kiva that she will use to replace the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace her husband's broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Edwin  Simiyu

texts.en:
Edwin Simiyu, 28 years old and married to Nancy, has been running a school for one and half years with a very good income of about Kshs. 74,000 per month. His wife supports him in managing the school. Edwin has never borrowed from any other MFI, and he is applying for his first Loan from KADET LTD to be used for the following purposes: Kshs.10,000 to market the school, and the remaining Kshs.70,000 to expand classrooms to accommodate more pupils.

With the anticipated profits he plans to purchase a vehicle to transport students to school from the neighboring areas of Githurai 44. In the future he hopes to buy a plot of land and construct a home for his family.

loans.use: To market and expand the school

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S. has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. She lives in the province of Kompong Tom. Since 2005, Sen S. has owned and operated her farmland to cultivate a rice crop, from which she earns a daily income. Sen S., 38, is a married woman and mother of five children, all of whom are single, and live under her managing. Her husband works as a local carpenter in Our Sousbay village. Usually Sen S. generates around $2.50 a day in profits to meet the needs of her family. This rice-harvesting season Sen S. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice to store and then sell when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia A. K. is a widow with two children aged between seven and three years old, whom she hopes to raise to the best of her abilities. Her business is located beside a busy highway where metal work is the major type of business. She has been making and selling such items as wheelbarrows, metal boxes, chicken feeders, etc. to serve the local people. She has been running this business for six years now and has three employees. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is poor records, which makes it easy for the workers to defraud the business. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to buy scrap metal to grow her business. She hopes to expand her business and open other outlets in other towns. She describes herself as determined, goal oriented, ambitious, and God fearing.

loans.use: To buy scrap metal in order to make and sell more metal items.

loans.name: Yos

texts.en:
Yos S. is a 34 year old woman and mother caring for three teenagers, and all them are single and students who study in public school in Kompong Tom Province. Yos S. can earn her daily income by working on staff in a local shop which sells soup from evening time until night time. She can receive revenue from this job averaging $2 a day. Her husband is a recycling seller.

Her house is not comfortable for her and her family to live in because it is getting old and is broken in some parts. She wishes to repair it, but her savings fund is not enough to mend it. To solve this problem, Yos S. is seeking for a loan to buy some pieces of wood to repair her broken house.

loans.use: To buy some pieces of wood to repair her broken house.

loans.name: Baktybek

texts.en:
Baktybek C. is 29 years old, married and has three children. He was born in a large family of farmers and from early childhood was engaged in cultivating vegetables, which his family sold at the local market. After finishing school, Baktybek moved to the capital city Bishkek and started his business of reselling vegetables. Thanks to his wide experience in cultivating vegetables, he was able to open a selling point at the local market, which became known for its high quality products. With the starting capital of 5,000 KGS, he managed to earn about 15,000 KGS in a month.

Now Baktybek has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to broaden the assortment of goods by purchasing garlic and cucumbers. With the revenues, he plans to open a second selling point with fruits and vegetables. In the future, he dreams of building a house for his family.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden the assortment of goods.

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en: Nhor S., 33, resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. She helps her husband with the blacksmith business, earning an income of 5 USD per day. Her husband also earns an income of 5 USD per day. The family has to spend 83 USD on food, 10 USD on electricity, and 100 USD on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Reng

texts.en: Reng O., 43, produces traditional cakes to sell, earning an income of 1 USD per day. O. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of 2 USD per day. The family has to spend 83 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, and 40 USD on other necessary expenses every month. O. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a machine to cut wood for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. O. is not available so her husband appears in the photograph instead.

loans.use: To buy a machine to cut wood for her husband to improve his business

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en: Marie Grace owns a business that sells meat. She is 24 years old, married and has two children who are 7 and 8 years old. Her children attend school. Her husband works together in the same business. Marie Grace has been selling meat for four years.  Her loan will be used to buy more meats to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to own more than one butcher shop in the years to come.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Huy M., 28, is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. M. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 10 per day. The family has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.

M. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 24 years old, married and has two children who are between three and six years old. Currently, one of her children attends school.  Jacqueline owns a restaurant, which she has done for 5 years. Her husband is a precious metals dealer. Jacqueline will use the loan to purchase food and drinks for the betterment of her restaurant growth. With the new profits from her expanded business, Jacqueline plans to establish another restaurant. In the future, she would like a larger loan.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and set up a new restaurant.

loans.name: Meang

texts.en: Meang P., 45, is a housewife. P. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 10 per day. The family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 30 on other necessary expenses every month. P. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached for her child to start a business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine owns a business that sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, soaps and salt. She is 44 years old, married and has seven children who are between six and eighteen years old and three other dependents. All of them attend school. Her husband has no defined job. 

Justine has been selling rice, sugar, cooking oil, soaps, and salt for 16 years. Her loan will be used to buy more of these items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house for her store, as she is tired of renting and she wishes to own a permanent site for her business. This is her plan for the future.

loans.use: To buy more home products to sell.

loans.name: Abra Laure

texts.fr: Laure  a 25 ans.  Elle gère comme activité   génératrice de revenus, la vente des mèches.  Elle exerce cette activité il y a de cela 5 ans et  s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé en gros. Elle redistribue en détail.   Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 250 paquets de mèches.
texts.en: Laure is 25 years old. She has an income-generating activity selling hair extensions and has been carrying out this activity for the past five years. She gets her supplies wholesale at the large market in Lomé and then retails them.  She is requesting a loan to buy 250 packets of hair extensions.

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 23 years old, married and has one child who is six months old. Angelique sells foodstuffs, cooking oil, and soda, which she has been doing for four years. Her husband is a motorcyclist.  

Angelique will use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Angelique plans to build a house. In the future she would like to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick L. B. is a married man. His wife stays at home to take care of the household chores and they have five children aged between eighteen and five years old. His business is located at the busy Kakamega town. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and it is well known as the sugar belt region.

He sells batteries, car jacks, chains, head lamps, wheel openers, and other parts. He sells to the local people in Kakamega. He has been doing this business for eight years now and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints and that there are many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 30,000 to buy more spare parts to expand his business and meet the customers' demands. He hopes to be a big distributor of spare parts in future. He also hopes to give his children a good education to the university level. He describes himself as polite, ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea P. is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 4 per day. P. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. The family has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 35 on other necessary expenses every month.

P. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S., 24, is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. The family has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a new business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San S. was born in 1983; she is a married woman and has been blessed with two children. Both of them are students in the local public school. Her husband's name is Kong Phon. He is 26 years old, and he is a partner who helps her conduct the business. Presently, S. grows vegetables to sell and raises pigs, which she will sell when they mature. With her loan with HKL, they will purchase two buffalo to alleviate their hard physical labor on the farm field.

loans.use: To purchase two buffalo for farming business.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Virginie is 30 years old, married and has two children who are eighteen and twenty-one years old. Currently, both children attend school. Virginie sells a wide variety of items such as rice, sugar, salt and many other foodstuffs, which she has done for 2 years. Her husband works as a spare parts dealer for motorbikes and cars.  

Virginie will use the loan to purchase more items such as foodstuffs, soft drinks and other home products. With the new profits from her expanded business, Virginie plans to buy a plot of land where her commercial activities will be established. She dreams of having capital of two million in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Winifride

texts.en:
Winifride owns a restaurant and bar and has had this business for 13 years. She is 36 years old, married and has five children. All her children go to school except the youngest. Her husband works as a mason. 

Winifred will use this loan to buy more drinks, both soft and alcoholic. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase the sales for business growth. She wishes to be a distributor in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beer and food to use in the restaurant.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem S., 29, is a housewife. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 5 per day. The family has to spend USD 25 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month. Yem S. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a trailer to attach to her husband’s motorbike to expand his business.

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. was unavailable so her husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to attach to the motorbike.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette owns a business that sells milk and charcoal. She is 46 years old, married, and has two children who are enrolled in school. Both her children go to school as well as the dependents she adopted. Her husband works as an Administrator at the medical center.Odette has been selling milk and charcoal for 6 years.  

Her loan will be used to buy more liters of milk as well as more sacks of charcoals. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a commercial premise. In the future, she would like to get a loan of three million for a long sustainable business.

loans.use: To buy several litres of milk to sell.

loans.name: Aminadabu

texts.en:
Aminadabu sells rice, salt, and other foodstuffs. He is 30 years old, married and has three children who are between three and ten years old. His wife works together with him in the same business. 

Aminadabu has been selling rice, salt, and other foodstuffs for 4 years. His loan will be used to buy more items to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest. He would like to have a shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 27 years old, married and has one child. Presently, her child has not attended school yet. Claudine sells charcoal, which she has done for 2 years. Her husband has no specific job. Claudine will use the loan to purchase more charcoal.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Claudine plans to increase the output of the business, and to start a new and different business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jeane

texts.en:
Jeane is a 55 year old lady, and is married to Alexander who is 56 years old. They live in Oepura Village. From the marriage, Jeane is blessed with 6 children and they are: Novi, Ivon, Melky, Mersi, Rolland and Andre. Five of the children work but still live with Jeane and Alexander. Jeane does not want to lean on her children's income even though they are willing to support their parents' needs.

Jeane is a successful woman in running her business. She initiated her business by selling mobile phone recharges with her own capital. She created a simple counter to sell the mobile phone recharges at her house. Unfortunately, she only generated small income about IDR 30,000 – 50,000/day. She is now interested in running a kiosk business using the capital, but she needs more capital to expand her business.

Jeane has been with the TLM group lending program for 3 cycles. She heard from her friend that TLM provided loans for entrepreneurs like her. Her previous loans were invested to buy her kiosk business stock. She has a good credit history under the group loan program. She plans to expand her business by purchasing more stock to sell in her kiosk. She is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 4,000,000 from TLM through the individual lending program. She hopes that TLM is willing to assist her by providing the loan.

loans.use: To purchase stock to sell in kiosk.

loans.name: Peris Osoro

texts.en:
For five years, Peris M. has practiced farming (both dairy and horticultural) in Kahawa Wendani, just a few kilometers from Nairobi city centre. Besides farming, she also runs a posho mill and rental houses.

She is 59 years old and widowed, with one son. Peris supports her son and his wife, two grandchildren, and also a sister who is physically challenged. This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to buy more animal feed and complete a rental house.

The expected income from the business after this loan she will use to pay back the loan and complete her house by doing some finishing upstairs. Peris hopes to succeed and ensure that her grandchildren have a good education in the future.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, and complete rental houses.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She also cares for her younger sister's children too. Currently, three of her children attend school. Seraphine sells boutique items, which she has done for 3 years. Her husband works together with his wife. 

Seraphine will use this loan to purchase food stuffs, charcoal, sugar, soap, and beans. With the new profits from her expanded business, Seraphine plans to reinvest in the business for its growth. She dreams to have a shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Camlus

texts.en:
Camlus J. E. is a married man. His wife stays at home to take care of the household chores and they have one child aged three years old. His business is located at the busy Kakamega town. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and it is well known as the sugar belt region.

Camlus is a mechanic and does vehicle repairs for the local people. He has been doing this business for five years now and has three employees. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his so customers are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy spare parts to grow his business and meet the customers' demands. He hopes to own a garage some day and provide employment to many people. He also hopes to give his child a good education to the university level. He describes himself as ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Regine

texts.en:
Regine is 40 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 6 and 18. Regine sells different products such as: water, juice, beer, and so on. This is her tenth successful year in her business, which is open from 6 am until 10 pm every day. 

Regine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more products for her shop. This loan will help her to obtain more profits from her sales. Regine would like to use the profits to pay school fees for her children and save money for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married man and the father of two school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He established a car repair shop in 1995. He specializes in repairing the vehicle's paint and body. He learned this occupation from a local technical school. He works hard to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. His income is needed to support his wife and two children. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools needed to increase his business level and be able to take more repair work. He is optimistic about his business growth in the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun S., 39, weaves traditional silk, earning an income of USD 2 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 55 on other necessary expenses every month.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase raw silk to produce silk produts. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un K., 51, weaves Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of USD 2 per day. K. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a traditional musician, earning an income of USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month.

K. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to buy more supplements to produce rice wine. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more supplements to produce rice wine.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch C., 28, weaves traditional silk products, earning an income of USD 2 per day. C. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband transports fresh water to sell in the village, earning an income of USD 5 per day. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 50 on other necessary expenses every month.

C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products.

loans.name: Sjemi

texts.en:
Sjemi is aged 42 years. She lives in Maupoli Village, Oebobo Subdistrict - Kupang District. Sjemi is married and has 4 children: Margito (married), Febrianto (first grade of junior high school), Feby (sixth grade of elementary school) and Julio (fourth grade of elementary school). Sjemi’s husband, Dominggus, works as a pig breeder but they can not rely on his income as his income from pigs breeding is unstable. 

Prior to running food stall business, Sjemi sold vegetables at her house. Sjemi initiated her business as a vegetable trader to help her husband in providing for their life needs and the educational needs of their children. However, the income from the business was not sufficient to meet their needs. She tried to find loans to run a food stall business and then she got information from her neighbor that she could apply for the group loan from TLM. 
She was happy when TLM approved her loan application. 

Sjemi has joined the group lending program for 4 cycles. She spent the loan money to rent a business place in Inpres Market and bought rice and raw materials such as flavors, vegetables, meat, etc. She started the food stall business by selling yellow rice and side dishes. Sjemi plans to improve her business as her current business is running well and she has many customers. She would like to request an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000.

She plans to buy more food stall equipment such as plates, glasses, chairs and tables and some cooking flavors. She also wants to buy a young pig to be fattened for her husband's business. Sjemi expects TLM will give her an opportunity to get this individual loan so she can improve her business and her living standard as well.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and food stall equipment.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem S. is 46-year-old married woman and mother of six: five are single, and one is married. Two of them are employed as workers in a garment factory. She lives with other family members in her small family home in Tom Province. S. has a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother where she is able to plant the crops twice a year following both rainy and dry seasons. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. It is the time for dry-season rice-field, but she hasn't been able to plow her farm yet. So Yem S. would like to request a loan to hire a laborer to plow her farm so she can plant crops. She proposes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase a sack fertilizer.

loans.use: To hire a laborer to plow her farm land so she can plant crops and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 51, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 55 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise for sale.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Khen N., 37, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day. N. is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 4 on electricity supply, and USD 65 on other necessary expenses every month. N. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem O., 47, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. O. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is employed to take care of the plantation, earning an income of USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 60 on other necessary expenses every month. O. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. O. was not available so her husband appears in the photograph instead.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell.

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: Duch S., 33, weaves traditional silk, earning an income of USD 2 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is a motorbike driver, earning an income of USD 3.5 per day. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 50 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached to improve the business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily A. is a married woman. Her husband is a civil servant and they have four children aged between 8 and 20 years old. 

Her business is located at the busy Kakamega town. Kakamega is the region in Kenya known for production of sugar cane and it is well-known as the sugar-belt region. She sells cereals, e.g. beans, wheat and dried cassava, to the local people. She has been doing this business for eight years now and has one employee. 

She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more cereals to expand her business and meet customer demand. She hopes to grow her business and in the future, start a poultry farming business. She also hopes to give her children good education to the university level. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: Cereals

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
