This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children.  She is from Lebanon. She sells a wide range of goods from her home to customers in her community. She has been working hard to support her family in cooperation with her husband who works as a security man in a local cinema. Her goods are enjoyed by members of her community. She sells different Lebanese food and products. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her inventory for the winter months since her business sales increase during this period. She believes that her business would fare be better if she were to sell her goods in a different part of Lebanon. In the future, she would like to rent out a space to sell her merchandise, as well as sell popular homemade food products. For the time being, she will continue to sell goods from her home.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet A. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children.  Four of her children are currently in school.  Annet has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 3 years.  She owns a hotel as her second business.  

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar and stock food.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Annet hopes to own a plot.        Annet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving on business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and food stock

loans.name: Duol

texts.en: Duol R. is a 36-year-old divorced father who has two children, both in school. He is a farmer in Kompong Tom Province. Duol R. is also a rice trader. He buys rice in bulk and stores it in his stock supply in order to sell it to retailers in the market at a profit. He wants to buy a larger quantity of rice but doesn’t have a big enough vehicle to transport it. To achieve his goal, Duol R. has decided to seek a loan to purchase a trailer to connect to his motorbike so that he can carry more rice.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for his motorbike so that he can transport more rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Vegetables

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline M. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Caroline has a retail shop business, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Caroline has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Caroline hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Caroline hopes to own a charcoal business. She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her new games.

loans.use: To purchase sugar for resale

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 40 years old. Estrellita is married and has four children, aged 13, 11, 9 and 7. She owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells sardines, detergent soap and other kinds of products. She also buys and sells fish and sea cucumber. Estrellita wants to grow pigs for fattening and sale. She hopes to be successful in all her endeavors.

Estrellita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrellita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Estrellita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to buy fish, piglets and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To buy fish, piglets and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a laser machine

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl M. is from the town of Talibon. She is 28 years old and married. She owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells various kinds of products. She hopes for her store to grow. Her husband operates a motorcycle-transport service. Cheryl and her husband work hard to build their businesses and have a stable income.

Cheryl joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cheryl is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Cheryl from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children. He has worked in the agriculture field since 2005. His specializes in cultivating the land with an agriculture tractor.  From the time he started his work, he began to build his experience in the same occupation. He is the only income source in his family. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with on time payments during the long term. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform some maintenance to his tractor to make his work faster so he can deal with more customers and, thus, increase his productivity and his profitability.

loans.use: To perform some maintenance to his tractor

loans.name: Leaflor

texts.en:
Leaflor T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 21 years old. Leaflor is single. To make a living, Leaflor runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leaflor works hard to be able to help her family financially.

Leaflor joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leaflor is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Leaflor from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Uuganbayar

texts.en:
Uuganbayar B. is 22 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year-old son in a rented apartment Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He owns a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent and yard. He has been an orphan since he was child and has been working very hard to support and raise his two siblings. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home taking care of their son. 

Uuganbayar operates a cellphone repair service, that he started in 2006, in his town. Since 2009, he has continued operating a cellphone repair service shop in a rented space at the local market after completing a cellphone parts and repair training course. Uuganbayar hopes to expand his business by selling cellphones in addition to his repair service in the future. Uuganbayar is a self confident and optimistic man. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more cellphone parts and tools for his cellphone repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase more cellphone parts and tools.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata M. is a single lady with two children aged five and two. Her business is located at the Nairobi Central Business District where she sells clothes to the local people. She has been doing this for six years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that fashion is seasonal and some designs go out of style before she has sold them. Then she takes losses or her capital becomes locked up due to slow stock movement. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more clothes to boost her business during this festive season. She hopes to grow her business and open more stalls in Nairobi since the target market is huge. She also hopes to gain financial stability and give her children a good education to the university level. She describes herself as generous, kind and lovable.

loans.use: Buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma D. is from the town of Talibon. She is 29 years old. Vilma is married. To make a living, Vilma owns & operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for breeding. Vilma wishes to have a stable income.

Vilma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase oil bath equipment and tools

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the last four years, Aidah has run a business selling charcoal.
To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Aidah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Aidah hopes to become a teacher. She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to sing.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 30 years old. Florencia is married and has 6 school-aged children. Her eldest child is only 12 years old. To make a living, Florencia owns & operates a fishing business, primarily gathering and selling seaweeds to the market. Florencia works hard to sustain her children's education. She wants them to finish college and find good jobs.

Florencia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Florencia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Florencia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and three young children. She has 15 years of experience in the tailoring field and started to manage her own work from her house in 2005. She cooperates with her husband in the family’s income to maintain a minimum fair average of profit to provide better living conditions for her family.

She obtained her first Kiva loan and she was satisfied from the results. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a tailoring machine to enlarge her business so that she will be able to produce her services faster and increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng C., 33, produces hammocks to sell and grows sugarcane, earning an income of USD 2.5 per day. C. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 48 on other necessary expenses every month. C. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase more fabrics to produce hammocks to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to produce hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Dogbo

texts.fr: Mme Dogbo  a 41 ans et est mariée. Elle a 2 enfants.    Elle est née à Aného et habite Tokoin Cassablanca, elle fait la vente du jus et glaçon. Elle fait cette activité il y a de cela 3 ans et achète  les ingrédients au marché local de Gbossimé. Pour satisfaire plus de clients, elle demande un prêt pour acheter un congélateur.
texts.en: Dogbo is 41 years old and married with two children. She was born in Aného and lives in Tokoin Cassablanca. She sells juice and ice-cubes, and has being doing this for the past three years. She buys her ingredients at the local market in Gbossimé. She is requesting a loan to buy a freezer so that she can satisfy more customers.

loans.use: Purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents. Despite his young age, he has good experience working as a home painter for four years. He works on a freelance basis upon the customers’ request.  As its common in Lebanon, he helps his father with the family income. Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his business tools and purchase paints for a new project. He needs to be prepared to satisfy the client and earn a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business and be able to take construction projects in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: To renew his business tools and purchase paints

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Thise Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He started to work in the motorcycle repair field in 2007 and in parallel he began to work as a home painter in 2008 because he is the only income provider for the family in cooperation with his father and wants to increase the  family’s profit. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase various supplies to complete his work and be able to increase his efficiency and his sales.

loans.use: To purchase various supplies

loans.name: Zinabou

texts.fr: Zinabou a 38 ans et est mariée. Elle a en  charge 3 enfants. Elle fait comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de bouillie et beignet.  Elle a commencé en 1985 cette activité. Pour se procurer des ingrédients de fabrication, elle achète à Wahalla et Atakpamé les nécessaires.  Elle revend ensuite à côté du feu tricole de Tokoin hôpital. Elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de Mil, 5 sacs de Maïs, 2 baules d’haricot  3 tas de fagot de bois.
texts.en: Zinabou is 38 years old and married. She has three children in her care. She has an income-generating activity selling "bouillie" (a type of porridge or gruel) and fritters. She began this business in 1985. She buys the ingredients she needs in Wahalla and Atakpamé. She resells them afterwards next to the traffic lights at the Tokoin hospital. She is requesting a loan to buy five bags of millet, five bags of corn, two bowls of beans and three piles firewood bundles.

loans.use: Purchase of millet, beans and bundles of firewood

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile owns a business that sells food items. She is 53 years old, married and has five children who are between fourteen and thirty years old. She has two children whom she cares for as dependents. All of her children go to school. Her husband is a teacher. Cecile has been selling food items for one and a half years. She will use this loan to buy more rice, sugar, and maize flour. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase the output and growth of the business. She would like to have a car for better transportation for her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more food to sell.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 34 years old, married and has four children who are between 5 and 12 years old. Her husband works as a mason, while for the past seven years Cecile has owned a business that sells foodstuffs.  She decided to request this loan to buy more foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, green bananas, and soaps to sell and hopes to use the new profits from her business to pay the school fees for her children.  In the future, she would like to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife. Since 1995, he has acquired good experience working as a home painter. He works on a freelance basis upon the customers’ request. He is the main source of income for his wife. Today, he is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his business tools and purchase paints for his newest project. He wants to be ready to please the client and earn a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business and be able to take construction projects in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: To renew his business tools and purchase paints

loans.name: Buyantogtoh

texts.en:
Buyantogtoh L. is a single parent who lives with her three children. Her oldest daughter is disabled and stays at home, while her younger two children both attend a local high school. Buyantogtoh supports her family by operating a clothes-making business in her town, sewing not only the traditional Mongolian coat called deel, but also dresses.

Having worked in a tailoring business for many years, she gained much experience as a seamstress. She started her own business in 1992 after retiring from a dressmaking company, and over the years has expanded her product line to make a variety of evening dresses. She has built a positive reputation amongst her customers because of the good quality of her products.

A modest woman, Buyantogtoh is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics and finishing materials for 1,250,000 MNT and a new sewing machine for her business at 250,000 MNT.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is 26 years old, and married with two children — a ten-month old and a three-year-old who attends nursery school. Her husband works in construction. Doreen sells various items in her store, which she has had for three years. She will use the loan to purchase more rice, sugar, cooking oil, salt and soap to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Doreen plans to re invest in her business. She would like to be a supplier to other business people or a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as sugar, rice, cooking oil and salt to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 31 years old, and married with two children 5 and 10 years old. She also takes care of three relatives. Sylvia owns a printing store, located in Kimironko, a suburb of Kigali. She provides secretarial and printing services to her customers and will use this loan to buy more paper, ink for printers, files, and more internet broadband. Her dream is to buy more computers for her growing business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her printing service.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en: Antoine sells cooking oil, rice, tomato sauce and sandals and works with his wife in this business. He is 30 years old and has two children. Antoine has been selling food and shoes for five years and has requested this loan to buy more products to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to buy another plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more rice, tomato sauce and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Adele

texts.en: Adele owns a business that sells foodstuff. She is 35 years old, married and has four children who are between four and thirteen years old. All her children attend school. Her husband works together with her selling vegetables. Adele has been selling foodstuffs for two years. Her loan will be used to buy more sweet potatoes, cassava, yams, and beans. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to re invest in her business. She dreams of buying a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Gerardine

texts.en: Gerardine is 38 years old, separated from her husband, and has three children and one orphan she cares for. Currently, three of her children attend school. Gerardine owns a beauty salon, which she has had for 13 years. She will use this loan to purchase hair products and cosmetics. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gerardine plans to expand her salon business and build another house to rent. She would also like to start a chicken farm in the future.

loans.use: To buy more hair products and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 33-year-old, married man who lives with his family that consists of six members. In 2005, Mahmoud opened his own store in which he produces his own dairy products and all types of cheese. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to buy modern machines and equipment for his store to increase the size of production, which will increase his income and allow him to have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy modern machines and equipment

loans.name: Tsogtbaatar

texts.en: Tsogtbaatar L. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages 19 and 12, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in an apartment. Both of his children attend a local secondary school and Tsogtbaatar and his wife operate a clothes-making and repair business out of a rented space at the Bayangol department store. Tsogtbaatar started the business in 2007 after working as a driver at the local transportation business between 2004 and 2007. He is a modest and honest man who says, "I want to continue operating our business at a stable level to provide higher education for my children." He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and supplies for his clothes business.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 58-year-old married man from Lebanon, living with his wife. Since twenty years ago, he has made his living as an experienced blacksmith. He has obtained a first Kiva loan and he is thankful for the results. Since he joined, he has grown his business. He has been a reliable client and repaid on time for the duration of the loan.

 Today, he is requesting to borrow a larger amount of $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his inventory of iron in order to increase his business production and thus his income.

loans.use: increase his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old divorced woman from Lebanon, living with her parents. She has been working as an esthetician since 2003. She has been involved in the beauty field for 10 years.  Because of her reputation, she has been able to attract a good number of customers who are very satisfied with her work. She cooperates with her family in supporting the household. 

She has obtained a first Kiva loan and today, she is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase merchandise (make-up and other cosmetic products) to be able to satisfy her clients when they ask her to offer them such services.  In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man and the father of two school-aged children. He lives in Lebanon. He has been working in the construction field for the past twelve years. His work consists in wall foliage. He has been involved in this occupation for twenty years now. He cooperates with his wife who works as a household maid to satisfy the needs of the family.  

He works directly with construction entrepreneurs where he completes the concrete work. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase iron scaffolding which will answer his business needs.

loans.use: to purchase iron scaffolding

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and 3 siblings. He cooperates with his father to maintain a good income to support the family. Despite his young age, he opened a cleaning company in 2005 and got experience in this occupation since then. He works depending on customers’ requests, offering cleaning services to homes and companies. In addition, he produces cleaning products and detergents. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase raw materials to improve his work and better serve  his clients.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married woman living in Lebanon with her husband and 3 children. In addition to her husband’s income, she represents a second income source for the family. She opened a clothing store in 2008 and she hopes to extend her business especially that she built up a good reputation and has her loyal customers. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new, much-needed products since she wants to offer her clients new styles and designs to attract a maximum number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase new much-needed products

loans.name: Abad Al Motleb

texts.en:
Abad Al Motleb is a 28 year old married man who is the father of two kids.  They live in Baalbeck. Abad Al Motleb and he has been working as a car mechanic since 2008.  He is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua, in order to improve his business.  He was out of Lebanon for a long period and came back in 2008 with his family for good. 

He was dreaming of opening a big maintenance company but the financial situation in Lebanon isn’t good, and he has to stay up to date to maintain his family's standard of living. He hopes to educate his children in a good private schools and to provide them with the things they need.  He will struggle to make his dream come true and he believes that where there’s a will there’s a way

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married man living in Lebanon with his wife and five young children.   He is the only income source for his big family. He has worked as a taxi driver for 15 years and in 2008, he bought his own taxi car. He works hard day and night to provide his family with fair living conditions.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for needed maintenance for the car and registration to obtain the accurate, legA. clearance for his vehicle so he can drive safely and transport his clients in an appropriate car.

loans.use: To make needed maintenance on the car

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nasana just outside Kampala She is married and has 2 children.  None of her children is currently in school.  Florence has a business of selling food, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food  for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Florence hopes to own a sewing machine.  Florence is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard and getting new friends

loans.use: To purchase food for resale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia M., aged 38, runs a poultry business in Tala. She is married to Cosmas M. and together they have three grown children: Mutisya aged 23, Charles aged 22, and Mbatha aged 20. Patricia was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Tala office. She has been running this business for five years and her monthly profit is Kshs. 6,000. With the loan of Kshs 17,500 which, is her second loan from KADET, she plans to buy chicks to raise and sell later at a profit. If this loan boosts her business, she will expand her poultry business and open a grocery store. This will make it easier to her pay school fees for her children. Patricia’s dream is to expand her poultry business. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy chicks.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 20 year old single ambitious man from Baalbeck.  Ali has been working as a Tractor driver since 2004.  He owns a tractor and he is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, to do the necessary maintenance to it.  It’s his main source of income.  

Ali didn’t finish his education due to his parent's financial situation.  He works hard on improving his business through buying more tractors and expanding his business.  His clients are people dealing with construction.  They might be neighbors, friends and relatives.  He hopes he can  make his dream come true.

loans.use: To do the necessary maintenance to his tractor.

loans.name: Ramla

texts.en:
Ramla I. aged 53 years runs a food kiosk at Kibera which is a slum area.  She has many customers.  She is married to Yusuf I. and they have no children.  Ramla was introduced to KADET by another KADET client.

Ramla has been running this business for a period of nine years and has a monthly profit of 15,000 KES.  This is the third loan she is taking from KADET LTD, after paying off her previous loans well.  Ramla plans to use the loan to increase stocks of beans, green grams, wheat flour and potatoes for her food kiosk.  If this loan boosts her business, the additional income will be ploughed back into the business. 

Ramla hopes to open another food kiosk in the future.  She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To increase stocks of beans, green grams, wheat flour and potatoes for the business.

loans.name: Nakyanzi Selondia

texts.en:
Nakyanzi Selondia aged 39 years runs a beauty salon at Mlolongo market.  Mlolongo is a transit town from Nairobi to Mombasa and Machakos so her customers are both residents and passengers.  Nakyanzi is a single mother of two daughters and one son, Anna who is employed and Doreen and Patrick both in form three.  Nakyanzi was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office.

Nakyanzi has been running this business for a period of four years and her monthly profit is 20,500 KES.  This loan of 20,000 KES is her first loan with KADET and she plans to use the entire amount to buy a hair blow dryer.  If the loan boosts the business, Nakyanzi will open another salon.

Nakyanzi's dream is to purchase a piece of land and build commercial houses.  She describes herself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy Hair dryer machines.

loans.name: Kadenge Koin

texts.en:
Kadenge Koin, age 22 years, trades livestock at Bissil market in Kajiado.  He is married to Lemomo who is a housewife and they have no children. Kadenge was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Kitengela office.

He has been in the livestock trading  business for a period of one year and his monthly profit is 2,000 KES.  This loan of 15,000 KES is his first loan from KADET and he intends to use it to purchase cows and goats for trade.  If the loan boosts the business, Kadenge will start a butchery business.

Kadenge’s dream is to  own a pickup and start transporting animals to the Kenya meat commission.  He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase cows and goats for trade.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 64 year old married woman from Baalbeck.  She is the owner of a used clothes and shoes shop.  She sells old shoes and clothes exported from Europe since 2003. 

Fatima is requesting her first loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy extra winter clothing.  Her clients are her neighbors, relatives, and people passing by. Her prices are affordable to most people and she believes she has to do so to help everyone dress properly.  Fatima would like to do some decorations to her shop but she believes she could do it when she pays back the requested loan, and requests another one.

loans.use: To buy extra winter clothing.

loans.name: Rose Muthike

texts.en:
Rose Muthike, aged 46 years, operates a grocery shop in Kaloleni. She is married to Charles Mbithi and together they have four children: Nduku in college, Makau and Sammy in class eight, and Mbatha in class three. She was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of the Tala office.

Rose has been running this business for a period of 10 years and her monthly income is 7,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs). This loan of Kshs 40,000 is her third loan with KADET. Rose plans to use Kshs 25,000 to increase stock of sugarcane, tomatoes and bananas, and Kshs 15,000 to buy farm seedlings and fertilizers. If this loan boosts the business, she plans to expand the business and educate her children.

Rose's future dream is to expand her business and look for another source of income. She describes herself as a serious business lady.

loans.use: To increase stocks of tomatoes, sugarcane and bananas

loans.name: Daniel Wacira

texts.en:
Daniel, 34 years old, is married to Racheal Wambui, who sells shoes at a center called Kimende in Limuru. Together they have two children, aged 11 and 4 years. He runs a retail shop in Kimende, where he sells commodities like soft drinks and snacks. 

Daniel was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who was already a member of KADET. He has been running this business for 13 years and as a result, he has established good relationships with his clients. Besides the retail shop, Daniel also sells timber, so with this loan he wants to buy more trees in order to get more timber for sale. 

This will be his second loan he is getting from KADET. If the loan improves the business, he will construct a timber yard so that he can have proper storage. 

He desires to give his family a good life.

loans.use: To boost the timber business

loans.name: Hekmat

texts.en:
Hikmat is a 32 year old married man, who is the father of four kids.  He has been working as a carpenter since 1997, with 18 years of experience.  Hekmat is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to buy wood for a project he is working on. 

His clients like his work a lot and they recommend him a lot to friends and relatives.  He is working on expanding his factory and hopes to open his own showroom in  the future.

loans.use: To buy wood for a project he is working on.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana just outside  of Kampala.  She is married and has no children. Rose has a business of a small retail shop selling drinks, which she has had for 1 year.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar, drinks.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Rose hopes to own a whole sell shop. Rose is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to work hard.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and drinks for resale

loans.name: Nchoonga Taratia

texts.en:
Nchoonga Taratia, aged 46 years, trades livestock at Bissil market in Kajiado. She is married to Taratia N., aged 50 years. He is a farmer and together they have three children: Sapatu, aged 19 years and in college; Noela, aged 15 years and in form one; and John, aged 12 years and in class six. Nchoonga was introduced to KADET by the staff of KADET. 

Nchoonga has been in this livestock-trading business for a period of eight years and her monthly profit is 5,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs). She is applying for her first loan of Kshs. 20,000 from KADET. She intends to use Kshs 10,000 to purchase cows and Kshs 10,000 to buy goats, both for trade. If the loan boosts the business, Nchoonga will pay school fees for her children.

Nchoonga hopes to start dairy farming in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cows and goats

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Kuña Guapa, se conformó en  agosto de 2.010, en la ciudad de Carmen del Paraná y renuevan en el 2do ciclo, con 10 integrantes. En el primer ciclo estaban 19 integrantes en el comité, y por una cuestión de diferencia de puntos de vista decidieron dividir el grupo y quedarse  entre las que mejor trabajaba. 

Las actividades a las que se dedican las señoras son diversas, por ejemplo, pesca y venta de pescado, fabricación y venta de ladrillos, al comercio, entre otros. 
La directora general del comité, Ramona A. tiene 56 años de edad  y junto con su marido Juan V. tiene una fábrica de ladrillos en su residencia. Juntos tienen 2 hijos.

Doña Ramona es una señora muy sacrificada y trabaja a la par de su marido para ayudar en la fábrica que tienen juntos. 
Fue beneficiaria de una casa construida por la Entidad Binancional Yacyreta, con lo que pudo acceder a un mejor conford en su vivienda. 
Solicita el préstamo para la  reparación del horno donde se realiza la cocción de los ladrillos.

El comité es nuevo y estan aprendiendo y tomado conciencia de la importancia de trabajar en equipo, además de ser concientes de la importancia de desarrollar el espiritu emprendedor para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa Women's Committee was founded in August 2010, in the city of Carmen del Paraná and they are now in their second loan cycle with 10 members.  There were 19 members during the first loan cycle but, owing to some differences of opinion, they decided to split the group up and retain the  members who worked best.

The ladies' business activities are varied and include fishing and selling fish, making and selling bricks, and sales.

The head of the committee is Ramona A. who is 56 years old.  She and her husband Juan V. have a brick factory at their home.  They have 2 children together.

Ramona is a very selfless woman who works with her husband, helping in their factory.  She was the beneficiary of a house built by Entidad Binacional Yacyreta and this provided her with more comfort in her home.  She is requesting this loan to fix the oven where she bakes her bricks.

This is a new committee and they are learning and becoming aware of the importance of teamwork and the need to develop their entrepreneurial spirit in order to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy clay

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single woman from Lebanon living with her mother and three siblings. She has worked as a beautician since 2005. Because of her reputation, she has been able to build up a good number of customers who are very satisfied from her work. She is the only provider for her family. She has obtained her first Kiva loan and today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a laser machine to be able to accommodate her clients asking her to offer them such type of service.  In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high. In the future, she hopes to open a formal beauty salon as her own business.

loans.use: To purchase a laser machine

loans.name: Titus Risa

texts.en:
Titus Risa, 25, trades livestock at Bissil market in Kajiado. He is married to Pessy S., who is a farmer, and together they have one child, Sopon S., who is two years old. Titus was introduced to KADET by other KADET customers. 

Titus has been in the livestock trading business for a period of five years and his monthly profit is Kshs 4,000. This loan of Kshs 20,000 is his first loan with KADET and he intends to use Kshs 10,000 to purchase cows and Kshs 10,000 to buy goats, both for trading. If the loan boosts his business, Titus will start a butchery business. Titus hopes to become a prominent businessman. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cows and goats for trading.

loans.name: Luchando Todas  Juntas Group

texts.es:
En todos estos años han vivido muchas experiencias como grupo, que las ha formado para seguir trabajando solidariamente entre todas.
 Si bien siempre se presentan dificultas, ellas encuentran la forma de salir adelante y seguir obteniendo el crédito con la Fundación. 
Las señoras se dedican a la venta de mercaderías varias de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes, por ejemplo, carne, aceite, harina, etc., otras venden ropas, tienen despensa, venta de comidas y otros. 
La directora general Elva Benítez, está casada con Silvio Fernández, quienes viven entre 6 personas en su vivienda y trabajan 2 (ella y su marido). 
 
La señora Elba, vende mercaderías como carne, y otros alimentos de primera necesidad de acuerdo a lo que le solicitan sus clientes. 
Ella dice que su estrategia para vender más es el poco margen de ganancia que le recarga a sus productos además del excelente trato con las personas. 

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne.
texts.en:
Over the years, this group has lived through many experiences which has pushed them as a group to continue working supportively together.

Whilst there are always difficulties, the women find ways to get ahead and to continue obtaining loans from Fundación Paraguaya.

The ladies work selling various merchandise to fill their customers' orders.  Some sell meat, oil, flour, etc.., others sell clothes, run a grocery store or sell meals.

The head of this group, Elva Benítez, is married to Silvio Fernández.  They live with 6 people in their home and 2 of them work (her and her husband).

Elva sells merchandise such as meat and other essential food products according to what her customers ask for.  She says that her strategy for selling more is to place only a small profit margin on the price she charges for her products.  She also provides excellent customer service.

Elva is requesting her loan to buy meat.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Anthony Topos

texts.en: Anthony Topos M. is 34 years old and married to Maximiller Emase, who is a house wife. They have three school-going children aged 18, 14 and eight. The family resides in Lodwar, Kenya. Anthony operates a motorcycle service and has been in this business for the past four years. He earns a monthly profit of KES17,000. Anthony learnt about KADET LTD through a credit officer and is now applying for a second loan of KES75,000 from KADET, which he intends to use to buy another motorbike. The anticipated profits will be used to expand his motorbike service business. In the future Anthony wishes to be the leading local investor in the area.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Emperatriz María

texts.es: La señora Emperatriz C. Márquez es comerciante de mercancía en general. Vive en el municipio de Malambo, perteneciente al área metropolitana de Barranquilla, en compañía de su esposo y tres hijos. La microempresaria inició su negocio hace diez años con un pequeño capital que le regaló su esposo quien es técnico de refrigeración y hay épocas del año en que sus ingresos escasamente le alcanzan para cubrir los gastos familiares. Al comienzo, y por falta de experiencia, la señora emperatriz tuvo inconvenientes con algunas personas  morosas, pero logró superar el problema y ahora es más selectiva a la hora de escoger sus clientes. En la casa de la microempresaria también funciona un hogar del Instituto Colombiano de Bienestar Familiar, éstas son pequeñas escuelas de pre-escolar, financiadas por el gobierno en las que además de educación, también le suministran alimentación a niños de escasos recursos. Por ésta actividad obtiene ingresos adicionales de $ 130.000 COP. La señora Emperatriz ha recibido dos créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y éste es su primer Credikiva. Planea invertirlo en la compra de jeans, blusas, calzado, perfumes y juguetes. Normalmente, ella no compra mercancía para tener en existencia, sino sobre pedidos. Por la temporada de fin de año la demanda de su clientela se ha incrementado considerablemente. El promedio de las ventas mensuales de la usuaria es de $ 2.600.000 COP, el margen de utilidad es del 40% y el plazo promedio de sus cuentas por cobrar es de 60 días. Para el próximo año, pensando en aumentar sus ingresos, la señora Emperatriz planea comprar una vitrina metálica exhibidora y vender útiles escolares, aprovechando la demanda de todos los niños de su escuelita de pre-jardín.
texts.en:
Emperatriz C. Márquez sells general merchandise.  She lives in the town of Malambo, in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla.  She lives with her husband and three children.

This small businesswoman started her business ten years ago with only a small amount of capital which her husband provided her with.  Her husband is a refrigeration technician and there are periods of the year in which his income barely manages to cover their family expenses.  At the beginning, owing to a lack of experience, Emperatriz faced problems with some delinquent customers but she managed to sort the problems out and now she is more selective when it comes to choosing her customers.

Emperatriz' home is also used as a location for an 'Instituto Colombiano de Bienestar Familiar' (Colombian Institute of Family Well-being).  These are small pre-schools, financed by the government, which offer education and also food for children from poor families.  Emperatriz makes an additional income of 130,000 Colombian pesos from this business.

Emperatriz has received two loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and this is her first Kiva loan.  She plans to invest it in buying jeans, blouses, footwear, perfume and toys.  Normally she doesn't buy merchandise to have in stock but rather buys according to what her customers order.  During the end-of-year season, her customer demand has increased considerably.  Her average monthly sales amount to 2,600,000 Colombian pesos, her profit margin is 40% and her accounts receivable turnover period is 60 days.

Next year, Emperatriz is thinking of increasing her sales.  She is planning to buy a metal display case and start selling school supplies, taking advantage of the demand from all the children in her pre-school.

loans.use: To buy jeans, blouses, footwear, perfume and toys

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old single man living with his mother. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a DJ and party organizer for almost 15 years. He takes on weddings, ceremonies, and private parties. He took out a first Kiva loan to purchase a musical instrument and he is thankful for the results. 

Currently, his business is getting bigger and he wants to take out a new loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional musical equipment. Please note that the borrower was very punctual and repaid on time during previous the loan period.

loans.use: to purchase additional musical equipment

loans.name: Samuel Ekwam

texts.en: Samuel Ekwam E. is 48 years old and married to Alice Ekusi Ekuwam, who is a house wife. They have two school-going children aged 10 and four. They reside in Lodwar, Kenya. Samuel sells new clothes and has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly profit of KES38,000. Samuel learnt about KADET LTD through a credit officer and so he is now applying for a second loan of KES80,000 from KADET. Samuel paid back his previous one well and in time. With the loan he intends to buy more clothes to sell and use the anticipated profits to expand the boutique business. In the future, Samuel wishes to be economicaly stable.

loans.use: To buy more clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a conversion kit to transform her vehicle from gas to natural gas

loans.name: Jane Musangi

texts.en:
Jane Musangi, 45, runs a tailoring shop at Kwa Njenga. She is married to Alex Mutuku and together they have two children: Alex, 18, in form four and Blessy, 16, in form three. Jane was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients.

She has been running her business for two years and her monthly profit is 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (Kshs). This loan of 20,000 Kshs is her second loan from KADET. The previous loan was well paid. Jane intends to use the loan to buy rolls of materials for making clothes. If this boosts the business, she plans to buy another sewing machine.

Jane hopes to expand her business and develop her piece of land in Ruai. This will increase her income allowing her to pay school fees for her children. She describes herself as social and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy rolls of materials.

loans.name: Peter Lopeyok

texts.en:
Peter Lopeyok E.,is 34 years old, married to Asinyen. He is a businessman who sells livestock in Lodwar-Kenya. He has been running this business for the last five years.

He learnt about KADET LTD from a friend who is a client. This will be his second loan of Kshs. 80,000 from KADET LTD. He is planning to buy more livestock to rear and sell later at a profit. He plans to reinvest the profits in his business.

Peter believes in working hard and he only needs the resources to attain his goals. In the future, he wishes to be the leading local investor in the area.

loans.use: To buy more livestock to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de San Juan del Paraná  surgió por contacto de una de las señoras con la fundación,  el grupo se encuentra en el 12º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2005  con pagos excelentes, tienen un ahorro de 7.928.680  Gs. 
 La Directora General es la Sra. Julia F. su marido trabaja en la chacra y también ayuda en el kiosko que es la actividad .
Los créditos que ella recibe  dentro del comité lo invierte en la compra de mercaderías (Bebidas como gaseosa, vinos, gaseosas, y otros)  para surtir el kiosko , lo cual es muy importante  para ella y su familia , ya que de esta manera consiguen mejores precios y cantidad. De las  ganancias que le genera la venta ella  paga la cuota de su comité y el resto es un ingreso importante para su familia.
 
Todas las señoras del grupo también  realizan actividades productivas como ser :  venta de ropas,  venta de  verduras, venta de huevos, venta de comidas , modista  etc.
texts.en:
This group from San Juan del Paraná started through contact of one of the women with the Foundation. The group is now in its 12th loan cycle, working with the Foundation since 2005, with excellent payment history and a savings of 7.928.680 Gs.

The General Director of the group is Mrs. Julia F.. Her husband works on the farm and also helps in the kiosk which is her business.

The loans that she receives from the committee will be invested in purchasing merchandise (beverages such as soda pop, wine, and more) in order to stock her kiosk, which is very important for her and her family, as in this way they can get better prices and quantity. From the earnings that are generated from sales she makes the loan payment to her committee and the rest is important income for the family.

All the women of the group also are actively employed: selling clothes, selling vegetables, selling eggs, selling food, seamstress, etc.

loans.use: Buy beverages such as wine, beer, soda pop, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 62-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. He started to work in the car mechanics field 50 years ago.  He represents the only income provider for the family and wants to amplify the family’s income. He repairs different types of cars. 

Due to his long experience in this field, he was able to gain a good number of clients passing by his shop and asking for his services.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase various tools instead of the old ones to complete his work and be able to increase his efficiency and therefore his sales.

loans.use: to purchase various tools

loans.name: Nueva Ilusion Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal NUEVA ILUSION está solicitando su primer crédito en el centro focal de Cascada, un total de  8  socias integran este grupo.
Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, como por ejemplo: venta de polleras y macramé, puesto de ferretería, venta de comida, venta de llaves, zapatería, venta de perfumes, confección de polleras, artesanía de mantas y macramé y polleras.

Esta Banca Comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza se encuentra la presidenta, la señora  Valentina.

La señora Valentina tiene un hogar conformado por su pareja y tres hijos.   El negocio de la señora Valentina es la elaboración de polleras y mantas, sin embargo comenta que cuando no hay demanda de estos productos ella se dedica al traslado de ladrillos.
Ella aprendió a elaborar polleras porque fue su deseo desde que era niña, ahora lo hace como negocio, generalmente como encargo de sus clientes.   Su crédito de Bs. 2000 será utilizado para la compra de tela, presilla y basta.
Cuando le consultamos a la señora Valentina sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella responde que es el ahorro y el consultorio de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nueva Ilusión” from Cascada is seeking its first loan; this group has 8 members.

The women have different businesses, for example: selling traditional skirts and macramé items, hardware stand, selling food, selling keys, shoe store, selling perfume, making traditional skirts, and handicrafts of cloaks, macramé and traditional skirts.

This Communal Bank is directed by an executive board, and the leader is the president, Mrs. Valentina.

Mrs. Valentina has a home with her husband and three children. Mrs. Valentina’s business is making traditional skirts and cloaks. She says that when there isn’t a demand for products she works moving bricks.

She learned to make traditional skirts because this was her dream as a little girl; now she does it as a business, generally based on customer orders. Her loan for Bs. 2000 will be used to buy the fabric, button loops, and sack cloth.

When we asked Mrs. Valentina why she likes Pro Mujer she responded that it is the savings and health services.

loans.use: Buy fabric, button loops, sack cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 60-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one child. He has been working as a taxi driver for 25 years and bought his own car to use as a taxi 17 years ago. He is the only income provider for his family. Regarding his older age, he is making a big effort to keep his family doing well. His main route is between his town and its surroundings.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance for his car such as changing the engine and improving the outside look so he can attract more clients and serve them using a proper car.

loans.use: perform needed maintenance for his car

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old single man. He is from Lebanon and is living with his parents and one sibling. He is the only income source for his family. He is experienced in doing women's hair dressing for almost 18 years and in 2005 he opened his own women's hair salon. He purchases his products from a local beauty center. 

He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with on-time repayments. Today he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l  to make needed improvements for his salon to be able to welcome his clients in a suitable place where they can find excellent service.

loans.use: to make the needed improvements for his salon

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband, 2 school-aged children and one older parent. She cooperates with her husband in providing the family’s income. She has been working as a teacher in a local school for10 years and in 2007 she decided to receive students at her house. 

Today she is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to equip her teaching room with the needed tools. She is in really urgent need of a system to make the room warmer especially in the winter season to make to students feel comfortable while taking the lessons.

loans.use: to equip the teaching room

loans.name: Bosion Group

texts.en: Khadija M., on the left in front, is in her early twenties and married with one child of seven. She has had a beauty salon for five years and works from 7.00 am to 8.00 pm daily, making a fair monthly profit. This will be Khadija's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy salon equipment. She will share this loan with her loan group, Bosion, which has 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other acountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old married man living with his wife and four young children who are still attending school. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a parking lot since 2007 and tries to serve his clients as much as possible. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and he was an excellent client with punctual payments. He is the only one who provides the required income for the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve the parking lot and build tents to cover the cars from the rain.

loans.use: To improve the parking lot

loans.name: Nyakahanga Twetungure Group

texts.en: T. Ruth, with hand raised, is the leader of Nyakahanga Twetungure group in Kihihi. She is 40 years old and married with six children of whom five are in school. Ruth has had a retail shop in Nyakahanga that sells sugar, salt, drinks, and edibles to the customers in her locality for four years and makes 200,000/= as monthly profit. She got encouragement to start up this business from her husband due to the ready market available and now they are both happy. She is determined and trust-worthy and needs to expand her business and have a healthy family. She needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for the shop.

loans.use: Buying more stock for the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He cooperates with his parents to gather a good income for the family. He worked as an electrician who specialized in electronics projects for five years and decided to work as a freelance electrician in 2008. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a Rapid car, which will helps him in his transportation and facilitates his work especially since he works in different places and areas. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming year. He feels positive about his future work and looks forward to taking on bigger projects in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a Rapid car

loans.name: Kibaale Traders Sacco Group

texts.en: K. Yusufu, in the pink shirt, is the leader of Kibaale Traders savings and credit group in Mubende. He is 45 years old and married with 8 children. He has a retail store and is also a farmer in Kibaale LC 1. He is a very honest and loyal man for the 25 years that he has been in business. Farming was his first business and then he turned to retail as well. Now he needs a loan to buy general merchandise for his shop. As a result of taking loans, he has been able to buy a plot of land and a few cows. He hopes to increase the number of cows that he keeps.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more merchandise.

loans.name: Elmer Farid

texts.es:
Elmer, es un joven propietario de un equipo de pesca (lancha), tiene 37 años de edad, reside en Usulután, vive con su familia tienen casa propia, el negocio de la pesca lo tiene desde hace 15 años, ha logrado comprar dos equipos de pesca, en el lugar donde viven esta cerca el mar y fuente de empleo para las personas de cerca como Elmer que a través de la pesca a mantenido a su familia por años. 
El está necesitando un préstamo para complementar la cantidad de dinero para la compra de un motor, ya que tiene incompleta una lancha para utilizarla.
Su objetivo es tener en óptimas condiciones su transporte para realizar su trabajo diario, ayudar a su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida de estos.
texts.en:
Elmer is a young man of 37 who owns his own fishing equipment (boat).  He lives in Usulután with his family and owns his own house.  He has had his fishing business for 15 years and was able to purchase two fishing boats.  He lives very close to the ocean.  This provides him and other residents in his area with a source of employment and has supported his family for years.  

Elmer has a boat that can't be used because it doesn't have a motor so he is requesting a loan to supplement his own money to purchase one.  His goal is to have his boats in optimal working condition in order to be able to do his job every day, help his family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a motor for his fishing boat

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo del Barrio Bernardino  Caballero  surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona. Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser: venta de comidas, despensa, venta de mercaderías comestibles, kiosco,  venta de ropas, peluquería, fabricación de artículos de limpieza.  
Una de la integrantes es la se Vicencia quien  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas.
Ella prepara variados tipos de comidas para sus clientes y comenta que deja buena ganancia, además que en ocasiones recorre varios lugares  para vender y que le ayuda bastante a su familia.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingrediente que utiliza para la  elaboración de comestibles.
texts.en:
This group, which is from the Bernardino Caballero neighborhood, came into being as a result of the promotional activity carried out in the area.  All of the members are active in businesses such as: food production and sales through shops and stands, clothing sales, hairdresser or production of cleaning products.  

One of the members is Vicencia who sells the food she prepares.  She offers a variety of meals to her customers and earns a good profit.  Many times she has had to go out to many different places, but she is a great help to her family.  

She is requesting a loan to buy the ingredients she uses in her food preparation.

loans.use: To buy meat, oil, vegetables, bakery products and other items

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old married man living with his wife and three school-age children in Lebanon. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1998. He works hard to obtain a good income for his family. In addition, he works in the agriculture field. It is common in Lebanon to have multiple jobs in parallel to make profit and cover the heavy expenses of housing, food, school etc.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy a new engine and fix his car to offer a comfortable transportation service to his customers.

loans.use: To buy a new engine and fix his car

loans.name: Jacha Taki Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal  “Jacha Taki” está solicitando su primer crédito en el centro focal de Cascada, un total de  8  socias integran este grupo.
Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, como por ejemplo: tienda de carnicería, venta de mote y condimentos, tejido de chompas, macramé por encargo, venta de sombreros, costura de polleras, elaboración de colchones, venta de cemento – ladrillo -  estuco, tienda de barrio, macramé.

La Banca Comunal Jacha Taki está dirigida por una mesa directiva, a la cabeza se encuentra la presidenta, la señora  Eugenia.

La señora Eugenia tiene un hogar conformado por su esposo y sus dos hijos.   El negocio de la señora Eugenia es la venta de carne de res.  Ha iniciado este negocio por necesidad hace unos seis meses, ella piensa que con el crédito puede comprar mayor cantidad de carne.  El lugar de venta esta en su propio domicilio, por ello la venta es realizada todos los días de 8:00 a 20:00, cuando es necesario le colaboran sus hijos. Este tipo de negocio le permite atender su hogar y cuidar a sus hijos.

Cuando le consultamos a la señora Eugenia sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella responde que es la reunión de pago.
texts.en:
The "Jacha Taki" communal bank, comprised of eight members, is requesting its first loan through the Cascada center.  The ladies have different businesses such as: butcher shop, corn and condiments sales, knitted jackets, macramé orders, hat manufacturer, seamstress, mattress maker, cement, brick and plaster sales, and neighborhood store.

The Jacha Taki community bank is governed by a board of directors with Mrs. Eugenia as their chairwoman.

Eugenia lives with her husband and two children.  She began her business of selling beef some six months ago.  She plans to use the loan to buy more meat.  She runs her store out of her own home between 8:00 a.m. and 8:00 p.m., and sometimes requires the help of her children.  The income is used to help with household expenses and caring for her children.

When we asked Eugenia what she liked about Pro Women she responded by saying it was mainly the payment meeting.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Glenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Glenda de 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo de dos años de edad, residen en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, posee un tienda donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, esta tienda comenzó hace tres años después de que formo su hogar, pensó en una fuente de ingreso para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para la tienda, quiere fortalecer su inventario comprando arroz, pollo, carnes, pastas y bebidas, con esta mercadería en su tienda espera mejorar el servicio a los clientes y aumentar su potencial.
Sueña con crecer en el negocio, ampliarlo y mantener estable sus ganancias para ayudar a su hijo con sano crecimiento, educación y alimentación.
texts.en:
Glenda is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two-year-old son in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  She owns a store and sells staple goods.  After getting married she set up the store three years ago in order to help her husband with the household expenses.

She wants to use the loan to expand the store's inventory to include rice, chicken, meat, bakery products and beverages.  In this way she hopes to offer better service to her customers and grow her business.

Her dream is to increase activity and maintain a stable income so her son can grow up in a healthy atmosphere and receive a good education.

loans.use: To buy rice, chicken, meat, baked goods and beverages

loans.name: Tukolelewamu Group

texts.en: A. Musa, on the right, is the leader of Tukolerewamu group in Mubende. He is 32 years old and married with three children in school. He has a business selling produce from Bangi and grateful that his customers are so loyal and dedicated. He is able to make 100,000/= as weekly profit and these help him in reinvesting in his business as well as caring for his family. Musa is also a farmer who sells some of his plantains. He is very experienced since this has always been a family business — one that he took over from his parents. He needs a loan to be able buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Carmen De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Carmen, es una señora D. 53 años D. edad, es viuda, resiD. en Jiquilisco, departamento D. Usulután, vive con sus hijos quienes la apoyan mucho, ella se dedica a la venta D. frutas y verduras, este negocio lo tiene desD. hace 8 años, lo atienD. todos los días D. la semana; por el momento ella no tiene dinero para invertir en mercadería por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra D. verduras y frutas, con esta inversión espera aumentar su atención y buen servicio  a los clientes ya que en esta temporada muchas personas buscan frutas para acompañar la cena D. navidad.
Su objetivo es seguir en el negocio mientras tenga  salud, ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos D. la casa y continuar dando buen ejemplo D. su dedicación al comercio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 53-year-old widow who lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  She lives with her children, who offer her their full support, and has been selling fruit and vegetables for eight years.  She works seven days a week.

For the time being Carmen has no capital to invest in products to sell so she is requesting a loan to purchase fruit and vegetables.  She wants to improve service to her customers since now many of them are interested in buying fruit for the Christmas season.  Her goal is to stay in business for as long as her health permits, help her children with household expenses and continue serving as a good example of true dedication to business.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 33-year-old man from Palestine and a father of one son and one daughter, Omar has started a studio one and a half year ago, Omar is still working on equipping the studio, which is located in a good location in the city center.

Omar came to FATEN and took a loan to purchase a still camera, as now he is having two photography rooms equipped and he needed a second camera. Omar's work is prospering steadily and he has become well known for his good work and punctuality.

Omar appears in the picture here in his studio.

loans.use: To purchase a still camera

loans.name: Azucena Margarita

texts.es:
Azucena, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, donde vive con su madre, no tiene hijos ni hermanos, ella tienen 25 años de edad, administra un negocio de frutas y verduras, este negocio es de familia y lo tienen desde hace 10 años, quien al principio lo inicio fue una tía y luego se lo heredo a Azucena.
Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en el negocio comprando frutas y verduras, este préstamo ayudara a que posea diversidad de productos y atienda de una mejor manera la demanda generada por los clientes.
Sueña con ser una gran comerciante, que a través de los préstamo pueda darle el desarrollo deseado al negocio para que este sea reconocido en el lugar y cuente con la preferencia de los clientes, también en el ámbito familiar quiere seguir proveyendo para su madre todo lo necesario para la alimentación y gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Azucena lives with her mother in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  She is 25 years old and has no children nor siblings.  She has been operating the family-owned fruit and vegetable business for the last ten years since inheriting it from an aunt.

She is requesting a loan to buy fruit and vegetables and to broaden her product base in order to meet customer demand.

She would like to become an important merchant in the area and use future loans to become well-known among her customers.  She also wants to provide a good income to cover all of her mother's needs and family expenses.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es:
Doña Ana, tiene 58 años de edad, vive con esposo, tiene 3 hijos de 30, 33 y 40 años de edad, residen en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, ella posee una tienda desde hace 8 años, fue por iniciativa propia y junto a su esposo decidieron comenzar con la tienda, la atienden todos los días de la semana, de 5:00am a 7:00pm, hasta la fecha este negocio les ha generado sus ingresos y han solventado sus necesidades más importantes.
Ella necesita en su negocio mercadería como aceite, pollo, queso, pan, detergentes entre otros que son demandados por los clientes, para realizar esta inversión solicita un préstamo que le ayude a hacer las compras y a diversificar su inventario, ella quiere mantener estable el negocio para que tenga vida durante muchos años.

El propósito de Doña Ana es que su negocio sea fortalecido, que continúe ayudando a sus clientes a través del buen servicio y atención y que genere las ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is 58 years old.  She lives with her husband and has 3 children ages 30, 33 and 40.  They live in San Miguel in the department of San Miguel.  As a result of Doña Ana's own initiative, she and her husband decided to open a store 8 years ago.  They wait on customers every day of the week from 5:00 am until 7:00 pm.  To date this business has generated their income and has provided for their most pressing needs.  

For her business, Doña Ana needs to buy merchandise such as oil, chicken, cheese, bread, detergents and other things that her customers request.  To do this she is soliciting a loan to help her to make these purchases and diversify her inventory.  She wants to maintain a stable business so that it is viable for many years to come.  Doña Ana's goal is to strengthen her business, continue providing her customers with good service and attention and to generate the income that she needs to cover her expenses.

loans.use: To purchase oil, chicken, cheese, bread and detergents

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “KUÑA GUAPA ” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Venita quien  se desempeña como vendedora de leche y queso, ventas de verduras, lácteos y cosméticos.
Para preparar varios tipos de comestibles  solicita el préstamo para la compra de carne en gran cantidad.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo, aprendiendo unas de otras. En el 3º ciclo se sienten con mucho mas animo de seguir sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
Several neighbors joined together to form the Kuña Guapa Communal Bank.  All of the members of the communal bank have independent business activities like sales and fast food preparation.

Venita is one of the members.  She sells milk, cheese, vegetables, dairy products, and cosmetics.  In order to prepare various types of food, she is requesting a loan to buy meat in large quantities.

The members formed a communal bank that is capable of jointly carrying out business activities that strengthen their comradeship.  They are learning from each other.  In their third cycle they have a lot of energy to continue their enterprises.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Fátima

texts.es:
Fátima del Socorro Pérez  es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora propietaria de una pequeña pulpería y cosecha tamarindo desde hace 10 años. Ella es una mujer joven, soltera que su mayor anhelo es aumentar su negocio. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en productos para la pulpería como granos básicos, gaseosa, jabón, detergente…etc.
texts.en:
Fátima del Socorro Pérez is a hard-working woman.  She is the dedicated and enterprising owner of a small store.  Also, she has been growing tamarinds for ten years.  She is a young, single woman whose greatest desire is to increase her business.

She will use the loan to buy products like basic grains, soft drinks, soap, and detergent, etc.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, soft drinks, and soap, etc.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro de 45 años de edad, es barbero y posee una barbería y peluquería llamada "Hernández", reside en Lolotiquillo, departamento de Morazán, vive solo con su esposa, este negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y lleva dedicándose a este oficio 11 años, este ha sido su fuente de ingreso y hasta el momento no ha tenido problemas con los clientes, pues ya son personas conocidas que lo recomiendan por su buen trabajo.

Él solicita un préstamo pues quiere remodelar el local, pintar las sillas y las paredes, todo esto con la intención de que sus clientes estén en un sitio mejor, más agradable y mejorar la apariencia para las personas que transitan el lugar, con este préstamo el comprara la pintura tanto para las paredes como para las sillas, espera que a través de esta inversión su situación mejore y pueda atraer a más personas.
Sus proyecciones son mejorar cada día su trabajo, ampliar el local y tener mejores instalaciones, con herramientas nuevas, con su familia pues estar estables económicamente.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 45, is a barber.  He has a barber and hairdresser shop called “Hernández”.  He lives in Lolotiquillo in the Morazán department.  He lives alone with his wife.  This business is located in his home, and he has been working at this trade for 11 years.

This has been his source of income, and so far he has not had any problems with the customers.  They are people who know him, and they recommend him for his good work.

He is requesting a loan because he wants to remodel his place and paint the chairs and the walls.  He wants to do this so that his customers are in a better, more pleasant place.  He wants to improve the appearance for the people who pass by. 

He will use the loan to buy paint for the walls and the chairs. He hopes that through this investment his situation will improve, and he will be able to attract more people.

His plans are to improve his work every day, expand his place, and to have better equipment with new tools.  He also plans to be financially stable with his family.

loans.use: To buy paint

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es: Aura Lila B. Delgado es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de bisuteria negocio que inicio ayudando le a su madre y luego empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. Ella tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales dos están a su cargo y le ayudan en el negocio después de clases.
texts.en:
Aura Lila B. Delgado is a hard-working woman.  She is dedicated and enterprising.  She has a costume jewelry business.  She started out helping her mother.  Later, she started working for herself.  

She has four children under her care.  They help her with the business after classes.

loans.use: Costume jewelry

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela Cruz M. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de lácteos desde 1972. Ella inicio este negocio en el populoso mercado oriental, considerado el más grande de Centroamérica, con la indemnización de su trabajo y considera que se enamoró del queso por eso todo este tiempo ha trabajado con este producto. En la actualidad tiene su puestito en mercadito de San Judas.
Ella invertirá el crédito en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela Cruz M. is a hard-working, dedicated entrepeneur who has been selling dairy products since 1972.  She used her work's severance pay to begin business in the populous east market, considered to be one of the largest in Central America.
