She fell in love with cheese products and has been active in this business since then.

She currently has a stall in the San Judas market.  She plans to invest the loan in her business activity.

loans.use: Dairy products

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio E. works in his family trade of photography.  His grandfather’s interest in photography began when he was a young man living in Campeche, Mexico and he passed this interest on to his children and grandchildren.  When Sergio immigrated to the United States from Mexico, he brought the passion and history of his family photography business with him to El Paso.  He opened his first studio under the family name, Hernandez Photography Studio, in 2006.  He runs the business with his wife and the couple supports their four children with the business. 
   
Sergio is proud that the business is still operating strongly during the economic crisis and looks forward to expanding to a new location in the future.  This loan is the second that Sergio has received from ACCION Texas-Louisiana.  The first helped him remodel his studio and this loan is going to give him working capital to buy equipment.  Sergio found out about ACCION because a representative was a customer of his.  Without this loan, Sergio would not be able to reach his goals of expanding and improving his business.   

Feel free to check out his website:  www.hdezphotography.com

loans.use: To buy new equipment

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.es: Gliceria, de 48 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Cesar de 48 años, y de sus 2 hijos, de los cuales solo se hace cargo del menor, pues el mayor trabaja y se mantiene, pero juntos trabajan para salir adelante en busca del progreso. Desde hace 12 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de pescado en un puesto ubicado en el mercado de su zona. El tiempo que comercializa le ha permitido adquirir experiencia y cantidad de clientes que le consumen con frecuencia sus pescados, por la frescura y calidad de su mercadería, y también porque los precios que son muy cómodos. Ella trabaja sola, durante todos los días, y empieza con la venta desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde; y esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene considerables ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar, también se entretiene bastante conversando con sus clientes mientras les despacha toda clase de pescados y moluscos. Y ya tiene pensado para el futuro instalar un negocio fijo de venta de pescados, además quiere empezar con otro negocio, pero no sabe aun que rubro. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando para salir adelante. Gliceria tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en pescados y también quiere implementar con mejores herramientas su negocio.
texts.en:
Gliceria is 48 years old and lives with her 48-year old husband and two children, one of which is still dependant on the parents for support.  This female entrepeneur has been selling fish at the local market since she was 12 years old.  She has gained much experience from so many years' work and she has many customers who prefer her products for the quality and freshness of the fish.  She also sells at competitive prices.

She works alone every day and opens for business at 7:00 a.m. and works until 2:00 p.m.  She makes a considerable profit which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.  She also enjoys talking to her customers who buy all kinds of fish and shell-fish.

Future plans include setting up a permanent fish selling business and expanding into other areas of business, although she's not sure what that might be for the time being.  This will be the third loan she has obtained through MFP and she is commited to making payments on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who have helped her get this far.  

Gliceria plans to use the loan to buy fish products and add more business tools.

loans.use: To buy more products for her fish business

loans.name: Shevonda

texts.en:
Shevonda A. is passionate about improving the health of her community through zumba fitness.  She opened InspirationZ Studio in September of this year in order to accommodate her growing clientele.  Shevonda named the studio InspirationZ because people are constantly telling her that she inspires them and she is also greatly inspired by her clients.  She says that InspirationZ is not just a business, “this is from my heart.”

Her clients come to her studio because of her different style.  She constantly talks to her clients, correcting their movements, motivating them, and making sure they benefit from the workout.  Shevonda has built a safe space where her clients feel comfortable and supported.  “We laugh, we cry, we scream,” she says.   

Shevonda has already had many success stories.  One of her clients has lost 58 pounds since January, has her diabetes under control, and comes to every workout even when her osteoporosis is causing her pain.  “Her dedication is amazing.”  Another of her clients came to her right after being hospitalized for high blood pressure.  After five weeks of working with Shevonda, he had his blood pressure under control and has since lost 25 pounds.   

Shevonda was referred to ACCION Texas-Louisiana by her bank when she opened a business account.  ACCION gave her the chance to build credit for her business and the money to buy mirrors for the walls and possibly new flooring.  She feels that her loan officer truly believes in what she is doing, and she is thankful for the opportunity she has been given to continue doing what she loves in a safer and more accommodating studio.

loans.use: To buy mirrors and flooring for her studio

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Enrique; el tiene 48 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de pollos y cuyes en Yanatile que queda ubicado en la provincia de Calca que es a una hora de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio también se dedica a la docencia enseñando en un instituto, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de crianza de pollos y cuyes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y pollos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "BUENA ESPERANZA" communal bank which is located in the disctrict of Cusco, Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Enrique is 48 years old and married, with two children.  He alternates his daily activity with the business of raising chickens and guinea pigs in Yanatile, which is located in the province of Calca, a one-hour drive from Cusco.  He also is a high school teacher.

Enrique wants to expand his chicken and guinea pig business and is requesting a loan to increase purchases.

He truly appreciates the loan and is committed to making payments on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M. opened Bistro Six to fulfill her dream of working in the food industry.  She decided to start a food truck because she wanted to make buying excellent food more convenient for people.  Norma and her husband used to grab breakfast at food trucks before work.  These experiences helped Norma learn about this model of food production.  Bistro Six is successful because of the commitment of Norma and her family.  Her oldest son, Javier, is the executive chef and her stepdaughter, Stacey, is the sous chef.  

Norma says that receiving the loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana could not have been more perfectly timed.  She and her husband had depleted personal funds to remodel the truck, but the truck was still not outfitted with kitchen supplies.  They used part of the loan to pay off the remodeling, which included upgrading the electric wires, adding the logo, and buying a new generator.  The day that Norma received the loan, she and her son went shopping for all the pots, pans, and other necessary cooking equipment.  As soon as they bought the supplies, the family “started cooking and didn’t stop for four days” until the food truck’s opening.  Norma and her family would not have been able to achieve their goal without the loan.   

Norma says the most difficult part of owning a food truck is finding a legal place to park.  She has struggled to negotiate the rules surrounding food trucks in San Antonio.  Some challenges are that there are not many curb spaces to fit a food truck and that the truck is not allowed to park within 300 feet of another eatery.  In order to work through these challenges, Norma and a number of other food truck owners have come together to support one another.  They are all parking on one piece of land and are calling the area the Boardwalk on Bulverde.  Norma says that the food trucks are not competition for one another, but rather are fighting through the same problems and banding together to come up with solutions.  

Norma believes that it is important for anyone who has an entrepreneurial inkling to recognize his or her talent and act on it.  Norma says, “once you have a dream, never quit and believe that you can do it.”

loans.use: To pay for pots, pans, and other kitchen equipment and remodeling of her food truck

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in the Hato Mayor region of the Dominican Republic, located in the eastern part of the country.  Hato Mayor is a fairly mountainous region where the principal industry is agriculture.  Simon's community, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from a constant shortage of running water and electricity.

Simon requires a loan to buy diverse inventory (such as cinnamon, and other similar products) for wholesale in order to sell them to others.  He has been running this business for five years.  Simon has taken out a number of loans with field partner Esperanza International over the past five years, all of which have been paid back in full.  He has used these loans to diversify the products that he sells.  He is very excited about taking out this loan so that he can continue to grow his business.

Simon says that his favorite thing is to be with his family, and he hopes that the profits from his business will be saved to buy a bus.  His dream is to have his own house and this vehicle.

loans.use: To buy cinnamon and other similar products for sale.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad del Carmen Vermudez es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada quien desde hace 25 años se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras. Este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo de su suegra  quien le enseño este trabajo y luego se independizo. Con este trabajo ha sacado adelante a sus cuatros hijos de los cuales solo el menor de 19 años está a su cargo.
texts.en: Trinidad del Carmen Vermudez is a hard-working woman who has been selling fruit and vegetables for 25 years.  She started her business with the support of her mother-in-law who taught her the trade and then she set up on her own.  Through her work, Trinidad has managed to get her four children ahead in life.  Only her youngest, who is 19, is still in her care.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Elmer Orlando

texts.es:
Elmer, reside en Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután, tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos uno de 6 años y el otro de 3 años de edad, se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió desde hace mucho, no tiene horario fijo, este trabajo le ayuda a llevar la alimentación necesaria a su familia.
Él solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para plagas, con este préstamo ayudara a su cultivo para que poder realizarlo con los cuidados necesarios para que crezca y produzca en grande.
Su propósito es obtener una buena cosecha, seguir trabajando la tierra y velar por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer lives in Concepción Batres, in Usulután department.  He is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children aged 6 and 3.  He is a livestock farmer and also a crop farmer.  He learned his trade a long time ago.  He doesn't work regular hours and his work helps him to provide his family with the food they need.

Elmer is requesting a loan so that he can buy farming materials such as manure, fertilizers and solutions for treating plant diseases.  This loan will help his crops as he will be able to give them the care they need to grow and produce well.  His goal is to obtain a good harvest, to continue working his land and to look out for his family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers and solutions for treating plant diseases

loans.name: Wilbert Nolberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Wilbert Nolberto; el tiene 60 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ferretería, el tiene una pequeña tienda donde trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar y ampliar le negocio de ferretería. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la ferretería.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Wilbert Nolberto is a member of the "Buena Esperanza" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Wilbert Nolberto is 60 years old.  He is single and has 5 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his hardware business.  He has a small store where he works from 9.00am to 7.00pm.  Through his work, he gets his children ahead in life.

WIlbert Nolberto would like to improve and expand his hardware business.  He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for his store.  He is happy to be receiving a loan and he pledges to make his payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his hardware business

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina, de 61 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su hijo menor Juan de 23 años, de los ocho que tiene, pero los mayores ya están casados y tiene sus propias familias. Esta trabajadora dama se ha dedicado toda su vida al comercio, es por esta razón que desde hace 10 años vende menús (comida diaria) a unos comerciantes de un mercado aledaño a su zona; de lunes a viernes cocina muy temprano y les lleva sus platillos a sus comensales. Le pagan semanal y esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene regulares ganancias y así puede mantenerse sola y ayudar a su hijo en los gastos del hogar. Además paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de ropa, por pedido, durante los fines de semana y también obtiene regulares ganancias. Como es muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene el anhelo de instalar su tienda de repuestos de autos, pues sus hijos mayores tienen este tipo de negocios y sabe que las ganancias son buenas. Es el séptimo  crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Alejandrina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en ropa, pues se acerca las fiestas de fin de año y tiene varios pedidos pendientes por concretar, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 61 years old.  She lives in her own home with her youngest son Juan who is 23 years old.  She has eight children in all but her older children are all married and have their own families.

This hard-working lady has been selling things her whole life.  For the past 10 years she has been selling meals to salespeople in a market in a neighboring area.  From Monday to Friday she cooks her meals very early in the morning and then delivers them to her customers.  Her customers pay her weekly and she is very satisfied because she makes regular income which means that she can support herself and help her son with the household expenses.

In parallel with this business, Alejandrina also sells clothes to order on weekends and makes regular income from this activity too.  As she is a very enterprising woman, in the future she plans to set up a store selling spare parts for cars since her older children have this type of business and she knows that the profits are good.

This is Alejandrina's seventh loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments punctually.  She doesn't want to let down the people who made this support possible as it will enable her to continue working in search of progress.  Alejandrina is planning to invest her loan in buying clothes since the end-of-year festive season is approaching and she has several orders pending which she needs to fill.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

loans.use: To buy clothes to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Reina Idalia

texts.es:
Reina, es una joven de 20 años de edad, reside en Santa Elena, departamento de Usulután, ella está casada y vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 8, 5 y 3 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, negocio que inicio para obtener una fuente de ingreso y poder dar a apoyo a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, no tiene horario fijo.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo ya que no tienen fondos para invertir en la compra de cerdos, pero con esta ayuda espera aumentar el número de cerdos en su pequeña granja, de esta manera continuara dedicándose a este oficio y generando ingresos para el sustento diario de su familia.
Su deseo es crecer, ampliar su granja, comercializar los cerdos a buen precio y ayudar a sus hijos en la educación para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Reina is a young woman of 20 and lives in Santa Elena, in Usulután department.  She is married and lives with her husband and three children aged 8, 5 and 3.  Her business is raising pigs, a business that she started in order to have a source of income so that she could support her husband with their household expenses.  She does not work regular hours.

Reina is currently requesting a loan because she doesn't have enough money to invest in buying pigs.  With this help, she is hoping to increase the number of pigs on her small farm.  In this way, she hopes to continue working in this business, making income to support her family on a daily basis.  Her wish is to grow and expand her farm, to sell her pigs for a good price and to help her children with their education so that they can improve themselves.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Don Lorenzo, es un señor de 52 años, dedicado a la agricultura, vive con su madre y una hermana, él es soltero y no tiene hijos, el tiene 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, de esta actividad ha logrado mantener a su familia con la ayuda de sus sobrinos, no tiene horario de trabajo.
Él está iniciando el proceso de una nueva siembra de maíz para realizarla solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento de plagas, con estos materiales podrá desarrollar el proceso de siembra de una forma ordenada y correcta para obtener una cosecha sana y abundante.
Su principal objetivo es realizar la siembra y obtener una buena producción, comercializar el producto y pagar este préstamo de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 52 years old.  He works as a farmer and lives with his mother and sister.  He is single and doesn't have any children.

Lorenzo has been farming for 30 years.  Through this business, he has managed to support his family with the help of his nephews.  He does not work regular hours.

Lorenzo is starting the process of sowing a new crop of corn.  He is requesting a loan to invest in buying manure, fertilizers and solutions for treating plant diseases.  With these materials, he will be able to carry out his sowing in a tidy and correct manner so that he achieves a healthy and abundant harvest.  His main goal is to sow his crops, to have a good harvest, to sell his produce and to pay back this loan in the best way possible.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers and solutions for treating plant diseases

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 47 años vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 2 hijos mayores, pues es separada; y juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 3 años, esta emprendedora dama se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca. Realiza su labor durante todos los días de la semana y siempre camina  con su catalogo en mano para ofrecer los cosméticos a sus habituales clientes y ha otras que pueda captar. Esta muy satisfecha con su labor ya que ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos, además nunca desatendió las labores de su hogar. Paralelamente a esta actividad también comercializa algunos adornos para el hogar; entre otros pedidos que le puedan realizar sus clientes, y ella les trae lo que piden para luego cobrarles a crédito a un poco mas del precio habitual. Como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un pequeño bazar en su casa, donde ofrecerá sus productos y también diversos artículos para el hogar. Es el 11avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Carmen tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en productos de belleza, pues quiere mejorar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en stock, pues tiene varios pedidos para la campaña navideña que se encuentra próxima.
texts.en:
Carmen is 47 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her two eldest children as she is separated.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead in life.

For three years this enterprising lady has been selling a well-known brand of beauty products.  She works every day of the week and is always walking with her catalog in her hand to sell cosmetics to her regular customers, as well as any others that she might be able to attract.  She is very satisfied with her work since it has enabled her to get her children ahead without ever having had to neglect her household duties.

In parallel with this business, Carmen also sells some household decorations.  Her customers order their products and she brings them what they ask for.  She sells her goods on credit and collects payments that add up to a little more than the regular price.  As she is a very enterprising woman, in the future she plans to set up a small store in her home where she will sell her products and also a range of articles for the home.

This is Carmen's 11th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments punctually.  She does not want to let down the people who made this support possible as it will enable her to continue working in search of progress.  Carmen plans to invest her loan in buying beauty products.  She would like to improve the quantity of merchandise that she has in stock because she has several orders for the Christmas period that is fast approaching.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to satisfy her customers' demands

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosa Beatriz; ella tiene 31 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia tiene su chacra donde cria a toros y vacas la socia se dedica a la ganaderia, a la vez la socia tiene su negocio de venta de pesacdo y pollo en el mercado de la provincia de Urcos, de esta forma la socia saca a su familia adelante.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar toretes para su chacra y para comprar algunos productos para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Rosa Beatriz is a member of the "Qori Orcco" community bank which is located in Urcos, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Rosa Beatriz is 31 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 4 children.  She has a small piece of land where she raised bulls and cows. Sometimes she also sells chicken and fish in the market of Urcos province.  Through her businesses Rosa is able to support and push her family forward.

Rosa Beatriz is requesting this loan to buy young bulls for her farm and some products for her home.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy young bulls for her farm and to buy some products for her home

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Argentina L. de 30 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de calzado desde hace 5 años. En la actualidad aprovechando la temporada invertirá en juegos pirotécnicos.
Ella tiene la meta de mejorar su negocio y seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Rosa Argentina L. is 30 years old.  She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has been selling footwear for 5 years.  She would currently like to take advantage of the season and invest in buying fireworks.  Her goal is to improve her business and continue growing.

loans.use: To buy fireworks

loans.name: Alpacoma Ii Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal  “ALPACOMA II” está solicitando su décimo crédito en el centro focal de Villa Exaltación, un total de  9  socias integran este grupo.

Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, como por ejemplo: venta de ladrillos, fabrica de ladrillos, venta de artefactos electrodomésticos, venta de sullus, compra y venta de ladrillo.  Los integrantes de esta banca comunal están ubicados en una zona en la que el negocio principal es la elaboración y venta de ladrillos.

La Banca Comunal Alpacoma II está dirigida por una mesa directiva, a la cabeza se encuentra la presidenta, la señora  Maria Dolores.

La señora María Dolores tiene un hogar conformado por su esposo y sus tres hijos.   El negocio de la señora María Dolores es la venta de “Sullus” (fetos de llama, resecados, utilizados en las ofrendas a la Pachamama).  Aprendió este negocio de su mamá hace varios años, compra la mercadería de la  población de Desaguadero y vende de manera ambulante en la ciudad de La Paz.

Cuando le consultamos a la señora Eugenia sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer ella responde que le gusta todo, el crédito, la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The “ALPACOMA II” community bank is requesting its tenth loan from the Villa Exaltación regional office.  This group has 9 members.  

The ladies' businesses are all different and include: selling bricks, making bricks, selling electrical appliances, selling 'sullu' (animal fetuses) and buying and selling bricks.  The members of this community bank are located in an area where the main business activity is making and selling bricks.

The Alpacoma II community bank has an executive committee.  The head of this committee is María Dolores, the president. 

María Dolores lives with her husband and three children.  Her business is selling 'sullus' (llama fetuses which are dried and then used in offerings to the goddess Pachamama).  She learned this business from her mother several years ago.  She buys her goods from the town of Desaguadero and sells them as an itinerant street vendor in the city of La Paz.

When we asked Eugenia what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes everything: the loans and the health service.

loans.use: To buy 'sullus' (animal fetuses)

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Trinidad; ella tiene 45 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de compra y venta de ganados vivos que luego lo distribuye a sus clientes y a personas que le solicitan y a la vez vende en su propio estableciento, lleva años en este negocio siendo la única actividad que realiza y de esta forma saca a su familia adelanta.

La socia solicita solicita el préstamo para poder  comprar ganado que luego lo venderá a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Trinidad belongs to the "Qori Orcco" community bank which is located in Urcos district, in Quispicanchis province , in Cusco department.

Trinidad is 45 years old, married and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying live animals which she then sells to her customers and other people who request it.  She also makes sales from her own premises.  She has been in this business for years and it is the only business activity that she carries out.  Her business allows her to get her family ahead.

Trinidad is requesting a loan so that she can buy live animals which she will later sell to her customers.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy animals which she will then sell to her customers

loans.name: Naka

texts.fr: Mme Naka est mariée  et a 42 ans. Elle a en charge 2 enfants.  Elle est dans son deuxième cycle de prêt. En effet, pour arriver à contribuer au foyer, elle fait la vente du glaçon et du jus et compte 5 ans déjà. Pour acquérir les ingrédients, elle le fait à la Société SABL   ATC pour avoir une bonne qualité.  La demande ne cesse d’augmenter, pour satisfaire mieux les clients, elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter un congélateur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Naka is a 42-year-old married woman with two children in her care. She is in her second loan cycle. 

She sells ice and juice to help support the household, and has five years of experience in this activity. She gets her ingredients from SABL ATC to ensure good quality. 

As demand continues to grow, she is seeking a loan to buy a freezer. This will allow her to better serve her customers.

Buying a freezer

loans.use: Buying a freezer

loans.name: Mauricio Ramon

texts.es:
Mauricio de 23 años,  es un hombre trabajador que siempre le ha gustado trabajar con esfuerzo para poder mantener a su familia. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas trabajo de adolecente en una panadería. Poco a poco fue aprendiendo y decidió ubicar una panadería con la ayuda de su mama. Como fueron mejorando sus ingresos en la actualidad se levanta a las 05h00am a elaborar los panes hasta las 06h45am que abre la panadería para atender a sus clientes. Vende toda clase de panes llamados enrollados, mixtos, dulces etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su panadería por eso quiere comenzar con un préstamo para comprar quintales de harina. En el futuro quiere tener en otro sector otra panadería para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 23 years old.  He is a hard-working man who has always liked to work hard to support his family.

Mauricio lives in an urban area called Orquídeas.  He has worked in a bakery since he was a teenager.  He gradually learned the trade and then decided to set up his own bakery with his mom's help.  His sales have improved over time.  He currently gets up at 5.00am and makes his bread until 6.45am when he opens his bakery to serve his customers.  He sells all kinds of different breads called 'enrollados', 'mixtos', 'dulces', etc.

Mauricio has a lot of aspirations for his bakery.  For this reason, he would like a loan to buy 100kg sacks of flour.  In the future, he would like to own another bakery in a different neighborhood so that he can make more income.

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Lourdes Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lourdes Celia; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa deportiva, ella tiene una tienda donde vende buzos, pantalones, polos y short, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa deportiva. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer la ropa deportiva.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lourdes Celia belongs to the "Buena Esperanza" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Lourdes Celia is 48 years old, married and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling sports clothing.  She has a store where she sells tracksuits, pants, tops and shorts.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm.

Lourdes Celia would like to improve and expand her business selling sports clothing.  She is requesting this loan to buy materials for making sports clothing.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy materials for making sports clothing

loans.name: Crsitina

texts.es: Cristina, de 38 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 2 hijos menores; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 4 años, esta laboriosa dama se dedica a la venta de comida (menús) por su zona. Se despierta cada mañana y empieza con la preparación de los 20 platillos que debe entregar al mediodía a sus habituales comensales, que la prefieren por los buenos precios y la exquisitez de sus comidas. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues le ha permitido durante todos estos años sacar adelante a sus hijos; además durante los fines de semana sus hijos le ayudan en la repartición de los platos. Esta muy contenta y por eso tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar un negocio de venta de balones de gas, o también manifiesta que podría ser un locutorio, aún no se decide pero tiene en claro que quiere seguir progresando. Es el 12avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando para salir adelante. Cristina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de balones de gas que necesita para empezar a implementar el negocio que instalará, pues tiene el anhelo de instalar un negocio fijo para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cristina is 38 years old.  She lives in her own home with her two dependent children.  Together they work hard every day to get ahead in life.  For four years, this hard-working lady has been selling meals in her area.  She gets up every morning and begins making the 20 meals that she must deliver at midday to her regular customers who prefer her meals because they are a good price and taste delicious.

Cristina likes her work a lot as it has allowed her, over the years, to get her children ahead in life.  Her children help her to deliver her meals on the weekends.  Cristina is very happy and has many plans for the future such as setting up a business selling natural gas cylinders.  She would also perhaps like to set up a 'locutorio' (an establishment that provides telephone booths for public use).  She is still not certain but she is certain that she would like to continue making progress.

This is Cristina's 12th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments punctually.  She doesn't want to let down the people who are making this support possible as it will enable her to continue working to get ahead in life.  Cristina plans to invest her loan in buying natural gas cylinders that she needs to begin to set up her business.  She would like to set up a regular business to guarantee her children's future.

loans.use: To buy natural gas cylinders to set up her new business

loans.name: Etchrivi

texts.fr: Monsieur Etchrivi est âgé de 30. Il  fait comme activité l’Electricité et la Plomberie où il tire ses revenus.   A travers cette activité, il a remboursé  déjà plusieurs crédits. IL achète les matériels d’électricité  au grand marché de Lomé et travaille dans les zones environnantes  de Lomé. IL  a commencé en 2006 cette activité. Il demande un prêt  pour acheter  10 tubes orange, 15 câbles TH et 2 rouleaux de fil.
texts.en:
Mr. Etchrivi is 30 years old. He makes a living working as an electrician and a plumber. These activities, started in 2006, have already allowed him to repay several loans. 

He gets his electrical equipment at the big market of Lomé and works in the surrounding areas. 

He is seeking a loan to buy 10 orange tubes, 15 TH cables, and 2 rolls of wire.

loans.use: To purchase electrical and plumbing equipment

loans.name: Manolo

texts.en:
Manolo is an individual loan client with Esperanza, and his story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). He is located in Hato Mayor where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife and three children.

Manolo is excited to be taking his second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by purchasing used clothing packets, and ingredients to make empanadas (this is like a snack made with flour and filled with meat, jam, cheese, vegetables, etc.). He started this business with his own savings. He will use the profits to save, because he wants to renovate his house to be a better structure, using concrete blocks. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing and ingredients for empanadas.

loans.name: Elsy

texts.es: Elsy, de 41 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 2 hijos, de los cuales solo se hace cargo del menor, pues el mayor ya se mantiene y trabaja; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Los días de esta emprendedora mujer pasan tranquilos, pues ella se dedica a la atención de la tienda que tiene instalada en su casa. Desde hace 4 años, esta emprendedora dama decidió empezar con un negocio que le permita obtener ganancias y también atender a sus hijos, es así como instala su tienda donde no solo ofrece comestibles si no además adornos y diversos artículos para el hogar, es por esta razón que su tienda es muy visitada por sus vecinos. Le gusta mucho su labor porque es tranquila y mientras comercializa se entretiene conversando con sus vecinos, quienes suelen comprarle por los buenos precios de su mercadería. Como siempre piensa en el futuro ya tiene pensado ampliar su tienda para ofrecer lo  mejor a sus clientes, y de esta manera espera alcanzar el progreso. Es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Elsy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en comestibles para surtir mejor su tienda, pues debe ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes durante la campaña navideña que esta próxima.
texts.en:
Elsy, 41, lives in her own house with her 2 children. She looks after the youngest child only, as the eldest already works and earns a living. Together they strive to get ahead every day. The days of this enterprising woman are peaceful, because she manages a store installed in her own home. Four years ago she decided to start a business that would allow her to make a profit and also care for her children. That's why she opened the store, where she not only sells food, but also decorative and household items. The store is well liked by her neighbours, who buy because of the good prices of the merchandise. She loves her work because it is quiet and she enjoys talking to her neighbours when she is selling to them. 

She always thinks about the future and she already has plans to expand her store in order to offer the best to her customers and make progress. This is her eighth loan with MFP and she is committed to replaying it on time, because she doesn't want to disappoint those who are helping her to continue to work. Elsy is planning to invest the requested loan in the purchase of foodstuff to stock up her store, because she wants to offer the best to her customers during the Christmas season.

loans.use: Buy assorted products to stock up her store.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en: Mathias Bahati N. is thirty eight years old and married with two children aged thirteen and nine. His business is located at Pirates beach in Mombasa, the coastal region of Kenya well known for its many many tourist attractions — not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He has been selling stone carvings and sculptures for the last five years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy wood and stones to make more carvings to meet the high demand, especially during the Christmas season. He hopes to give a good life to his family and describes himself as customer friendly.

loans.use: Wood and stone

loans.name: Ilsia Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, tiene 37 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos, se dedica a la sastrería, ella inicio como empleada de un taller de sastrería, pero al pasar del tiempo cuando aprendió perfectamente el trabajo decidió instalar su propio negocio, compro sus propias maquinas de coser y lleva ya 16 años D. ser sastre.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la adquisición de una maquina sencilla, comprara además materia prima como telas, hilos, cierres y broches, todo esto con la intención de fortalecer el taller y de disponer de materiales para la fabricación de ropa que los clientes le soliciten, así mismo podrá aumentar su número de costuras para ofrecer.
Su objetivo es hacerse de maquinas para aumentar su producción, mejorar el servicio brindado a los clientes a través de las costuras de trajes, vestidos y pantalones; y mejorar los ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Evelyn lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután.  She is 37 years old and lives with her 2 children.  She works as a tailor.  She started out as an employee in a tailoring workshop but after some time, when she had perfected her tailoring techniques, she decided to set up her own business.  She bought her own sewing machines and has been working in this business for 16 years.

She is requesting a loan to buy a basic sewing machine, and also material such as fabric, thread, zippers and snaps. This will strengthen her business and allow her to have materials available for making the clothing that her customers request, so that she can increase the number of garments she offers.

Her goal is to get more machines to increase her production and to provide better service to her customers via the suits, dresses and pants she produces.  She would also like to increase her household income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, thread, zippers and snaps

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan T. is thirty-seven years old, married and they have two children aged seven years old and five years old. His business is located at a busy area called Bandarini in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches.

He operates a small restaurant in which he serves food and drinks to his customers. He has been in this business for the last one and half years and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy utensils and expand his working area to grow his business and serve more people. He hopes to open a hotel and eventually a catering school. He describes himself as ambitious.

loans.use: To buy utensils and expand premises.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy W. W. is thirty-six years old, married and has three children. Her business is located at Changamwe estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian ocean white beaches.

She has been selling vegetables, coconuts and potatoes for the last two years and she serves the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is the high perishability of some of her items like tomatoes. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more vegetables, coconuts and potatoes to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to be a wholesaler in future. She describes herself as patient, aggressive and goal oriented.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, coconuts and potatoes.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 33 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Rolando de 33 años y de sus 2 pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde muy joven esta dedicada mujer siempre ha laborado en el comercio de diversos artículos, y hace siete  años comercializa productos naturales y también de limpieza. Ella trabaja de lunes a viernes, durante sus ratos libres, y le va muy bien pues lo productos de limpieza los fabrica su hermano y se los vende barato, de esta manera ella puede obtener buenas ganancias de las ventas. Le gusta mucho ofrecer las hierbas naturales, que compra a mayoristas, pues sabe de las bondades curativas de éstos productos. Los días de Liz pasan tranquilos entre el cuidado de sus hijos y su trabajo que no le toma mucho tiempo; y ya esta pensando instalar un negocio de venta de venta de productos de limpieza en un local fijo ya que tiene varios clientes fijos. Es el 20avo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar adelante con su negocio. Liz tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en productos de limpieza, pues quiere abastecerse para el año venidero.
texts.en: Liz, 33 years old, lives in her own house with her husband Rolando, who is 33 years old, and her two small children.  They work hard every day to get ahead.  Since she was very young, this dedicated woman has worked at selling various products and for the last seven years she has been selling natural products and cleaning supplies.  She works from Monday to Friday, during her free time, and she is doing very well because her brother makes the cleaning products and she is able to get them very cheaply and can this way make good profits from her sales.  She likes to sell the natural herbs, which she buys from a wholesaler, because she know that they offer many curative benefits. Her days are quiet, between the care of her children and her work which does not take too much of her time.  She is thinking of opening a store selling cleaning products, now that she has some stable customers.  This is her 20th loan with MFP and she promises to pay her installments on time because she does not want to look bad to all the people that have made her support possible and allow her to continue to get ahead.  Liz is planning to invest this loan in the purchase of cleaning merchandise and supply her business for the upcoming year.

loans.use: Purchase cleaning products to supply her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia y su pareja son convivientes, tienen dos hijos, de 10 y 2 años de edad. Sonia invierte los préstamos que recibe en sus negocios que tiene en el mercado. Cada mes, Sonia viaja a Lima para comprar joyas como aretes y pulseras, que lleva a vender en el mercado central de Ayacucho. Sonia es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace un año, lo que más le gusta son los incentivos para ahorrar y las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque le han capacitado. Su sueño es que sus hijos asistan a la universidad y sean profesionales
texts.en: Sonia lives with a partner and their 2 children aged 10 and 2.  Sonia invests the loans she receives in the businesses that she has in the market.  Every month, Sonia travels to Lima to buy jewelry such as earrings and bracelets, which she sells in the central market of Ayacucho.  Sonia has been a member of FINCA Peru for a year, and what she likes most are the incentives to save and the meetings of her communal bank, because they have provided her with training.  Her dream is to have her children attend the university and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy jewelry in Lima

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna es madre soltera de dos niños. Su hijo menor asiste diariamente a una escuela especial ubicada en Quinua a una hora desde su casa. Reyna tiene una tienda de abarrotes, con su último préstamo, compró productos como arroz, azúcar y aceite para su tienda. Como socia antigua de FINCA Perú, Reyna ha aprendido a ahorrar el dinero suficiente para construir una casa en Ayacucho para su hermana.  A ella le gusta ser socia de FINCA Perú más que nada por los préstamos e incentivo  del ahorro. De las charlas dadas por miembros del personal de FINCA Perú, ella ha aprendido a administrador de su dinero, cuidar mejor a sí misma y cómo mejorar su negocio. Su sueño es seguir ahorrando dinero para compras futuras, como un automóvil.
texts.en: Reyna is a single mother of 2 children.  Her youngest child goes each day to a special school located in Quinua, an hour from the house.  Reyna has a grocery store.  With her last loan she bought products such as rice, sugar and cooking oil for her store.  As a longtime member of FINCA Peru, Reyna has learned to save, and has saved enough money to build a house in Ayacucho for her sister.  She enjoys being a member of FINCA Peru most of all for the loans and the saving incentives.  From the talks given by the staff of FINCA Peru, she has learned to manage her own money, and to take better care of herself and improve her business.  Her dream is to continue to save money for future purchases, such as an automobile.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of groceries

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal “12 D. Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia D. Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 51 años, D. estado civil casada, tiene ocho hijos independientes.

Trabaja  hace un año con el Movimiento   Manuela  Ramos,  su  préstamo  inicial fue D.  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. comidas fuera D. los establecimientos, en las ferias.

Solicitará un  nuevo crédito por la suma  D. S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio, con el cual comprará productos como azúcar, chocolates, leche, arroz, papa, y gas, es ayudada en el negocio por sus hijos y su esposo.

Su sueño es mejorar el negocio.

Le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo
texts.en:
María is a member of the "12 D. Agosto" community bank which is located in Puno district, in the province and department of the same name.  She is 51 years old, married and has eight children who live independently.

María has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling meals outsiD. businesses, in markets.

María is requesting a new loan for 600 Peruvian soles which she will invest in her business, buying products such as sugar, chocolate, milk, rice, potato and gas.  María receives help in her business from her children and her husband.  Her dream is to improve her business.  What she likes about her community bank is the convenience of the loans.

loans.use: To buy products such as sugar, rice, potatoes and gas for preparing her meals

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en: Mirna is a 28 year old married woman, living in Baalbeck with her husband  and 3 children. Mirna has worked as a Tailor since 2005. In her house, she works sewing garments and her clients ask about her from town to town. She helps her husband provide their income, and plans to open a showroom for her designs. They aim to raise their kids in a healthy and secure way. Her clients are friends, relatives and neighbors.

loans.use: To buy new textile designs.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.es: Guillerma es casada y tiene tres hijos de 20, 14, y 6 años de edad. Los dos menores se encuentran todavía en la escuela y la mayor esta en Lima. Guillerma y su esposo son los carniceros en la ciudad de Quinua, que está a una hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Ellos compran animales como cerdos, vacas, carneros en ferias de ganado y diversas granjas y venden la carne en el mercado central de la Quinua. El negocio ha sido lento últimamente porque ha habido menos lluvia que lo normal y los animales no tienen tanto que comer. Guillerma es socia de FINCA Perú hace 11 años aproximadamente. A ella le gusta trabajar con FINCA Perú porque le ayudan a obtener el capital que necesita para invertir en su negocio y ahorrar dinero y educar a sus hijos. Su sueño es la construcción de una casa en Quinua y dice que para Junio próximo debería haber ahorrado lo suficiente para comenzar la construcción!
texts.en: Guillerma is married and has three children who are aged 20, 14, and 6. The two younger ones are still at school and the eldest is in Lima. Guillerma and her husband are butchers in the city of Quinua, which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho. They buy animals such as pigs, cows, rams at livestock fairs and various farms and sell the meat at the Quinua central market. Business has been slow lately because there has been less rain than normal and the animals don't have so much to eat. Guillerma has been a member of FINCA Perú for approximately 11 years. She likes working with FINCA Perú because they help her obtain the capital that she needs to invest in her business and save money and educate her children. Her dream is to build a house in Quinua and she says that by next June she would have saved sufficient to start building!

loans.use: Buy young animals

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is an individual loan client with Esperanza, and he is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza. In his business, he produces and sell Pastel en Hojas (meat or vegetables coated in a blend of mashed plantain, green banana or yuca, wrapped in the leaves of a banana tree and then boiled in water), a traditional plate for the Dominican cuisine. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by purchasing beef, chicken, plantains, seasoning, yuca, and other vegetables. 

Rene makes his home here in a simple structure with his wife and three children. He has been running his business for about 10 years. He will use the profits to improve his business and to establish it. His story is representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). He is located in Hato Mayor where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy plantain, seasoning, meats.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 23 year old single man from Baalbeck, and the owner of a household appliances shop since 2008. Mohamad is working on improving his new business, and that’s why he requested a loan, for the first time, from Al Majmoua. Mohamad’s honesty is his power in front of all the competition around him. He is well known in the region, and neighbors, friends and relatives talk about him and about his personality, and say that they can rely on him for every single need they request. Mohamad hopes to open a new branch in the future, and make a beautiful family.

loans.use: To improve his business.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de M.R.A.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, algunas van a empezar a emprender actividades independientes con el crédito obtenido por la Fundación Paraguaya.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 

La Señora Erika es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la compra y ventas de Ropas, también tiene una librería donde tiene minicarga, ventas de golosinas.
Todos sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus trabajos. 
Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 1  hijo y su marido quien trabaja  como Albañil. 
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. 
La señora Erika solicita el crédito para la compra de más Ropas y ampliar su librería.
texts.en:
“La Esperanza” (The Hope) Communal Bank was formed by bringing together various neighbors of M.R.A. City.  All the bank's members carry out their activities independently; for example, sales and preparing fast food. Some will begin carrying out independent activities with this loan obtained through the Fundacion Paraguaya (Paraguay Foundation).  The members have formed a very united group, capable of realizing together activities that strengthen their collegiality.

Erika is one of the bank's members. She is dedicated to buying and selling clothing, and also has a book store where she sells small items, including sweets. All her customers admire her efforts. Erika has a very united family with 1 child and a husband, who works as a bricklayer.

Erika is very satisfied with her activity and the training they receive as a group. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing to sell, and to expand her book store.

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTHING, T-SHIRTS, SHORTS, AND OTHER ITEMS TO SELL

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, es una madre de familia muy emprendedora, vive en casa de sus familiares, en compañía de su esposo y su hijo. Todos los días de la semana, Ana trabaja brindando el servicio de transporte público en su motocarro. En un inicio su esposo fue quien se dedicaba a esta actividad, pero tuvo una propuesta de empleo y para no dejar de percibir ganancias, así que ella tomó la posta de este trabajo. Han transcurrido un año dedicándose a esta labor, ha aprendido a tener destreza y habilidad en el manejo de éste vehículo. Se siente muy feliz por desarrollarse en esta actividad, asimismo le es muy rentable, con lo cual puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. En adelante anhela comprar su propio moto carro, de ese modo podrá alquilar la moto que tienen y así generarse ingresos adicionales. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar a tiempo sus cuotas; para así  acceder a posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará llantas para su moto carro, para tener en buenas condiciones su motocarro.
texts.en: Ana is a mother and a very enterprising person. She lives in a house belonging to her family, in the company of her husband and their son. Every day of the week Ana provides public transport with the help of her motorcycle rickshaw. In the beginning it was her husband's business but he got a job offer and for the sake of keeping this source of income she took it up.  It has been one year since she started in the business, and she has learned the skills and abilities to drive such a vehicle. She is very happy to have started in the business especially because it is so profitable. She is able to contribute with her husband towards the household expenses. In the future she endeavors to purchase her own rickshaw, to be able to rent out the motorcycle they already have as an additional source of income. This is her second loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she knows she needs to make her payments on time to be eligible for any future loans. The loan she requests will be used to purchase tires for her rickshaw, to have a dependable vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase new tires.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 

La Señora María  es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la  venta de  mercaderías varios para la comunidad.
 
Ella tiene una familia muy unidad con 2  hijos y su marido es Empleado. 
Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
La señora María solicita el crédito para la ampliación de su Almacén y comprar varias mercaderías como azúcar, arroz, fideos, aceite,  y otros.
texts.en:
The group named "Mujeres Unidas" is formed from several individuals who are neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. 

Each of the members has their own business, including sales, and fast food. The members of the group are very close knit and very capable of team work, to strengthen their sense of collegiality.

Maria is one of the members of the group and she has a general store in her community. 

She is very close to her family; she has 2 children and a husband who is employed.

She is very happy with her business and with the support she receives from her group. Maria requests a loan to supplement her inventory and to purchase various merchandise such as sugar, rice, pasta, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, flour, meat, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas.
 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas.
La señora Marina es una de las integrantes y se desempeña como chipera (vendedora de chipas), ella vende las chipas en varios lugares con concurrencia de la genta especialmente a la gente que viaja, por ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de chipa para esta época ya que mucha gente que viaja hacia el interior del país para la fiestas.
texts.en:
The group named "Mujeres Unidas" is formed from several individuals who are neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. 

Each of the members has their own business, including sales, and fast food.

Marina is a member of the group and she sells biscuits. She sells biscuits in various well traveled locales, especially focusing on travelers. She requests a loan to purchase biscuits for this time of year when there are many holiday travelers in the country.

loans.use: To purchase biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Acuario 2 Group

texts.es: La foto fue tomada en la ciudad de Orizaba, en casa de Leticia R. una integrante del grupo "Acuario 2". Se ven las 11 integrantes en la foto. La señora Leticia se dedica a la compra de tiempo aire para célulares que inició hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de tiempo aire y accesorios para teléfono. Sus ganancias aumentan ya que en esta temporada solicitan muchas recargas para célular.Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente satisfecha ya que con ello obtendrá más ganancias. Tiene 49 años, estudió hasta el bachillerato, es madre y tiene en total 3 hijos de los cuales los tres son varones. Quiere este crédito para comprar una vitrina para poder poner sus accesorios y exhibirlos.
texts.en: The photograph was taken in the city of Orizaba, at the home of Leticia R., one of the members of the Acuario 2 Group ("aquarium"). The 11 members are pictured. Señora Leticia has been buying and selling air time for cell phones for 5 years. She applies for this loan to buy air time and phone accessories. This season she has better earnings because many customers ask for recharge cards for their cell phones. When Leticia applied for this loan, she was satisfied because it will enable her to earn a higher income. She is 49, studied until high school and is the mother of three children, all boys. She wants this loan to buy a showcase to display her phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy air time, accessories and a showcase for cell phones.

loans.name: Los Solares 1 Group

texts.en:
Sonia is one of the members of Los Solares 1 (her community is called Plot 1). They are micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling clothing, natural goods, shoes, education, etc. in the city of San Pedro D. Macoris, which is famous for its athletes and its sugar industry. At present, its economy depends on the duty-free industrial zones, the cement industry and other minor activities like tourism. Sonia is the mother of three children and, together with her husband, she has been able to proviD. the necessities for her family. 

Sonia is receiving her ninth loan. For each loan, she has maD. her payments on time and has maD. good investments. She is planning to invest her new loan to purchase new clothes for men, women and children. She is going to use her earnings to save and continue providing the necessities for her home. By saving regularly, she will be able to build a new home - this is her more difficult challenge. Her favorite activity is reading.

loans.use: To buy clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Martha Maximiliana

texts.es:
Martha  es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años, de estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella, realizó estudios hasta 4º de educación secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 años, su  préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para comprar granos, actualmente trabaja en cuidado de niños en el wawawasi (centro de cuidado para niños).

Su nuevo crédito fue de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en materiales educativos, lanas para sus títeres, cuentos en bordados, etc, y también comprará materiales para construir su casa, su esposo trabaja en construcción.

Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes y terminar con la construcción de su casa.

Le gusta del Banco Comunal las reuniones nos sentimos como una familia y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the communal bank "August 12" in the Puno region. She is 35 years old and is married. She has 2 children that depend economically on her. She completed 4 years of secondary education.

She has been working with the "Manuela Ramos Movement" for six years. Her first loan was for 300.00 nuevos soles, which she used to buy grains. Now she works taking care of children in "wawawasi" (a child care center).

Her new loan was for 1000.00 nuevos soles, which she will used to buy educational materials, wool for her puppets, embroidered story books, etc. She will also buy materials to build her house. Her husband works in construction.

Her dream is to have a grocery store and finish the construction of her home.

She likes the meetings of the communal bank and the ease of the loan. She says, "We feel like a family."

loans.use: To buy materials such as wool, stories, and other things for the making of educational materials.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este comité, esta constituido por 21 señoras que luchan día a día para mantener a sus familias, cada una tiene un trabajo propio, y las ganas DE seguir adelante. Y esto es posible gracias al apoyo créditicio que le brinda la Fundación paraguaya la de formar un Comité de Mujeres en donde la responsabilidad es conjunta y el compromiso solidario.
Una de la integrantes es la señora Ana quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles para mucha gente que trabaja cerca de su casa y asi logra obtener para su ingreso y de esa manera ayudar a su familia.
El ingreso que el obtiene le ayuda a su familia para la alimentación y de esa manera no pasan necesidades.
Ella solicita el prestamo para la compra de carne ingrediente mas importante para sus comestibles.
texts.en:
This committee is made up of 21 ladies who work hard every day to support their families.  Each member has her own business activity and the desire to get ahead in life which is made possible through the support that Fundación Paraguaya offers them with their loans.  They have formed their own Women's Committee which emphasizes joint responsibility and commitment. 

One of the group's members is Ana who sells food to a lot of people who work near her home.  This makes her an income which she uses to help her family.  Her income helps provide her family with food so that they do not have to experience hardship.  She is requesting this loan to buy meat which is the most important ingredient in her meals.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Flores Magon Group

texts.es:
La señora Roció Sanromán M., ella es parte del grupo “Flores Magon” comentan que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que la mayoría de las integrantes viven en ese andador llamado Flores Magon y dice q	ue esta muy orgullosa de pertenecer a este grupo porque ella es la representante de este. Ella originaria de la población llamada Zitácuaro Michoacán, tiene 29 años de edad, está estudiando la preparatoria abierta en este momento porque sus papas no tenían dinero para comprarle el uniforme y los útiles escolares, dice que su esposo es una gran ayuda para ella porque él la motiva a salir adelante para que estudie una carrera. Doña Rosy como le dicen sus amigos y familiares se dedica a vender dulces, jugos, chicharrones preparados con soya, refrescos, frituras, paletas de hielo etc., frente al hospital regional de Zitácuaro, tiene con su negocio 2 años, comenta que empezó a vender sus jugos y demás cosas porque ella veía que las personas que tenían enfermos en el hospital no tenían que almorzar y por eso ella decidió poner su puesto, otro de los motivos por el cual puso su puesto fue que le quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. La señora Rosy, está casada con el señor Salvador, el es abogado y tienen una niña de seis años llamada Leylan que estudia el primer año de primaria. Dice la señora Rosy que su meta en la vida es poder hacer un local estable donde pueda vender sus dulces y vender bisutería ya que le gusta diseñar collares y pulseras de pedrería, otra de sus metas es terminar la preparatoria y terminar la carrera de Licenciado en Derecho. Comenta que con las ganancias que saque de vender sus dulces y jugos ahorrara para comprar un terreno para hacer el local que tanto sueña.

María Amparo S., es parte del grupo “FLORES MAGON" tiene 43 años y estudio hasta el tercer año de preparatoria comenta que no termino sus estudios ya que sus papás no tuvieron el dinero suficiente para seguirla apoyando con los gastos de la escuela. Doña Amparo está casada con el señor José Carlos él es carpintero ellos tienen 3 hijos  de nombres José Carlos el cual trabaja con su papa y quiere emprender una tienda de abarrotes, Paulo Cesar de 13 años de edad el estudia la secundaria y Mauricio de 6 años estudiante de primaria Ella se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catalogo como cremas, cosméticos, etc, lleva con esta actividad aproximadamente 9 años, decidió emprender este negocio para ayudar con su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos y también para estar al pendiente de ellos y de su casa. Doña Elvia está solicitando su préstamo para invertir en cosméticos para tener en existencia y no pedirlos porque es algo tardado los pedidos que realiza, La meta que tiene para su negocio es seguir incrementando el número de clientas.

Los otros 10 integrantes se llaman María Guadalupe Julián C., Reyna P. Esquivel, Isabel M. García, Clementina Solís Setina, Stephanie Sanromán Sandoval, Teresa López Pichardo, Perla Janeth M. López, Azucena Julián C., José Carlos J. S., Marisol Sanromán Sandoval ellos quieren los préstamos para invertir en venta de colchas por catalogo, venta de dulces, zapatos por catalogo, manualidades, panadería, cosméticos por catalogo etc.

***la chica a la mesa con blusa blanca y chamarra de mezclilla es la coordinadora de FRAC***
texts.en:
Roció Sanromán M. is part of the group “Flores Magon." She says she gave the group this name because the majority of the members live in the Flores Magon area. She also says that she is very proud to belong to this group and be its representative. She is from the town of Zitácuaro Michoacán, and she is 29 years old and is finishing high school in an Open High School program, because her parents were unable to afford her uniform and other school supplies when she was younger. She says that her spouse is a great help to her because he motivates her to study and to advance. Rosy, as her friends call her, sells sweets, juices, soy chicharrones, soft drinks, fried foods, ice blocks, and more, in front of the regional hospital of Zitácuaro. She has had this business for 2 years, and began to sell juices and other things because she saw that the family members of the hospital patients didn't have anything for lunch, and she decided to put up her stall. Another motivation for putting her stall there was that she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses. Rosy is married to Salvador, who is a lawyer and they have a 6 year old daughter named Leylan, who is in first grade. Rosy says that he goal in life is to be able to have a fixed location from which to sell her treats and also to sell jewelry, as she likes to design necklaces and jeweled bracelets. Another of her goals is to finish school and complete a degree in law. She says that with the earnings from her sales of sweets and juices that she's saved, she wants to buy some land to have permanent store she's dreamed of. 


María Amparo S. López is part of the “Flores Magon” group. She is 43 year old and is in her third year of Open High School. She says she had not finished her studies earlier because her parents didn't have the money to continue to support her with her school expenses. She is married to José Carlos who is a carpenter and together they have 3 sons: José Carlos, who works with his dad and wants to open a grocery store, Paulo Cesar, who is 13 years old and studies in secondary school, and Mauricio, who is 6 and is in primary school. María sells beauty products through a catalogue, like creams, makeup, etc. She has done this for about 9 years. She decided to open her business to help her husband with the kids' expenses and also to be able to watch over them and her house. Elvia is seeking this loan to invest in cosmetics to add to her stock and not to have to order them when her clients request them because it delays her ability to deliver her clients' items. Her goal is to continue increasing her number of clients. 

The other 10 group members are: María Guadalupe Julián C., Reyna P. Esquivel, Isabel M. García, Clementina Solís Setina, Stephanie Sanromán Sandoval, Teresa López Pichardo, Perla Janeth M. López, Azucena Julián C., José Carlos J. S., Marisol Sanromán Sandoval. They seek this loan to invest in the purchase of bedding, sweets, shoes, handiwork, bread, and cosmetics. 

***The woman at the table with the jean jacket is the coordinator from FRAC (a Kiva partner) ***

loans.use: To purchase sweets, juices, refreshments, etc.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
Melania  es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 18 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 01 hijo, estudio educación secundaria

La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora al Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su préstamo solicitado es S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de choclos cocidos y verduras, para la cual comprará choclos, quesos, y verduras etc., su esposo trabaja en construcción.

Desea que su negocio de buenos frutos.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Melania is a member of the community bank “12 de Agosto” ("August 12th") in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 18 years old, has a common-law spouse, has one child, and attends secondary school.

She is a new member who recently joined the Manuela Ramos Movement. She seeks a loan of 500 Peruvian Soles, which she decided to invest in her business of selling cooked corn on the cob, for which she will buy ears of corn, cheeses, and other vegetables. Her spouse works in construction. She wishes for good products for her business. What she likes most about her community bank is the ease of the loan process.

loans.use: To buy ears of corn, cheeses, and other vegetables for her business

loans.name: Naam

texts.en: Naam is a 57-year-old widow and mother of three children from Baalbeck. Naam has owned a butcher shop and a bakery for 30 years. She has worked hard to fill the space her husband left to raise her kids. She is both the mother and the father, as her neighbors describe her. Naam is a hard worker and she is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary flour and gas to increase her business. Naam hopes to keep growing her business for her children.

loans.use: To buy flour and gas to increase her business

loans.name: El Oasis 1 Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de Judith una integrante del grupo El Oasis 1 que está ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en México. Se ve al grupo de señoras alrededor de la mecancía en la foto. Ella se dedica a la venta de muebles y bisutería que inicio hace 1 año. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en material para bisuteria y segir invirtiendo en su negocio de muebles. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta y satisfecha. Tiene 21 años, estudió hasta 3er. semestre de preparatoria, vive en unión libre y tiene en total 1 hijo varón de 2 años. Tambien espera poder incrementar más sus ventas y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Judith's home.  Judith is a member of the El Oasis 1 group which is located in the State of Veracruz in Mexico.  Here in the photo you can see the ladies surrounding her merchandise.  Judith sells furniture and jewelry.  She started her business one year ago.

Judith is requesting a loan to invest in material for making jewelry and to keep her furniture business running.  At the time of requesting this loan she feels happy and satisfied.  She is 21 years and studied up to the third semester of high school.  She lives with her common-law husband and has a 2 year-old son.  She hopes to be able to further increase her sales and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy furniture and jewelry

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is one of our associates from the Hato Mayor´s branch, one of the most rural cities of the country and its economy depends on agriculture. She is a merchant selling clothing.  She is the mother of one.  Maria tells us that the most difficult part has been to build her house.  This made her want to work so that her business keeps growing, while she continues helping at the church, her favorite activity.
