Maria is very excited to be receiving her first loan from Esperanza Internacional.  She has been working for about 7 years.  She started on her own to generate earnings when she could save to start her business . She will use the money from the loan to buy clothing for men, women and kids.  She plans to use the profit to save and to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing for sale.

loans.name: Maria Grimaneza

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto” del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años, de estado civil viuda, tiene 01 hijo que depende económicamente de ella, la señora realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Trabaja  con el  Movimiento   Manuela  Ramos desde hace 04 meses su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de golosinas, galletas y productos de belleza.

Su nuevo crédito fue de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que aumentará al capital de su negocio para comprar galletas, aceite, huevo, champús, detergentes, etc., lo realiza sola.

Su sueño es ser mayorista en abarrotes.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el apoyo de las socias.
texts.en:
María is a member of the community bank “12 de Agosto” ("August 12th") which is in the district, province, and department of Puno. She is 40 years old, is a widow, and ha one child who depends on her economically. María completed her secondary school education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four months. Her initial loan was for 500 Peruvian Soles, which she will use in her business, which sells sweets, cookies, and beauty products. She will use the loan to add to her store's stock, buying cookies, oil, eggs, shampoos, detergents, etc. She runs this business on her own. Her dream is to be able to be a grocery wholesaler. What she likes most about her community back is the support of the members.

loans.use: To purchase supplies like cookies, oil, eggs, shampoo, and other products for her store

loans.name: Po Joayu Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de 17 Señoras  trabajadoras quenes se unierón para formar un grupo; un comité solidario Financiado por la Fundación Paraguaya, en donde el compromiso es conjunto y la clave del éxito poseer un espiritu emprendedor.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Gloria quien se dedica a la venta de joyas.
Ella compra las joyas de proveedores o viaja hasta la ciudad de Luque n donde se hace joyas de plata.
Comenta que no se queja de las ventas que tuvo en esta epoca pero quiere continuar con muchas variedades de joyas para la venta para ello solicita el prestamo para la compra de joyas de plata como pulseras, cadenas, aros y otros.
texts.en:
This group of 17 hardworking women have united as a group, a "financial solidarity committee" or communal bank, through the [field partner] Fundación Paraguaya. The pledge to repay the loan is a joint one, and the key to success is an entrepreneurial spirit. One of the members is Señora Gloria, who dedicates her time to selling jewellery. 

Señora Gloria buys the jewellery from intermediaries or travels to the city of Luque where they make siver jewellery. She says that while she can't complain about the sales she has had lately, she wants to continue stocking many styles of jewellery for sale. She is therefore seeking the loan to buy silver jewellery such as bracelets, chains, earrings and other things.

loans.use: To buy silver jewellery such as bracelets, earrings, chains and other things

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 49 años, es una buena y muy laboriosa madre de familia, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijas. Con mucho esfuerzo,  Ana logró salir adelante en su taller de carpintería, situado en un ambiente de su casa. Es ahí, donde trabajan conjuntamente con su esposo, y ella es la encargada de lijar las piezas de madera, que luego armarán para lo que será muebles. De esta manera vienen trabajando durante 25 años. Le gusta la labor que desarrollan, le generan buenas utilidades y más cuando son temporadas festivas. Mientras Ana y su esposo se encargan del taller, su hija es la encargada de ofrecer y vender sus mubles, en un Stand que tienen situado dentro del mercado. En adelante desea ampliar su negocio, asimismo mejorar las técnicas en la fabricación de muebles. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y hace compromiso de pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas, porque desea contratar con posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de madera ya que tiene mucha demanda de muebles.
texts.en: Ana, age 49, is a good and very hardworking mother. She lives in her own house, together with her husband and their 2 children. With a lot of effort, Ana has succeeded in developing her carpentry workshop, located in a room of her house. Here she works alongside her husband, and she is in charge of planing and sanding the pieces of wood, preparing it for being made into furniture. They have been working like this for 25 years. She is pleased with the work they do; they make a good living - and more in the festive season. While Ana and her husband run the workshop, her daughter takes charge of selling their furniture, at a stall they have inside the market. Going forward, Ana would like to expand her business and at the same time improve her skills in making the furniture. This is her first loan from [field partner] MFP, and she vows to make every one of her repayments on schedule, because she wants to make use of more such help subsequently. With the loan she is seeking, she will buy a larger quantity of wood, because she has a great deal of demand for furniture at present.

loans.use: To buy more wood

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
NidA. is a 31-year-old single man from Baalbeck. He has been the owner of a hardware, painting and electricA. tools store since 2005, with 16 years of experience in this field. NidA. is improving his work day after day. This business is important in his region, since construction takes a good part in his society. 

NidA. is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to buy necessary tools for his business, since most of his capitA. he used for his brother’s sickness and for his mother’s funerA.. NidA. wants to expand his business more in the coming years.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene dos hijos que dependen económicamente de ella, realizó estudios de educación secundaria.

Trabaja hace ocho años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos de artesanía como chompas, la cual entrega para exportar.

Solicitará un  nuevo crédito por la suma  de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará maquinas para tejer, herramientas auxiliares y lanas, lo trabaja sola.

Su sueño es ser proveedora a exportar.

Le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, la solidaridad y el compromiso.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the “12 de Agosto” Communal Bank in the Puno district,  province and department. She is 30 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has two children who financially depend on her, she has had high school education.

She has worked for eight years with the Manuela Ramos Movement, her first loan was for  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, money that she invested in her business of selling craftwork such as sweaters, which she delivers for export.

She will request a new loan for the sum of S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, she will buy machinery for weaving, auxilliary tools and wool, she works alone.

Her dream is to be an export provider.

She likes her Communal Bank for the loan facility, the solidarity and the commitment.

loans.use: To buy machinery for weaving, tools and wool to make sweaters

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco A. created Ventura Designs and Media to cater to the needs of senior citizens.  His publication, the Gold Pages - Paginas Doradas, was first published in 2002.  Seniors now seek out his publication to find out about services that are available for them.  The Gold Pages Directory is available in three Texas communities: El Paso, Midland/Odessa, and San Antonio.  

Francisco saw a huge void in the availability and accessibility of resources for seniors.  He approached the Area Agency on Aging of the Rio Grande Council of Governments to speak with them about his idea for a publication specifically for senior citizens.  He wanted to work with this agency to build his publication.  After securing this sponsorship, Ventura sought additional sponsors and advertisers from public, private, governmental, and nonprofit agencies interested in appealing to senior citizens.  

With the demographic shift to an older America, Francisco’s hope is to continue to be the leader in providing the information and resources needed for older citizens to lead an active, productive, and engaged life.  Ventura is using the loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana to expand and enhance its presence on the web.  Francisco’s first loan with ACCION allowed Ventura to build the initial format for the website.  

Frank describes himself as a dreamer.  He believes a person can provide a service to the community and positively impact the economics of the community while making a difference.  Francisco’s advice to other business owners involves three things: pick something you enjoy doing, pick something you are good at doing, and make sure you research and establish yourself.  

To learn more about his business, visit the website at www.txgoldpages.com.  

To learn about Ventura’s print services, visit www.venturaprinstore.com.

loans.use: To expand and enhance the website

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
Este comité esta conformado de 17 señoras dispuestas a progresar  decidierón a participar del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,  mujeres humildes y muy trabajadoras, formando asi un equipo de trabajo donde la responsabilidad es solidaria. 
Una de la integrantes es la señora Ada quien se dedica a  la venta de perfumes sobre pedido.
Ella cuenta con catalógos para ofrecer sus productos de diferentes marcas a sus clientes.
 Ella es una señora muy trabajadora que sale todas las tardes de su casa para ofrecer sus perfumes y asi reunir los pedidos.
Ella solicita el prestamo para la compra de perfumes de los que ya recibio pedidos.
texts.en:
This committee is made up of 17 women determined to progress, they decided to partipate in the "Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Enterprising Women's Committee),  modest women and very hardworking, so forming a work team where the responsibility is solidarity. 
One of the members is Ada who sells perfumes on order.
She has catalogues to offer her products from different brands to her customers.
 She is a very hard working woman who goes out every afternoon from her home to offer her perfumes and collect her orders.
She is asking for the loan to buy the perfumes for the orders she has received.

loans.use: To buy perfumes of different fragrances.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Less than a year ago, Antonia was listening to the radio and heard mention of Opportunity Fund, a local micro lender. The owner of a small clothing business, Antonia called that very afternoon to ask for information on Small Business loans.

Originally from Mexico City, Antonia moved to the San Francisco Bay Area seven years ago with her husband and children. In her free time, she began selling clothing to friends who said she had an uncanny ability to find the best deals. They encouraged her to begin her own business, which she now manages on weekends and evenings while still holding down a separate full-time job. 

By making monthly trips to Los Angeles, Antonia is able to acquire cheap, fashionable clothing that she sells to friends and at local markets. Antonia’s first loan from Opportunity Fund helped her to increase her inventory and consequently earn greater profits. Now, with the holidays quickly approaching, a second $3,000 loan is helping her stay fully stocked with merchandise during the busiest shopping season of the year. 

Antonia described the process of taking out a loan as quick, simple and easy. “Everything went smoothly with Opportunity Fund and I am thankful that I now have the opportunity to raise my sales.”

While she admits that having her own business can be difficult, she says she is “never afraid of a good challenge.” Antonia is proud of how far she has come as a businesswoman and that she has the opportunity to help support her family.

loans.use: To boost her inventory

loans.name: Eliana Yaneth

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIA: Eliana Yaneth Q. Sánchez

En un reducido espacio de tan solo 2 habitaciones, una pequeña cocina y un baño, habita Eliana Yaneth Q. Sánchez con sus padres, su esposo y sus dos hijos.  

En este lugar también está ubicado el taller de confección que desde hace 7 años se ha convertido en la fuente del sustento familiar y en el que trabaja de la mano de su padre que es discapacitado y una hermana. Su jornada de trabajo inicia a las 6:00 a.m. y se extiende hasta altas horas de la noche puesto que en la medida en que más trabajen, mejor será su calidad de vida.

Su mayor dificultad ha sido lo reducido del espacio en el que viven y trabajan, por esto requiere un crédito que le permita comprar más insumos para laborar y de esta manera tener más capacidad de producción que le permita generar mayores ingresos, con los cuales podrá mejor las condiciones en que habitan puesto que su más preciado sueño es poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y que su microempresa pueda estar en un lugar diferente al de su hogar.
texts.en:
Small businesswoman:  Eliana Yaneth Q. Sánchez

Eliana Yaneth Q. Sánchez lives with her parents, her husband, and their two children in a small space.  It only has two bedrooms, a small kitchen, and a bathroom.  

Her seamstress shop is also at this location. Her shop became the source of family support seven years ago.  She works with her father, who is disabled, and a sister.  Her work day starts at 6:00 a.m. and goes into the late hours of the night.  However, the more she works the better her quality of life will be.

Her biggest difficulty is the small space where they live and work.  That is why she needs a loan that will allow her to buy more supplies for work.  This way she will have a greater production capacity, which will allow her to generate greater income.  With this income she will be able to improve their living conditions.

Her most valued dream is to be able to give her family a better quality of live and that her small business is able to be in a location other than her home.

loans.use: Buy supplies and catalogues

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita tiene 64 años, es una madre de familia, amable y emprendedora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. El trabajo a la que se dedica Felicita, es el bordado y chompas de algodón para niños y niñas, prendas que tienen mucha demanda y más en temporada de verano. Por otro lado es apreciado en el extranjero, por ello debe aumentar la producción de esta mercadería, procura siempre en crear nuevos diseños, eso garantiza el aumento de sus ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizarlo desde la comodidad de su casa, sin descuidar a su familia. Por ahora su prioridad es dejar de trabajar como intermediario y ella misma vender su mercadería a las propias empresas extranjera. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, por que tranquilamente acceda a posteriores préstamos. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará diversidad de hilos y demás accesorios para continuar realizando su trabajo.
texts.en: Felicita is 64 years old, a mother, kind and enterprising, she lives in her own home, with her husband and their 2 children. The work that Felicita does, is embroidery and making cotton sweaters for boys and girls, garments that are in demand and more so in summer. On the other hand it is valued abroad, and for this reason she must increase production of this merchandise, she always tries to create new designs, this guarantees an increase in profits. What she likes most about her work is that she can do it from the comfort of her home, without neglecting her family. For now her priority is to stop working as an intermediary and sell her merchandise herself to the foreign companies. It is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to make all her payments on time, because she wants to have access to future loans. With this loan, she will buy a variety of threads and other accessories to keep doing her work.

loans.use: To buy thread and other accessories to make garments.

loans.name: Olga Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Olga Victoria; ella tiene 74 años de edad y es viuda; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de abogada, ella por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su familia, la socia quiere seguir mejorando en su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para el uso personal de su familia.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “BUENA ESPERANZA” (Good Hope) Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member's name is Olga Victoria; she is 74 years old and a widow; The member alternates her daily activities with working as a lawyer, through this work she has helped get her family ahead, the member wants to keep improving in her work. The member is asking for the loan for the personal use of her family.

The member is happy for the loan and promises to complete payment of all her installments.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan for the personal use of her family.

loans.name: Saul Alejandro

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIO: Saúl Alejandro D. O.


Desde muy niño, a partir de los 7 años, Saúl Alejandro D. O. ha sabido lo que es ganarse la vida gracias al trabajo. Fue criado por su abuela debido a que sus padres lo abandonaron cuando era muy pequeño, situación que le impidió estudiar, puesto que el trabajo era su prioridad para poder tener el sustento diario para su familia.

Desde hace 12 años, Saúl trabaja en el Sector de la Plaza  Minorista de Medellín vendiendo jugos, principalmente a los conductores del sector quienes reconocen la calidad de su producto. Para poder diversificar sus productos y para que su negocio pueda incrementar sus ventas, Saúl necesita un crédito que apoyará el mejoramiento de su negocio y que, por tanto, incidirá positivamente en su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Saúl es tener su casa propia y a través del crédito, que propiciará el crecimiento de su negocio, está convencido de que pronto lo podrá hacer realidad.
texts.en:
Small businessman:  Saúl Alejandro D. O.

Ever since he was seven years old Saúl Alejandro D. O. has known what is is to earn a living by working.  He was raised by his grandmother because his parents abandoned him when he was very little.  This situation kept him from getting an education. Work was his priority so that the family was able to have their daily bread. 

Saúl has been working twelve years selling juice in the Medellín Plaza Minorista sector.  He mainly sells to the drivers in the sector who recognize the quality of his product.  He is requesting a loan to be able to diversify his products so that he will be able to increase the sales in his business.

Saúl needs the loan to support the improvement to his business, which will positively influence his quality of life.

Saúl’s dream is to have his own house.  He is convinced that through the loan, which will increase his business, he will soon be able to make his dream come true.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Sandra Nora

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años, de estado civil soltera, tiene estudios de educación superior incompleta.

Trabaja desde hace tres años con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en lanas para la fabricación de tejidos, ahora trabaja con artefactos y juguetes.

Solicitará un  nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 1300.00 nuevos soles, invertirá en juguetes para navidad, la señora no tiene un puesto seguro la cual será repartida a otros, le ayuda su padre.

Su sueño es tener su propio puesto de venta.

Le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the "12 de Agosto" community bank which is located in Puno district, in the province and department of the same name.  She is 32 years old, single and did not complete her higher education.

Sandra has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles.  She invested that money in buying wool for weaving.  She now works with crafts and toys.

Sandra is requesting a new loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles which she will invest in buying Christmas toys.  She does not have a stable sales location.  Her father helps her in her business.  Her dream is to have her own sales location.  What Sandra likes about her community bank is the convenience of the loans.

loans.use: To buy Christmas toys

loans.name: Angela De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIA: Ángela D. las Mercedes M. D. Berrío

Ángela D. las Mercedes M. D. Berrío lleva varios años sentada  al lado del Hospital San Vicente D. Paúl ubicado en Caldas, Antioquia, con un cajón D. madera vendiendo mecato, confites, cigarrillos y minutos D. celular; labor que se ha convertido en su mayor bendición puesto que esta actividad le ha permitido obtener el sustento diario para ella y su hijo.

DesD. hace varios años las ventas se han incrementado, por esto Ángela necesita un crédito para poder comprar más insumos para su negocio y acceder a nuevos productos, que le permitan satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes.

Al crecer su negocio, su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia, mejorará notablemente y D. esta forma también podrá cumplir el sueño D. darle empleo a otra persona y proporcionarle un puesto D. trabajo en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Small Businesswoman:  Ángela D. las Mercedes M. D. Berrío

Ángela D. las Mercedes M. D. Berrío has been sitting on the siD. of the San Vicente D. Paúl Hospital in Caldas, Antioquia for several years.  She sits on a wood box, and she sells packed lunches, sweets, cigarettes, and cell phone minutes.  This work has become her greatest blessing given that it has allowed her to earn a daily living for herself and for her son.

Sales have increased during the past several years.  Ángela needs a loan to be able to buy more supplies for her business and to access new products.  This will allow her to meet the needs of her customers.

As her business grows her quality of life and that of her family improves considerably.  This way she will also be able to fulfill her dream of giving work to another person and adding a stand for work in another location.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Wasim

texts.en: Wasim is a 32-year-old married man, who is the father of three children. Wasim has owned a pharmacy in Baalbeck since 2005. He’s requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his capital. His clients are all kinds of people of different levels, cultures, and religions, because such a business is for everyone in need. Wasim is well known, and his special customer service distinguishes him among his competitors. Wasim hopes to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: To increase his capital.

loans.name: John Henry

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIO: John Henry G. G.

John Henry G. G. desde hace 4 años trabaja en una Cooperativa de Carnes en la que se desempeña como sacrificador de animales; esta labor la realiza en una jornada que va desde las  6:00 p.m. hasta las 4:00 a.m.

Sin embargo, su sueño es trabajar de manera independiente para poder ser el propietario de su propio negocio y tener la posibilidad de compartir más tiempo con su familia.
John Henry anhela iniciar el cultivo de hortalizas, granos y la cría de cerdos, puesto que esta labor la aprendió desde sus 10 años por una tradición familiar.

Para cumplir este sueño, John Henry requiere un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de abono e insumos agrícolas para no solo mantener un cultivo de arbejas que ya tiene, sino iniciar un cultivo de hortensias; estos insumos son fundamentales para que los cultivos se puedan sostener y el invierno que golpea al país no afecte la producción.

De esta manera, John Henry podrá mantener seguro el sustento de su esposa y sus 4 hijos y, además, podrá iniciar de manera positiva su desarrollo como empresario.
texts.en:
Small Businessman:  John Henry G. G.

John Henry G. G. has worked in a “Cooperativa de Carnes” (Meat Cooperative) for four years.  He slaughters animals.  His work schedule starts at 6:00 p.m. and ends at 4:00 a.m.  

His dream is to work independently in order to be able to be the proprietor of his own business.  Then he would have the possibility of sharing more time with his family.  To fulfill the dream John Henry needs a loan to buy fertilizer and farming supplies.  These are not just to maintain the pea crop that he already has, but they are also to start growing hydrangea.

These supplies are fundamental so that the crops are sustainable.  They are also needed so that the winter that strikes the country does not affect his production.

This way John Henry will be able to keep the support of his wife and four children secure.  He will also be able to start his development as a businessman in a positive way.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies

loans.name: Yemira

texts.es:
Yemira es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 27 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene un hijo que depende económicamente de ella, realizo estudios de educación superior.

Trabaja desde hace siete años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el primer préstamo que solicitó fue S/.300.00 nuevos soles la que invirtió en su tienda de abarrotes, ahora se dedica a la venta de chanchos y quesos.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma  de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio, comprará ocho unidades de chanchos regulares y 70 kilos de quesos, es ayudada por su hermana en el negocio y su esposo tiene otro empleo.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia, tener un carro para pasear y tener ahorros para su hijo.

Le gusta del Banco Comunal es la solidaridad, la puntualidad y el préstamo de la cuenta interna.
texts.en:
Yemira is a member of the "12th of August" communal bank, from the district, province and region called Puno. She is 27 years old. She lives with her partner and has a son, who depends upon her to provide for him. She completed her education to college level. 

She has been working with [the field partner] Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 7 years. The first loan she sought was for 3,000 Soles, which she invested in her grocery store. Now she dedicates her time to selling pigs and cheeses. She is seeking a loan of 1,200 Soles, money that she will invest in her business. She will buy 8 pigs and 70 kilos of cheeses. 

Her sister helps with the business and her husband has other employment. Yemira dreams of having her own house, a car to go around in, and savings for her son. What she likes about the communal bank is the solidarity, the timeliness, and being able to access a loan from the communal bank's internal account.

loans.use: To buy 8 pigs, and cheeses

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jhonatan tiene 22 años, es un joven con muchas ilusiones de progresar, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su madre y sus hermanos menores. Después de haber trabajado por muchos años en un taller de costura Jhonatan, puso su bodega hace 6 meses, instalado en el primer ambiente de su casa. La bodega  “Alva Dariano”, así es como se llama su negocio, es la más concurrida, donde todos sus vecinos recurren a su establecimiento para comprar algún producto, asimismo comparten momentos gratos con él. Es por ello, que atiende durante todo el día, siendo su madre quien le ayuda a proveer la mercadería que necesita para vender. De esa manera sus ganancias le resultan muy beneficiosas. Es así que  llevan  6 meses en esta labor, en la que le tiene tanta confianza y fe; en adelante, piensa ampliar su negocio y convertir en un mini Marquet. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y hace compromisos de pagar puntualmente  sus cuotas, para acceder a otras con mayor tranquilidad. Con el crédito que solicita,  incrementará más productos perecibles y no perecibles, para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en: Jhonatan is 22 years old. He is a young person that has dreams of success. He lives in his own house with his mother and younger brothers. After working for many years in a tailor’s workshop, six months ago Jhonatan started a small canteen in his house. The canteen, called “Alva Dariano”, which is the name of his business, is very busy. All of his neighbors stop by his house to buy certain products or to pass the time with Jhonatan. He works at this store all day. His mother helps him buy the merchandise that he sells. This is why his earnings are very helpful. After six months of work, in which he had a lot of confidence and faith, he looks forward to expanding his business by converting it into a mini-market. This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to pay his payments on time so that others will be pleased. With this loan he will buy more perishable and non-perishable products in order to stock his canteen.

loans.use: to increase the products that he sells in his business.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora, de 21 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Briceyda de 6 y Sebastian de 1 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente Aurora ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos. Sus productos los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde el choclo, arveja y durazno que cultiva, son rápidamente comprados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar y fertilizar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más campos para cultivar y ampliar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en la compra de abono e insecticidas.
texts.en: Aurora, 21, is a very kind and hard working woman, she lives in her own home with her 2 dear children Briceyda, 6, and Sebastian, 1 , for whom she wants to give a better quality of life. Working arduously Aurora has succeeded in getting ahead with her sown fields, every day she gets up very early to irrigate and provide the right care for her crops. She sells her produce at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where the corn, peas and peaches that she grows, are quickly sold. What she likes most about her work is that she can enjoy the freedom of working in her fields, she has been in this business for 2 years and considers that the most difficult thing is to have to work and fertilize the earth. In time, she hopes to be able to buy more fields to grow and increase her production. This is the first loan with MFP, she knows that this loan will help her enough in the progress and development of her business, this is why she is determined to make her payments on time, in her communal bank she is a very responsible member, motivated by what is very dear to her. The five hundred nuevos soles requested will be used to buy fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 02 hijos, en la actualidad sigue estudiando.

Trabaja desde hace 03 años con el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual incrementó a su capital, la que invirtió en su oficina de capacitación personal para mayores, tiene oficina de abogados, tiene proyectos como  Institución de seguridad vial y poner un colegio CEBA en Ilave.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en propagandas en radios, publicidad con los volantes en el distrito de Juli, Ilave, para que  la sociedad adulta participe en los servicios que les brinda.

Su visión es sacar el colegio adelante y también con el Instituto.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the “12 de Agosto” (August 12th) communal bank in Puno district, Puno province of Puno department.  She is 42, in a common law marriage, and she has 2 children who are in school.

She has worked for the last 3 years with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Her first loan was for  500 new sols.  She used it to increase her capital  for a personal training office for adults.  She has a law office and she has different projects like the Institution of Road and Traffic Safety, and to set up a CEBA school in Ilave.

She will use the new loan of 3000 new sols for radio ads, and flyers to put around the Juli, Ilave district so that the adults in the community can participate in the services that she offers.

Her goal is to help the school and the Institute develop.

What she most likes about the communal bank is the punctuality and responsibility of its members.

loans.use: To invest in advertisement on the radio, with flyers, and by other means

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto” del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años, de estado civil madre soltera, tiene un hijo que depende económicamente de ella, realizó estudios de educación primaria.

Trabaja desde hace ocho años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su  préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artículos de artesanía como chompas, también vende comidas.

Solicitará un  nuevo crédito por la suma  de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que aumentará a su capital de su negocio comprará maquinas para los tejidos, lanas, arroz, fideos, azúcar, le ayuda su hijo.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia para vivir en comodidad y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of the “12 de Agosto” (12 August) Communal Bank in the Puno district, province and department. She is 42 years old, and is a single mother, she has a son who depends financially on her, she has a elementary school education.

She has worked for eight years with the Manuela Ramos Movement, her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, money that she invested in her business selling craftwork such as sweaters, she also sells food.

She will ask for a new loan for a sum of S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, money which will increase the capital of her business and she will buy machinery for weaving, wool, rice, noodles, sugar. Her son helps her.

Her dream is to have her own home to live in comfort and that her children become professionals.

What she likes about the Communal Bank is the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: To buy machines for weaving, wool and goods for the preparation of food like rice, noodles, sugar and others.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Joselin de 15 y Víctor de 12 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Marlene ha logrado hacer de sus cultivos de lechuga, choclo, espinaca y papa, los más solicitados de su poblado, todas las mañanas sin importar las condiciones del clima, salen a trabajar sus chacras, ya que saben que de ello dependen los ingresos que obtendrán por la venta de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es primer crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en: Marlene, 38, is a very kind and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her 2 beloved children, Joselin, 15, and Victor, 12, and she wants to give them a better quality of life. Through hard work, Marlene has managed to make her crops of lettuce, corn, spinach and potatoes the most sought after in her village. Every morning, no matter the weather, they go out to work in the fields, since they know that the income they will get from the sale of their goods depends on it. What Marlene enjoys the most about her work is cultivating her lands. She has spent 5 years doing this and thinks the most difficult part is transporting her goods to the market in Tarma. Eventually, she wants to buy more lands, in order to increase production. This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes to be very punctual with her payments. She is a well-respected member of her communal bank, due to the responsibility she has shown. With the one thousand soles (PEN) requested, she will purchase more composted manure to fertilize her lands.

loans.use: Purchase composted manure to fertilize her lands.

loans.name: Aurora Lucrecia

texts.es:
Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “12 D. Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia D. Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 48 años, D. estado civil casada, tiene 05 hijos (02 dependientes),  la señora realizó estudios D. educación primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años, su préstamo inicial fue D.  S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su tienda D. abarrotes, actualmente trabaja con fotografías, locutorios y fotocopias.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito D. S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en materiales fotográficas, papel bond para trabajar en su negocio, etc.,  trabaja junto con su esposo.

Su sueño es poner un internet o un restaurant.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la unión y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Aurora is a member of the "12 D. Agosto" community bank which is located in Puno district, in the province and department of the same name.

Aurora is 48 years old, married and has five children (two of whom are still dependent).  She has an elementary school education.

Aurora has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles which she invested in her grocery store.  She currently works with photographs, telephone rental and photocopies.

Aurora is requesting a new loan for 600 Peruvian soles which she will invest in photographic materials, bond paper which she uses in her business, etc.  She works together with her husband.  Her dream is to set up an Internet café or a restaurant.  What she likes about her community bank is the unity and what she makes on her savings.

loans.use: To buy materials such as bond paper and photographic materials

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda, D. 50 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 queridas hijas, quienes son el motivo principal D. todos sus esfuerzos. La bodega D. Olinda es la primera en abrirse en su Pueblo, desD. las 6 D. la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo D. la variedad D. la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad D. que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse D. las cosas que suceden en su Pueblo, lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro D. su tienda, sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras D. su banco comunal, en donD. es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en: Olinda, age 50, is a kind and unassuming woman. She lives in her own home together with her four beloved daughters who are the main reason for all her efforts. In her town, Olinda's grocery store is the first one to open its doors in the morning, and from 6 o'clock she is ready to receive her early-bird visitors. Olinda's customers never doubt in choosing her store because they know the variety of items she offers and feel assured that they will always find the things they need. What Olinda likes best about her job is talking with her clients and finding out about what's going on in town. She has been in this business for two years and thinks that the most difficult part is to remain the whole day insiD. her store, without being able to go out. With time, she hopes to grow her store and bring a better service to her clients. This is Olinda's first loan with MFP, and she expects to be able to pay on time since she does not want to cause problems to other members in her communal bank, where she is very respected for the order she brings to the group. She will use the funds to purchase more products to improve her grocery store.

loans.use: Purchase of additional products to improve her store

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever, de 29 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Betty de 26 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Josira de 7 y Aldair de 6 meses, a quienes desea brindar una mejor vida. El trabajo al que Ever se dedica, es el cultivo de café y stevia, los cuales después de la cosecha lleva a vender a la ciudad de Pichanaki, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos ya que la ruta es muy accidentada. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras, para incrementar la cantidad que produce normalmente. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y desea ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que contagia su alegría al resto de socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para fertilizar mejor sus tierras.
texts.en:
Ever is 29 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 26 year-old Betty, and his two beloved children, 7 year-old Josira and 6 month-old Aldair, for whom he wishes to provide a better life.

Ever's business is growing coffee and stevia.  After he has harvested his crops, he takes them to sell in the city of Pichanaki which is where he obtains the best prices for his products.  What Ever most likes about his work is cultivating his land.  He has been in this business for 15 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his products since the road is very rough and rugged.

Over time, Ever hopes to be able to buy more land, to increase the quantity of crops that he produces.  This is his first loan with MFP and he would like to be very punctual in making his repayments.  He is a very well-liked member of his community bank since he infects the other members with his happiness which is contagious.  He will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy manure to better fertilize his land.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Basilia Berna

texts.es:
Basilia es socia del Banco Comunal “12 D. Agosto” del distrito Puno,  provincia D. Puno y departamento D. Puno, tiene 55 años, D. estado civil casada, tiene 02 hijos, estudio educación secundaria

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace un año, su  préstamo inicial fue D.  S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, decidió invertirlo en su negocio D. venta D. prendas D. vestir D. segundo uso, y comprará juguetes para venderlos en navidad.

Solicitara un nuevo crédito D. S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, con el que comprará juguetes para venderlos en navidad, como muñecas, carros, animalitos, etc., a la señora le ayudan sus hijos.

Desea poner una tienda D. prendas nuevas.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Basilia is a member of the "12 D. Agosto" community bank in Puno district, in the province and department of the same name.

Basilia is 55 years old, married and has 2 children.  She has a high school education.

Basilia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  Her first loan was for 500 Peruvian soles which she invested in her business selling used clothes.  She is requesting a new loan for 800 Peruvian soles with which she will buy toys to sell at Christmas such as dolls, cars, little animals, etc.  Basilia's children help her in her work.

Basilia would like to set up a store selling new clothes.  What she likes about her community bank is the convenience of the loans.

loans.use: To buy toys such as dolls, little cars, little animals, etc. to sell at Christmas

loans.name: El Renacer De Chacrasana Group

texts.es: María Teresa tiene 26 años de edad, es la tesorera de la Alcancía Comunal  “El Renacer de Chacrasana”, desde hace 4 meses. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, empezó  esta labor por invitación de una amiga, pero el día de hoy se dedica a ello con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar productos de belleza en oferta  para venderlos cuando esto cueste su precio real. María Teresa sueña con tener una bodeguita que le genere ingresos para poder darles educación superior a sus hijos y terminar con el acabado de su casa.
texts.en: María Teresa is 26 years old. Since four months ago, she has been the treasurer of the communal bank “El Renacer de Chacrasana.” Maria earns her living by selling cosmetics -- something that she started to do based on an invitation from a friend. However, currently, Maria is fully dedicated to this work because her goal is be able to help her husband in paying for household expenses. Maria has asked EDAPROSPO for a loan that she will use to purchase beauty products on sale so that she could later resell them for full price. Maria's dream is to have her own tiny store where she could earn income that would enable her to give higher education to her children and to finish building her house.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products on sale

loans.name: Benigna Jovita

texts.es:
Benigna  es socia del Banco Comunal “12 de Agosto”  del distrito Puno,  provincia de Puno y departamento de Puno, tiene 63 años, de estado civil madre abandonada, tiene 02 hijos independientes, estudio hasta 2º de educación secundaria

Trabaja desde hace 06 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, su préstamo lo invirtió en el negocio de venta de artículos artesanales, venta de prendas de vestir como chompas y gorros.

Ahora requerida de un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio, comprará lanas para su tejido y siete fardos de prendas de vestir.

Su sueño es poner un negocio más grande.

Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y las orientaciones
texts.en:
Benigna is a member of the “August 12th” Community Bank. The bank is located in the Puno District, in the Puno Province, in the department of Puno. She is 63 years old. Her marital status is single mother. She has two independent children. She has completed her second year of high school.
She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past six years. Her first loan was for 300.00 new soles. This loan she invested in her folkcraft business. She sells clothes such as sweaters and hats.
Now she would like a new loan for 500.00 new soles. This money she will invest in embroidery wool and seven packages of clothes.
Her dream is to have a larger business.
She likes the community bank as they provide her with the opportunity to have a loan and also she likes their meetings.

loans.use: She will buy wool and clothes to use to make her embroidery

loans.name: Gotita De Amor Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Gotita de Amor y se ubica en el Estado de Morelos en México. Su comunidad se distingue por su fiesta celebre que es el 30 de agosto donde llega gente de diferentes lugares a celebrar juntos al santo patrón del pueblo Santa Rosa de Lima. El grupo está conformado por once integrantes.La señora Ana Isabel es integrante del grupo, se dedica a la costura negocio que inicio hace quince años con una máquina prestada con el fin de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos. Solicita el préstamo para comprar  una máquina de coser eléctrica. Tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria. Es casada y tiene un total de cuatro hijos de: 22, 19,17 y 2 años de edad respectivamente. Sus clientes le llevan ropa a arreglar, maestros de primaria le mandan hacer pedidos  porque les gusta la manera de como los atiende y el trabajo que les realiza. La  señora Ana Isabel se siente contenta porque con este préstamo podrá comprar su maquina de coser eléctrica y poder sacar sus pedidos que ya tiene para esta temporada de invierno. Con los siguientes prestamos quiere comprar otra máquina de coser, sus planes son tener un taller de costura, y contratar gente de su misma comunidad que trabaje con ella para darles empleo y poder ayudarlas, con sus ganancias desea comprarse un terreno para sus hijos y dejarles un patrimonio a futuro.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Gotita de Amor' (Droplet of Love) and is located in the State of Morelos in Mexico.  Their community is known for the famous fiesta which takes place on August 30th, when people come from all over to celebrate the Patron Saint of the town of Santa Rosa de Lima. 

This group has 11 members.  Ana Isabel is a member of the group.  Her business is sewing.  She started her business fifteen years ago with a borrowed sewing machine as she wanted to help her husband with their children's expenses.  She is requesting this loan to buy an electric sewing machine.

Ana Isabel is 39 years old.  She studied up to the third year of her secondary education.  She is married and has four children aged: 22, 19, 17 and 2.  Her customers bring clothes to her to mend.  Elementary school teachers send her orders because they like her service and the work she does.  She feels happy because this loan will allow her to buy her electric sewing machine and fill the orders that she already has for this winter season.

Ana Isabel would like to use subsequent loans to buy another sewing machine.  Her plans are to own her own sewing workshop and to hire people from her own community to work with her so that she can give them work and help them.  She would like to use her profits to buy a plot of land for her children that she can leave them as an inheritance in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: 4- Tan Son 1 -  Nam Ngan Group

texts.en: Lien N. T. (14) is a 49-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Lien is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 4 - Tan Som 1 - Nam Ngan (02.10.1.4 Nam Ngan). Lien is married and has three adult -aged children. To make a living, Lien makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Lien has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2.000.000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from these activities. In 2010, Lien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lien is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women of 5.787.900 VND, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. T. T. Ha (15) is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 5.787.900 VND loan to support her manufacturing business. 2. T. T. Sam (16) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 5.787.900 VND loan to support her business of selling home products. 3. N. T. H. Ha (17) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5.787.900 VND loan to support her clothing business. 4. H. T. Huong (18) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 5.787.900 VND loan to support her food stall. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Lien N. T. (14) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Lien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 4 Tan Son 1- Nam Ngan (02.10.1.4 Nam Ngan). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thực phẩm chiên trong cộng đồng địa phương. Lien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Lien kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2010, Lien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Lien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. T. T. Ha (15) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. 2. T. T. Sam (16) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán hàng gia dụng. 3. N. T. H. Ha (17) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo. 4. H. T. Huong (18) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.787.900 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng C., 34, sells groceries, earning an income of USD 2 per day. C. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 11 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. C. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas T., 54, sells Cambodian noodles and fermented fish, earning an income of USD 2 per day. T. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. The family has to spend USD 18 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 30 on other necessary expenses every month. T. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more supplements to sell food to expand her current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more supplements to sell food

loans.name: Gerelt-Od

texts.en: Gerelt-Od T. is a young man. He works as a plumber for the Gonchig Soum company since graduating from Ulaangom college, majoring in plumbing in 2010. His work is seasonal, therefore he plans to operate a taxi service in his town during summer months. He has purchased a car, through a 3,500,000 MNT loan, that will be used as a taxi. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to pay off the car loan. For the future, he hopes to have his own plot of land and fence.

loans.use: To pay off the car's loan

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar T. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a house and fence. His son, age 7, attends a local primary school, while Otgonbayar and his wife operate a clothing retail business out of two different sales locations. He began his business in 2006 with working capital of 1,500,000 MNT, which was spent to purchase a shipping container at the local market where he sells his products. After years of operation, he was able to expand his business by purchasing a stall at the local trade center, which is managed by his wife to sell a variety of clothing items. Today, he is responsible for managing his shipping container while his wife takes care of operations for another stall at the trade center. For the future, Otgonbayar plans to develop his business and increase his product line to include fur and leather clothes. Their earnings have enabled them to build a house in their own yard. 

Otgonbayar is a modest and shy man and is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase and import more clothing products from Erlian, a border city of China, to sell at his two different places for the upcoming New Year holiday.

loans.use: To purchase and import more clothing products

loans.name: 11.04.23 Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Lien H. T. is a 31 year-old female living in the town of Thieu Hoa. Lien is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 23 (45234).


Lien is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Lien operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Lien has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Lien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lien is requesting a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 5,787,900 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  H. T. lien is a 31 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  T. T. dan is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  T. T. hue is a 50 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  N. T. long is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 23 (45234).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Lien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lien kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Lien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lien đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.787.900 VND.

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
María Margarita es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Pomape del distrito de Monsefú. Una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, específicamente de ovejas y aves de corral. Ella cría a sus animales en algunos ambientes situados en su domicilio, cuando ya ha desarrollado lo suficiente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

María ya había tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva anteriormente, en aquella oportunidad aprovechó el dinero para adquirir más ovejas, las cuales engordó y vendió, actualmente su demanda ha aumentado y ello la pone muy contenta. Actualmente desea adquirir más ovejas para satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

María se encuentra muy agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con su negocio a través del fondo Kiva. Ella nos comenta que el préstamo le ha brindado fuerzas para seguir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
Marîa Margarita is the mother of a family. She is 26 years old and lives with her husband and her three children in Pomape, in the Monsefu District. This area is located twenty minutes from Chiclayo. For the past six years she has been raising and selling small animals, specifically sheep and domesticated birds. She raises these animals in an area near her home. When they have grown up sufficiently, she sells them to buyers in her area. This business helps her husband with the economic support of their family.
Marîa has had a loan previously with KIVA. She used the last loan to buy sheep, which she fattened and sold. She had a greater demand for this product and that made her happy. She would like to buy more sheep to satisfy her customer’s needs. This is why she has come to Edpyme Alternativa to ask for a loan of 1000 new soles, which she will use to meet her business objectives.
Marîa is very thankful for the people that help her through KIVA. This loan gives her the opportunity to move forward and progress.

loans.use: She will buy more sheep in order to meet her customer's demands.

loans.name: Jorge Manuel

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Valle Hermoso del distrito de Monsefú, una zona agrícola de pobladores bastante humildes que se encuentra situada aproximadamente a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis años a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, por un lado posee una pequeña parcela de cultivo en donde ha instalado alfalfa, la cual vende a los pobladores del vecino distrito de Monsefú y, adicionalmente, cría animales menores y ovejas, los cuales también los vende al público en general una vez que estos se ha desarrollado completamente. Estas actividades le sirven para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante y progresar.

Jorge desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de alfalfa, asimismo desea invertir en la alimentación de sus animales, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles el cual piensa invertir en la compra de abonos para su cultivo y alimento balanceado para sus animales.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 34 year old father who lives with his wife and 3 children in the village of Valle Hermoso, Mansefú district, an agricultural region of humble villages found about half an hour from Chiclayo. 

For the past 6 years he has worked in agricultural labor.  He has a small plot of land where he has planted alfalfa, which he sells in the villages of the neighboring Monsefú district.  He also raises small animals and sheep, which he also sells to the general public once they are completely grown.  These activities help him and his family to get ahead and make progress.  

Jorge wants to care for his alfalfa crop and invest in the feed for his animals.  For this purpose he has requested a loan of 1000 new sols from Edpyma Alternativa, which he plans to use to purchase fertilizer for his crops and balanced feed for is animals.

loans.use: To care for his alfalfa crop.

loans.name: 24 Thieu Ngoc Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Trang N. T. (11) is a 48-year-old female living in the town of Thieu Ngoc Thieu Hoa Thanh Hoa.  Trang is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 24 (01.11.24).


Trang is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, Trang operates a family member's business raising cattle for sale.  Trang has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Trang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Trang is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is requesting a new loan of 5,787,900 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  The loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Trang from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Trang plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
